title: The Bread That Smiles Back
location: Market Ward -> Petra's Golden Crust Bakery
description: Three customers at Petra's bakery have been found weeping uncontrollably after eating her honey loaves. Petra begs someone to investigate before word spreads.

turns.narrative: You arrive at Petra's flour-dusted shop. A man named Donal still weeps softly, hours after eating. The bread looks golden and normal, but Donal has not stopped crying since the first bite.
turns.choice_a: Taste a small piece yourself
turns.consequence_a: A profound bittersweet sadness washes over you, fading after thirty minutes.
turns.choice_b: Examine the loaf without eating it
turns.consequence_b: You notice faint blue-grey striations through the crumb interior that shouldn't exist in normal bread.

turns.narrative: The effect traces back to 'Blue Fen Honey' Petra purchased from a new supplier named Lucius — a merchant who appeared at the gate last week selling honey at half price.
turns.choice_a: Confront Lucius directly
turns.consequence_a: Lucius admits the honey was harvested near a Void-seep in the Southern Fen — he didn't know it was dangerous.
turns.choice_b: Examine the honey jar for his stamp before confronting him
turns.consequence_b: You find a fox stamp in the wax seal. Armed with proof, Lucius pays damages voluntarily.

turns.narrative: With Lucius identified and tainted honey removed, you help Petra document Lucius's supply route for the Ward Warden.
turns.choice_a: File a formal report with the Ward Warden
turns.consequence_a: Lucius is fined and the Fen marked as a contaminated zone.
turns.choice_b: Let Lucius go with a stern warning
turns.consequence_b: Lucius leaves the city and switches to legitimate dry goods.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Lucius fined, Fen route closed.

title: A Recipe for Anger
description: Petra is baking normally again, but her Sourdough causes customers to erupt in violent arguments. A fistfight broke out. Petra suspects rival baker Gorm of sabotage.

turns.narrative: Two customers are screaming at each other. The moment they stop eating the darker-shaded bread they look confused and embarrassed. The sourdough is a strange deep reddish colour.
turns.choice_a: Calm the customers and assess the scene
turns.consequence_a: They apologise profusely once separated. The darker slice has a metallic smell.
turns.choice_b: Grab the darker bread as evidence immediately
turns.consequence_b: You secure the unusual loaf. It has a faint mineral odour unlike any sourdough you've smelled.

turns.narrative: Boot tracks behind the bakery lead toward Gorm's Bread House. Petra's sourdough starter has red fungal powder in it — Rage-Spore mushrooms.
turns.choice_a: Spy on Gorm's shop to catch him in the act
turns.consequence_a: You observe Gorm mixing red powder into a pouch. He notices you and tries to bolt.
turns.choice_b: Confront Gorm with the boot tracks as evidence
turns.consequence_b: Gorm confesses to buying Rage-Spore mushrooms from a travelling apothecary, not knowing they caused violence.

turns.narrative: Gorm is remorseful. He had been losing customers for months and panicked.
turns.choice_a: Demand Gorm pay Petra three weeks of lost earnings
turns.consequence_a: Gorm pays. Relations remain cold but legally resolved.
turns.choice_b: Propose Gorm and Petra partner on a joint stall
turns.consequence_b: After coaxing, both agree. A combined stall opens to unexpected success.

gorm_partnered.description: Gorm and Petra opened a joint stall.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Gorm compensated Petra financially.

title: The Laughing Loaf
description: Customers eating morning rolls from Gorm's bakery spend an entire afternoon laughing uncontrollably. Inspector Hewen wants the bakery closed. Alchemist Rynn suspects Mirthbloom spores from an Undercity vent.

turns.narrative: A giggling crowd surrounds the bakery. Inspector Hewen arrives to shut it down. None of the customers appear harmed — they are simply laughing at their own shoes.
turns.choice_a: Defend Gorm and buy time to investigate
turns.consequence_a: Hewen gives you three hours before issuing a closure notice.
turns.choice_b: Side with the Inspector and ask Gorm to close voluntarily
turns.consequence_b: Gorm cooperates. Hewen shares city health records of similar incidents.

turns.narrative: Alchemist Rynn identifies Mirthbloom pollen — airborne spores from purple flowers that only bloom near Undercity vents. Gorm's ovens must be venting through a bloom pocket.
turns.choice_a: Investigate the oven vents below the bakery immediately
turns.consequence_a: In the cellar a crack in the stone leads to a purple Mirthbloom pocket puffing spores with every heat cycle.
turns.choice_b: Ask Rynn to synthesise a neutraliser before going below
turns.consequence_b: Rynn mixes vinegar-ash paste. You don't succumb to laughter when you go below.

turns.narrative: The Mirthbloom pocket can be sealed or harvested — the flowers have genuine alchemical value.
turns.choice_a: Seal the crack with mortar
turns.consequence_a: Problem solved. Gorm is cleared.
turns.choice_b: Harvest the blooms for Rynn and then seal the crack
turns.consequence_b: You retrieve six full blooms. Rynn pays you generously.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Vent sealed, incidents ended.

title: The Flour Wars
description: Rival millers Hask and Doreth have been sabotaging each other's deliveries. A third bakery received flour mixed with plaster dust. You are asked to mediate.

turns.narrative: Baker Yena shows you the ruined plaster-flour. She nearly lost two teeth. Both Hask and Doreth deny responsibility with equal ferocity.
turns.choice_a: Examine each miller's operation separately
turns.consequence_a: At Hask's mill you find a recently emptied plaster bucket. At Doreth's you find mud matching Hask's storage path.
turns.choice_b: Arrange a sit-down and read the room
turns.consequence_b: Doreth's body language reveals guilt — pressed, he admits paying a courier to switch Hask's labels.

turns.narrative: Doreth is identified as the saboteur but claims Hask started it by bribing his workers.
turns.choice_a: Verify Hask's bribery claim before ruling
turns.consequence_a: One of Doreth's workers confirms the bribery, making both men share responsibility.
turns.choice_b: Rule against Doreth alone and demand restitution to Yena
turns.consequence_b: Doreth seethes but pays Yena for ruined flour and her damaged tooth.

turns.narrative: You propose a permanent resolution to end the Flour Wars.
turns.choice_a: Have both millers sign a non-sabotage contract before the Ward Warden
turns.consequence_a: The Warden witnesses the agreement.
turns.choice_b: Negotiate supply territories — Hask takes north, Doreth south
turns.consequence_b: Yena finally gets reliable flour from both.

contract_signed.description: Both millers signed a formal agreement.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Both millers signed a formal agreement.

title: Phantom Loaves
location: Market Ward -> The Charity Bread Queue
description: The charity bread program is being gamed. Merchant Prell uses proxy children to collect dozens of loaves and resells them at inflated prices. Sister Adda is heartbroken and asks you to stop it.

turns.narrative: Sister Adda runs out by the seventh family. You observe a heavyset man in a trader's cloak collecting loaves from multiple children standing in as proxies.
turns.choice_a: Tail the man discreetly
turns.consequence_a: He resells loaves three blocks away for eight times their value to desperate Lower Ward families.
turns.choice_b: Confront him in the queue directly
turns.consequence_b: He denies it loudly then attempts to bribe you with a silver coin.

turns.narrative: Prell uses hungry children as proxies, paying them one copper each. They are participating willingly but are genuinely hungry themselves.
turns.choice_a: Report Prell to the Ward Warden
turns.consequence_a: Prell is fined and banned from the charity queue permanently.
turns.choice_b: Offer the proxy children legitimate work so they stop working for Prell
turns.consequence_b: Adda employs them as distribution helpers. Prell loses his network.

turns.narrative: With Prell neutralised, Sister Adda wants safeguards to prevent recurrence.
turns.choice_a: Design a queue token system — one stamped token per family per day
turns.consequence_a: Adda implements tokens immediately.
turns.choice_b: Recommend a household registration list
turns.consequence_b: Adda compiles the list over a week. It becomes the Ward standard.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Prell fined and queue protected.

title: The Yeast Thief
location: Market Ward -> The Culinary College Cellar
description: The Culinary College's century-old sourdough starter has been stolen from the locked vault. Head Chef Voss demands it returned before morning lecture. A dropped ID badge points to groundskeeper Morren, who sold it to fence merchant Brinn.

turns.narrative: The vault door is intact — someone used a key. The re-applied wax seal drips the wrong way. A dropped College ID badge near the door belongs to groundskeeper Morren, not the suspected student.
turns.choice_a: Track down Morren immediately
turns.consequence_a: You find Morren at a canal-side tavern, nervous and evasive.
turns.choice_b: Inspect the vault interior for further evidence
turns.consequence_b: Wide-axle wagon wheel grooves in the floor don't match standard delivery carts.

turns.narrative: Morren confesses to selling the starter to fence Brinn, who acquires culinary novelties for wealthy collectors.
turns.choice_a: Approach Brinn diplomatically — offer to buy the crock back
turns.consequence_a: Brinn returns it for 200 gold to avoid legal trouble.
turns.choice_b: Threaten to report Brinn to the Trade Authority
turns.consequence_b: Brinn returns the crock for free rather than face criminal charges, but is furious.

turns.narrative: The crock is retrieved and Morren is exposed. Voss must decide Morren's fate.
turns.choice_a: Recommend Voss press formal charges
turns.consequence_a: Morren is given community service and a fine.
turns.choice_b: Recommend Voss handle it privately to avoid scandal
turns.consequence_b: Morren is dismissed quietly with a small severance.

morren_dismissed.description: Morren let go quietly. Starter restored.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Morren formally charged. Starter restored.

title: No Bread, No Peace
location: Lower Ward -> The Bread Riot Square
description: A three-day grain shipment delay has emptied Lower Ward shelves. A crowd gathers threatening to storm the Market Ward depot. A corrupt Ward official is deliberately withholding grain to resell it. You must defuse the situation.

turns.narrative: About sixty people stand in the square, many with hollow-cheeked children. Ex-dockworker Torben speaks eloquently about injustice. Three nervous guards stand at the depot entrance.
turns.choice_a: Approach Torben respectfully and speak privately
turns.consequence_a: Torben is surprised by the respectful tone. He is genuinely passionate, not a criminal, and agrees to wait while you investigate.
turns.choice_b: Address the whole crowd openly
turns.consequence_b: You acknowledge their hunger publicly and promise to investigate. This earns the crowd's conditional trust.

turns.narrative: You discover Depot Manager Caris is deliberately holding grain shipments on instructions from a corrupt Ward official who plans to resell it at premium prices.
turns.choice_a: Expose Caris publicly in the square
turns.consequence_a: The crowd's rage shifts from general anger to focused outrage at a specific corrupt official.
turns.choice_b: Secure written evidence and report to Ward Representative Elsin
turns.consequence_b: Elsin is appalled. She orders the depot opened immediately and the official suspended.

turns.narrative: The grain is released. You help Torben channel his energy productively.
turns.choice_a: Recommend Torben be appointed a community grain monitor
turns.consequence_a: Torben accepts. He prevents two future shortages over the next month.
turns.choice_b: Simply thank Torben and let events take their course
turns.consequence_b: Torben is satisfied justice was done and disperses the crowd peacefully.

torben_appointed.description: Torben given a formal community role.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Torben given a formal community role.

title: Strange Spice
description: A new vendor is selling 'Deeproot Spice' cheaply. Bakers using it find their bread develops luminescent veining. Ward Chemist Polla suspects Void traces and wants a sample before the spice spreads further through the Ward.

turns.narrative: Vendor Issra found the spice growing near the Crater Ridge Glass Shelf. The spice smells wonderful — like cardamom mixed with something electrical. She clearly isn't hiding anything.
turns.choice_a: Purchase a sample to bring to Polla immediately
turns.consequence_a: Polla identifies Void-adjacent mineral traces — not immediately dangerous in small quantities but cumulative exposure could be.
turns.choice_b: Ask Issra exactly where she found it
turns.consequence_b: Issra pinpoints the Glass Shelf quadrant — an area exposed by the original Scourge breach.

turns.narrative: Polla confirms the spice has Void-crystalline resin baked into its cells — potentially hallucinogenic after weeks of daily bread consumption. Issra is horrified.
turns.choice_a: Help Issra voluntarily recall all sold product
turns.consequence_a: Issra cooperates fully. Most buyers return the spice when warned.
turns.choice_b: Report to the Ward Authority for an official recall
turns.consequence_b: The Authority issues a public notice. More comprehensive but slower. Several bakers are annoyed.

turns.narrative: The recall is complete. Now you must advise on the Glass Shelf source.
turns.choice_a: Recommend it be marked a restricted foraging zone
turns.consequence_a: The Shelf is flagged on expedition maps for future foragers.
turns.choice_b: Recommend Polla's team study it for safe alchemical applications
turns.consequence_b: The safe component of Deeproot Spice becomes a mildly valuable alchemical reagent.

spice_studied.description: Deeproot Spice safely isolated by alchemists.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Glass Shelf marked restricted.

title: The Empty Granary
description: The Northern Granary supplying twelve bakeries shows dramatically lower stock. Grain Inspector Horta suspects organised theft. A midnight wagon and a nervous bin-keeper named Fen point to a Market Ward merchant cornering the flour supply.

turns.narrative: Bin Two's seal was re-applied sloppily — wax drips the wrong way. Horta points this out with grim satisfaction. Either someone panicked or was working quickly in the dark.
turns.choice_a: Question all granary workers about the seal discrepancy
turns.consequence_a: Bin-keeper Fen becomes uncomfortable and admits he saw a wagon arrive at night, not on the schedule.
turns.choice_b: Examine the bin's interior for physical evidence
turns.consequence_b: Wide-axle wagon wheel grooves in the floor don't match standard narrow delivery carts.

turns.narrative: The off-schedule wagon is traced to driver Cott, who has been making paid midnight runs for a merchant consolidating grain to corner the flour market.
turns.choice_a: Follow the grain trail to the merchant immediately
turns.consequence_a: The merchant's warehouse is packed with unsold grain. You have enough evidence to act.
turns.choice_b: Use Cott as an informant under promise of leniency
turns.consequence_b: Cott agrees and identifies three additional warehouse locations.

turns.narrative: With evidence gathered you move to end the smuggling operation.
turns.choice_a: Report the full network to Horta and Ward Authority
turns.consequence_a: All grain is seized and returned. The merchant is arrested.
turns.choice_b: Give Cott time to flee before reporting, honouring your promise
turns.consequence_b: Cott disappears. The merchant is arrested alone. Horta approves.

cott_spared.description: Cott was allowed to flee. Case still resolved.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Smuggling merchant arrested, grain returned.

title: The Secret Ingredient
location: Market Ward -> The Culinary College Hall
description: The annual Bread Competition is rocked by scandal: the winning loaf has an unidentifiable ingredient causing judges to grin uncontrollably. Runner-up baker Oswin alleges winner Petra used illegal alchemy. The prize is 500 gold and the title of City Baker.

turns.narrative: The winning loaf sits on a velvet cushion — golden and perfect but with an iridescent sheen along its crust. Judge Sella has eaten three slices and cannot stop grinning.
turns.choice_a: Taste a small piece and assess the effect
turns.consequence_a: An extraordinary wave of contentment settles over you — deep and pleasant but clearly unnatural. You feel no desire to argue with anyone.
turns.choice_b: Examine the bread under alchemical light
turns.consequence_b: Small crystalline particles are visible in the crumb — too fine for flour, too regular for impurity.

turns.narrative: Petra admits she accidentally used ancestral 'old honey' from her grandmother — a very diluted Mirthbloom extract her family has used for three generations as a secret spice. She had no idea it was alchemically active.
turns.choice_a: Recommend Sella disqualify Petra
turns.consequence_a: Petra is disqualified despite innocence. Oswin wins by default but feels hollow.
turns.choice_b: Recommend Sella declare a tie since the ingredient was used in innocent good faith
turns.consequence_b: Sella agrees. Both share the title and split the prize. Both are grudgingly satisfied.

turns.narrative: The ancestral honey tin is now a matter of record and public interest.
turns.choice_a: Ensure the honey tin is documented with the City Alchemists
turns.consequence_a: It is properly categorised — mildly regulated but not banned.
turns.choice_b: Suggest Petra keep the tin private and stop using it in competition
turns.consequence_b: Petra agrees. The tin stays in her family. The Ward is none the wiser.

honey_private.description: Honey kept private. No formal registration.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Ancestral honey formally registered.

title: The Midnight Cellar
location: Market Ward -> The Velvet Flagon Tavern
description: The Velvet Flagon Tavern has started opening a secret back room after midnight for a select clientele. The Ward Warden suspects it's an unlicensed Void-Wine operation and asks you to confirm the rumours before she can act officially.

turns.narrative: You visit the Velvet Flagon at normal hours. It seems entirely ordinary — good ale, a card game in the corner, a young bard playing quietly. But you notice the barmaid tapping a specific rhythm on the counter when certain customers arrive, who then disappear through a curtained alcove.
turns.choice_a: Attempt to follow a customer through the curtain
turns.consequence_a: A large man blocks your way politely but firmly. You are not one of the regulars.
turns.choice_b: Approach the barmaid and ask what's behind the curtain
turns.consequence_b: She tenses immediately and claims it's the owner's private office. Her pulse is visible at her throat.

turns.narrative: You need a way in. The back-room regulars seem to be upper-middle-class citizens — merchants, junior officials, a physician. None of them look like addicts. They look... hopeful.
turns.choice_a: Dress up as a merchant and ask Brel directly, dropping hints you've heard about his 'special cellar'
turns.consequence_a: Brel looks you over carefully for thirty seconds, then nods slowly and lets you in.
turns.choice_b: Stake out the alley behind the tavern and follow a customer when they leave
turns.consequence_b: A woman exits via the alley two hours later. She is glassy-eyed and serene. You search her bag and find a receipt for 'V.W. — Half Measure.'

turns.narrative: Inside the back room you find a small, tasteful lounge where a man measures Void-Wine in tiny gilded cups, explaining it relieves grief and chronic pain. No one appears in immediate danger, but the operation is unlicensed and the wine's source is unknown.
turns.choice_a: Arrest Brel and shut the back room immediately
turns.consequence_a: Brel is arrested. His customers are deeply unhappy. Warden Astrid is satisfied.
turns.choice_b: Report your findings first and let Astrid plan a coordinated investigation of the supply chain
turns.consequence_b: Astrid chooses a controlled sting operation rather than a hasty arrest. Better intelligence is gathered.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Tavern back-room shut down immediately.

title: The Wine Runner
description: Following up on the Velvet Flagon investigation, you've identified a supply runner named Moll who ferries small Void-Wine barrels from the docks to various establishments. Warden Astrid wants her intercepted and questioned.

turns.narrative: The canal docks are busy at dawn with legitimate cargo. Moll is described as a small, fast woman with a red kerchief who operates alone. Dock Foreman Hal knows her — she rents a locker at the eastern pier under a false name.
turns.choice_a: Watch the eastern pier locker and wait for Moll
turns.consequence_a: Moll arrives at dawn. She sees you before you can move, but she doesn't run — she simply stares at you with calm, calculating eyes.
turns.choice_b: Ask Hal to tip her off that someone is watching — to see how she reacts
turns.consequence_b: Hal reluctantly warns her. Moll's reaction is to move her pickup quickly, revealing her exit route.

turns.narrative: Moll is intercepted. She is more articulate than expected and refuses to name her supplier but explains her operation: she serves sick and grieving citizens who cannot afford legitimate alchemical treatments. The Void-Wine, at the dilutions she supplies, genuinely helps them function.
turns.choice_a: Arrest Moll and let the legal system sort out intent versus impact
turns.consequence_a: Moll is arrested but gives nothing up about the supply chain. Your case remains incomplete.
turns.choice_b: Offer Moll leniency in exchange for testimony about her supplier
turns.consequence_b: Moll names a warehouse in the Transit Corridor where a larger operation is staged.

turns.narrative: Based on Moll's testimony or your arrest, you update Warden Astrid.
turns.choice_a: Bring Astrid directly to the Transit Corridor warehouse immediately
turns.consequence_a: The warehouse is raided. Four barrels of Void-Wine and a supplier ledger are seized.
turns.choice_b: Document Moll's testimony formally and plan a careful sting
turns.consequence_b: A properly documented sting catches the warehouse operator red-handed.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Transit Corridor warehouse raided.

title: The Vacant Stare
description: Three dock workers on Labourer's Row have been found catatonic — sitting rigid, eyes open but unseeing. Their neighbour suspects they've been drinking cheap 'Void-Brew' sold in unlabelled bottles from a street cart. You are asked to find the source.

turns.narrative: The three men are propped against the wall of their shared room like mannequins. Their eyes track movement faintly but they cannot speak. Neighbour Cass found them this morning clutching small unlabelled green bottles.
turns.choice_a: Bring the bottles to Alchemist Rynn for analysis
turns.consequence_a: Rynn confirms the bottles contain heavily unrefined Void-Wine — so raw the neurological impact is severe. The catatonia should fade in 24 hours.
turns.choice_b: Go immediately to the street carts on Labourer's Row to find the vendor
turns.consequence_b: You find Pip pushing a small cart of identical green bottles. He bolts when he sees your expression.

turns.narrative: Pip, when caught, is genuinely terrified. He was given three crates of the bottles by a man named Doss and told to sell them as 'cheap relaxant.' He had no idea they were dangerous.
turns.choice_a: Use Pip as a lead to find Doss immediately
turns.consequence_a: Pip reluctantly points you toward a Scourge-Fringe building where Doss operates.
turns.choice_b: Confiscate Pip's remaining stock and let him go with a warning
turns.consequence_b: Pip surrenders nineteen bottles and disappears from the Row. No more victims follow.

turns.narrative: Regardless of how you handle Pip, the catatonic workers need medical care beyond waiting it out.
turns.choice_a: Bring Rynn's analysis to the Medical Quarter for proper antidote development
turns.consequence_a: A partial antidote is developed. The workers recover in six hours instead of twenty-four.
turns.choice_b: Ensure the workers drink water and are monitored — let the effect fade naturally
turns.consequence_b: The workers recover the next morning. They are shaken but unharmed.

antidote_developed.description: Workers treated with antidote. Partial formulary developed.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Workers treated with antidote. Partial formulary developed.

title: The Grieving Widow
location: North Ward -> The Quiet Homes District
description: A woman named Sera has been spending her entire weekly wage on Void-Wine from a house operation nearby. Her adult daughter Lena begs you to help her mother before the addiction takes the family's savings completely.

turns.narrative: You meet Lena at the door of a tidy but exhausted-looking home. Sera is inside, glassy-eyed and serene, turning a tiny bottle in her fingers. She lost her husband to the Scourge six months ago. The wine makes her feel him near her still.
turns.choice_a: Speak directly to Sera about the addiction and her financial situation
turns.consequence_a: Sera listens without anger. She admits she knows it's expensive but says the emptiness without it is unbearable.
turns.choice_b: First trace where Sera is buying the wine before engaging with her
turns.consequence_b: Lena shows you a house three streets over. Dealer Gant sells small doses from a locked parlour.

turns.narrative: Gant's parlour operation is not violent — he sells carefully and in small doses to ensure repeat customers. But his pricing is exploitative of grieving, vulnerable citizens.
turns.choice_a: Confront Gant and threaten to report him if he keeps selling to Sera
turns.consequence_a: Gant is coldly pragmatic. He agrees to cut Sera off because losing a customer to legal trouble isn't worth it.
turns.choice_b: Report Gant to the Ward Warden with documentation of his clientele
turns.consequence_b: Warden Astrid sends inspectors. Gant's operation is shut down permanently.

turns.narrative: With Gant's supply cut or shut, Sera must face her grief without chemical help.
turns.choice_a: Connect Sera with a grief counsellor at the Temple District
turns.consequence_a: Sera resists initially but agrees to try. Lena is deeply grateful.
turns.choice_b: Simply support Lena as her mother goes through withdrawal — providing comfort items and company
turns.consequence_b: You spend three evenings with the family. Sera comes through it shakily but with her savings mostly intact.

sera_helped.description: Sera connected with grief counselling. Supply cut.

family_supported.description: You personally helped the family through withdrawal.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Sera connected with grief counselling. Supply cut.

title: Colours of the Deep
description: A University professor reports that three students who consumed Void-Wine at an off-campus party experienced vivid shared hallucinations — all three saw exactly the same vision of a city beneath the city. The professor considers this scientifically significant but dangerous.

turns.narrative: The three students are physically fine but deeply shaken. They each independently drew the same image — a vast underground space with towering arcane machinery and channels of glowing blue liquid. The detail is extraordinary in its consistency.
turns.choice_a: Interview each student separately to verify the consistency
turns.consequence_a: Every detail matches across all three interviews — the same archways, same machinery, same faint figure standing in the centre.
turns.choice_b: Examine the drawings and compare them to any known architectural records
turns.consequence_b: Professor Wex matches two of the drawn archways to Pre-Scourge architectural diagrams in the restricted section of the university library.

turns.narrative: The hallucination appears to be a genuine Void-echo — a phenomenon where Void-Wine users briefly perceive the Void layer beneath physical reality. What the students saw may actually exist somewhere under Emberheart.
turns.choice_a: Recommend the University fund an expedition to find the location
turns.consequence_a: Wex is excited. A proposal is drafted for a supervised academic expedition.
turns.choice_b: Warn Wex that pursuing this could be extremely dangerous and recommend suppressing the findings
turns.consequence_b: Wex reluctantly files the drawings in the restricted archive, marked 'Sensitive — Void-Cognition Study.'

turns.narrative: You also need to address the students' wellbeing after the experience.
turns.choice_a: Connect them with a specialist in Void-exposure counselling
turns.consequence_a: The students process the experience safely. Two of them become interested in Void-research as a career.
turns.choice_b: Advise them simply to avoid Void-Wine permanently
turns.consequence_b: All three agree immediately and with obvious relief. They clearly had no desire to repeat the experience.

expedition_proposed.description: Academic expedition proposal drafted for the underground space.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Academic expedition proposal drafted for the underground space.

title: The Purple Ghost
description: Citizens in the Lower Ward have been reporting sightings of a purple-glowing 'ghost' moving through the streets at night. On closer inspection, this is someone or something that has consumed enormous quantities of Void-Wine and is bioluminescent. You need to find them before someone panics and causes an incident.

turns.narrative: You stake out the Drip Tunnels where the ghost was last seen. Two hours into your watch a lavender glow appears around a corner — and resolves into a man named Edden, a former city surveyor, wrapped in a worn blanket and visibly bewildered by his own glow.
turns.choice_a: Approach Edden calmly and non-threateningly
turns.consequence_a: Edden is frightened and ashamed. He has been buying cheap Void-Wine for months and the glow started three weeks ago.
turns.choice_b: Signal the Ward patrol to come assist before approaching
turns.consequence_b: The Ward patrol arrives. Their torchlight and loud voices cause Edden to bolt deeper into the tunnels.

turns.choice_b: Help Edden find a safe place to stay while dealing with withdrawal

turns.choice_a: Help Edden apply to the Reconstruction Survey Office — they need surveyors urgently
turns.consequence_a: Edden gets an interview. His pre-Scourge expertise is immediately valued.
turns.choice_b: Simply ensure Edden is safe and let him handle his own recovery
turns.consequence_b: Edden thanks you sincerely. He handles his own recovery over the following weeks.

title: The Other Side of the Glass
location: Market Ward -> The Sunken Lounge Tavern
description: The Sunken Lounge is a known Void-Wine tavern that operates openly under a grey-area permit. A journalist named Ira wants to expose the tavern's impact on vulnerable patrons. She asks you to gather evidence from inside over a single evening.

turns.narrative: The Sunken Lounge is atmospheric — dim Void-blue lanterns, plush seating, a very quiet crowd who stare into their cups with glassy contentment. Tavern Owner Syl is gracious and well-dressed. She points out that all patrons sign a consent waiver.
turns.choice_a: Accept a small taster glass to blend in and observe the room
turns.consequence_a: A wave of deep calm settles over you — pleasant but disorienting. You maintain your faculties but understand the appeal immediately.
turns.choice_b: Decline politely and simply observe the room as a curious visitor
turns.consequence_b: Syl is mildly suspicious but tolerates you. You note that three patrons have been here for over six hours without moving from their seats.

turns.narrative: You speak with several patrons throughout the evening. Most are managing grief, pain, or isolation. Two are clearly over-consuming — their eyes are vacant and they cannot consistently answer basic questions.
turns.choice_a: Document specific cases for Ira's exposé, including the long-term sitters
turns.consequence_a: Ira is given compelling human-centred testimony that goes beyond mere illegality.
turns.choice_b: Confront Syl directly about the over-consuming patrons and demand she stop serving them
turns.consequence_b: Syl points to her consent waiver and says these are adults making their own choices.

turns.narrative: Ira wants to publish but asks if you think the story should also humanise the patrons rather than just condemn the tavern.
turns.choice_a: Recommend a balanced story: humanise the patrons, critique the system that drives them here
turns.consequence_a: Ira writes a nuanced piece. The Ward Council opens a debate on Void-Wine regulation.
turns.choice_b: Recommend a hard-hitting exposé that focuses on the tavern's exploitation
turns.consequence_b: Ira publishes a damning piece. Syl faces a formal license audit.

balanced_story.description: Balanced journalism published. Council debate opened.

exposee_published.description: Damning exposé published. Tavern audit launched.

title: Vintage of Regret
description: An auction in the High Ward lists a sealed case of Pre-Scourge Void-Wine as a luxury curiosity. Ward Warden Astrid suspects this wine is far more potent than modern diluted versions and could be catastrophically dangerous if consumed. She wants it intercepted before the sale.

turns.narrative: The auction house is full of well-dressed High Ward citizens thumbing catalogues. The Void-Wine case is lot fourteen, listed as 'Pre-Scourge Curiosity — Non-Potable Display Item.' However the wax seals are intact, suggesting it could still be consumed by a wealthy eccentric.
turns.choice_a: Approach Tol the Auctioneer and request lot fourteen be withdrawn
turns.consequence_a: Tol is irritated but agrees to pause the lot pending an official inspection request from Astrid.
turns.choice_b: Identify the anticipated buyer and whisper in their ear about the risks before bidding starts
turns.consequence_b: Lord Edric looks alarmed. He withdraws his bidding card. With no competitive buyer the lot fails to sell.

turns.narrative: Astrid wants either the wine secured as evidence or quietly destroyed. There is also the question of who consigned the lot — a name on the consignment paper reads 'Estate of Vel de Haas' — a High Ward noble family that supposedly died out before the Scourge.
turns.choice_a: Secure the wine case for Astrid and investigate the de Haas consignment
turns.consequence_a: The wine is secured. The consignment appears to be from a Pre-Scourge estate accessed by a recent property buyer.
turns.choice_b: Have the wine destroyed on the auction house floor to prevent any future risk
turns.consequence_b: Tol is furious but Astrid's authority is sufficient. The case is smashed. The Void inside dissipates harmlessly in the air.

turns.narrative: Resolving this raises the question of what else might be in the de Haas estate.
turns.choice_a: Recommend Astrid open a formal investigation into the de Haas property
turns.consequence_a: Investigators find a partially intact wine cellar and several more sealed cases, all secured.
turns.choice_b: File a note and let the matter rest for now
turns.consequence_b: The case is closed. The de Haas property stays unexamined for now.

estate_investigated.description: De Haas estate opened. Multiple cases of Pre-Scourge wine secured.

matter_rested.description: Wine destroyed. De Haas estate left for now.

conclusion: De Haas estate opened. Multiple cases of Pre-Scourge wine secured.

title: The Vent That Screams
description: Maintenance worker Bram reports Vent Station 7 has been emitting a rhythmic screaming noise for three days that is disrupting nearby housing. The sound is not mechanical — it is too tonally complex. The Ridge Authority wants it investigated before panic spreads.

turns.narrative: Vent Station 7 is a squat iron cylinder jutting from the ridge basalt. You hear it from fifty metres away — a rising and falling wail that does indeed sound disturbingly organic. Bram stands nervously nearby holding a pressure gauge.
turns.choice_a: Open the vent access panel and investigate the interior
turns.consequence_a: Inside you find a large bird-like creature, a Vapour Lark, nesting in the intake pipe. Its distress cries echo through the pipe and are amplified into the screaming noise.
turns.choice_b: Take pressure readings around the vent to identify mechanical causes first
turns.consequence_b: Pressure readings are entirely normal. The noise source is organic, not mechanical, confirming it's something alive inside.

turns.narrative: The Vapour Lark is a native Ridge bird that uses geothermal heat to incubate its eggs. It has laid a clutch of six eggs in the intake and will not leave willingly. Forcibly removing it would cause extreme distress and may kill the eggs.
turns.choice_a: Carefully relocate the nest — eggs and all — to an adjacent inactive vent
turns.consequence_a: A delicate operation. The Lark is anxious but follows its eggs. Within hours, the screaming stops.
turns.choice_b: Simply cap the exhaust port to redirect the sound away from housing
turns.consequence_b: The noise is redirected downward into the Ridge stone. Humans can no longer hear it. The Lark continues nesting undisturbed.

turns.narrative: With the immediate problem resolved, Overseer Kell wants a policy on Ridge wildlife and the vent arrays.
turns.choice_a: Suggest installing bird-exclusion grilles on open intake vents
turns.consequence_a: Kell immediately approves the measure. Maintenance teams note three other occupied vents that are now properly addressed.
turns.choice_b: Recommend designating a zone of inactive vents as a protected Vapour Lark nesting area
turns.consequence_b: Kell agrees. A small ridge zone is designated accordingly.

grilles_installed.description: Bird-exclusion grilles installed across the vent array.

zone_designated.description: Protected Vapour Lark nesting zone designated.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Bird-exclusion grilles installed across the vent array.

title: The Failing Seal
description: A routine pressure check reveals Primary Valve Station 3 has a cracked seal that could vent superheated steam directly into the adjacent Ridge worker housing. You have about two hours before the seal fails completely.

turns.narrative: The crack is clearly visible under magnification — a hairline fracture extending two-thirds across the primary seal ring. Steam hisses from it with increasing urgency. Maintenance Chief Dara has the replacement seal but no one rated to work under active pressure.
turns.choice_a: Apply the replacement seal manually under active pressure
turns.consequence_a: A tense twenty minutes of careful work under scalding conditions. You succeed but suffer minor burn injuries to your hands and forearms.
turns.choice_b: Help Dara shut down the primary flow from the upstream junction first
turns.consequence_b: You locate the upstream shutoff. Closing it requires physically holding a corroded wheel for three minutes while Dara installs the seal safely.

turns.narrative: The immediate crisis is averted. But Engineer Pol points out that three other valve stations in the same age-group have never been inspected. Any one of them could have the same problem.
turns.choice_a: Volunteer to inspect all three aging valve stations immediately
turns.consequence_a: You spend four hours inspecting. One additional station has a similar but less advanced crack. Caught early.
turns.choice_b: Document the incident and formally recommend a Ridge-wide valve inspection program to the Authority
turns.consequence_b: Kell approves an emergency inspection program. Pol is assigned to lead it.

turns.narrative: The housing adjacent to Station 3 needs to be informed about what nearly happened.
turns.choice_a: Brief the housing residents openly about the near-miss
turns.consequence_a: The residents are shaken but deeply grateful for the honesty. They are now more engaged in reporting safety concerns.
turns.choice_b: Handle the communications through the Authority to avoid unnecessary panic
turns.consequence_b: An official brief is issued. Calm but uninformative — residents are safe but none the wiser.

residents_informed.description: Residents briefed openly. Community trust increased.

authority_briefed.description: Official communication handled by the Authority.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Residents briefed openly. Community trust increased.

title: Heat Debt
description: The geothermal heat feed to Lower Ward housing has been inexplicably diverted and three blocks of low-income housing are cold at night. Meanwhile Ridge-Lord Fenn's private estate enjoys triple the normal heat allocation.

turns.narrative: You visit three blocks of Lower Ward housing. Children are sleeping in their coats. Residents confirm the heat cut began six days ago with no explanation from the Authority. At the Distribution Junction you find the flow manually rerouted via a handwritten authority slip signed by Ridge-Lord Fenn.
turns.choice_a: Confront Ridge-Lord Fenn directly with the evidence
turns.consequence_a: Fenn is dismissive at first — 'administrative inefficiency' — but crumbles when you cite the handwritten slip.
turns.choice_b: Bring the evidence to Overseer Kell and request she issue a formal correction order
turns.consequence_b: Kell is furious. She issues an immediate correction and flags Fenn for a conduct review.

turns.narrative: Fenn claims he diverted the heat because his guests were visiting and 'required appropriate comfort.' He offers to pay compensation to the cold residents if the matter is kept quiet.
turns.choice_a: Accept Fenn's compensation offer on behalf of the residents
turns.consequence_a: Each household receives 50 gold — a meaningful sum. The matter is officially closed.
turns.choice_b: Reject the quiet settlement and push for a formal accountability report
turns.consequence_b: The conduct report goes public. Fenn is fined by the Authority and the distribution manipulation authority is removed from Ridge-Lord powers.

turns.narrative: With the heat restored, residents want to ensure this cannot happen again.
turns.choice_a: Help draft a basic resources charter for Lower Ward housing protection from Ridge-Lords
turns.consequence_a: The charter gains enough signatures to be submitted to the Ward Council.
turns.choice_b: Simply confirm the heat flow is permanently restored and let the legal process run its course
turns.consequence_b: The heat stays restored. Kell's ongoing conduct review acts as sufficient deterrent.

charter_drafted.description: Lower Ward resources charter drafted and submitted.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Lower Ward resources charter drafted and submitted.

title: The Glass Vein
description: Miners in Ridge Section 4 have struck an unusual vein — not ore, but a substance that looks and feels like glass and resonates faintly when spoken to. Mining Foreman Ness has halted the dig and wants the anomaly assessed before proceeding.

turns.narrative: The vein runs thirty feet into the rock face, glowing a faint amber. Miners nearby report dreaming vividly for the first time in years. One miner claims he spoke to his dead father. Foreman Ness is pragmatic — either this has value or it's dangerous, and he needs to know which.
turns.choice_a: Touch the vein directly to assess its properties
turns.consequence_a: An immediate, overwhelming sensation of interconnectedness fills you — not frightening but deeply alien. You understand instinctively that this material responds to intent.
turns.choice_b: Have Alchemist Tev analyse a surface sample without anyone touching the intact vein
turns.consequence_b: Tev identifies Resonant Crystal — a Pre-Scourge alchemical substrate used in communication and memory-storage devices.

turns.narrative: Resonant Crystal has both commercial and historical value, but it affects people's dreams and emotional states through proximity. The miners are not in danger but extended exposure may be unhealthy.
turns.choice_a: Recommend Ness continue mining the crystal under controlled conditions for the Academic Quarter
turns.consequence_a: Tev supervises. Several carefully harvested fragments are secured for study.
turns.choice_b: Recommend Ness seal the vein and restrict access pending full research
turns.consequence_b: Ness seals off the section. The anomaly is documented for future research under safer conditions.

turns.narrative: The miners who experienced the dreams need to be accounted for.
turns.choice_a: Arrange for them to speak formally with an Academic Quarter researcher about their experiences
turns.consequence_a: Valuable anecdotal data is gathered. Three miners volunteer for continued study.
turns.choice_b: Simply ensure they are rotated out of Section 4 and monitored for well-being
turns.consequence_b: All affected miners are moved to unaffected sections. No lasting effects are reported.

crystal_studied.description: Resonant Crystal harvested and sent for academic study.

vein_sealed.description: Crystal vein sealed pending future research.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

title: The Relic in the Rock
description: A mining excavation triggered a small controlled collapse that exposed a sealed chamber deep in the ridge. Inside is what appears to be a Pre-Scourge workshop — tools, half-finished devices, and a sealed metal trunk that hums faintly.

turns.narrative: The chamber is perfectly preserved — a pocket of ancient air sealed when the Scourge reshaped the rock. Work benches hold intricate instruments no one recognises. The humming trunk sits in the corner, sealed with a combination lock mechanism that still works.
turns.choice_a: Try to open the trunk immediately using trial combinations
turns.consequence_a: After twenty attempts you find the right sequence — three clicks, a quarter turn, two clicks. The trunk is open.
turns.choice_b: Have Winn photograph and document the full chamber before anyone touches anything
turns.consequence_b: Winn spends an hour documenting. Her photographs eventually become the basis of a significant academic paper.

turns.narrative: The trunk contains a set of small brass instruments with etched labels in Pre-Scourge script, along with a personal journal written by someone named Artificer Ollen. Ollen's notes suggest these instruments mapped 'the resonance of the deep' — whatever was beneath the city before the Scourge.
turns.choice_a: Immediately bring Ollen's journal and instruments to the Deep Archive for translation
turns.consequence_a: Archive translators identify three references to structures under Emberheart that match nothing in existing maps.
turns.choice_b: Secure the trunk and all contents for the Ridge Authority to distribute as they see fit
turns.consequence_b: The Authority catalogues the find and loans pieces to the Academic Quarter for study.

turns.consequence_a: An agreement is reached. Researchers get four weeks before mining resumes.
turns.choice_b: Support Darro's decision to continue excavation under researcher supervision
turns.consequence_b: Digging continues carefully. Three more artefacts are found in the chamber walls.

title: The Labour Draft
description: Ridge-Lord Fenn is conscripting workers from the Lower Ward for extended Ridge maintenance shifts — technically legal but the workers are paid below Ward minimum and working in dangerous conditions without protective gear. Three workers have been hurt this week.

turns.consequence_a: You find a locked storage room containing twenty protective suits. Fenn has them — he simply hasn't issued them.
turns.choice_b: Interview the injured workers directly for first-hand testimony
turns.consequence_b: Tomas shows you his burn scars and confirms he asked for protective gear on the first day and was told there was none.

turns.choice_a: Threaten Fenn with a formal safety violation report unless he issues the suits immediately
turns.consequence_a: Fenn backs down the moment legal language is invoked. Suits are issued within the hour.
turns.choice_b: File the safety violation formally with the Ridge Authority without giving Fenn advance warning
turns.consequence_b: The Authority issues a stop-work order on Fenn's muster operation. Workers are sent home with full pay.

turns.choice_b: Document the wage violation for a formal Ward Council complaint
turns.consequence_b: The complaint goes through channels slowly but results in a full back-pay order twelve weeks later.

title: Steam and Stars
description: A junior Ridge engineer named Pyra has been quietly spending her private hours modifying the summit observation post's old geothermal sensors into a long-range atmospheric scanner. turns.choice_b: Study the equipment and signal independently, bypassing Vrex for now
turns.consequence_b: You analyse the signal and confirm it cannot be geothermal in origin — it's directional and encoded.

turns.consequence_a: Vrex, now intrigued, forwards the recommendation. An Expedition planning document is started.
turns.choice_b: Recommend Pyra document everything and submit a research proposal to the Academic Quarter

turns.consequence_a: The design is patented. Pyra receives a modest stipend and recognition.
turns.choice_b: Simply thank Pyra and let her continue her work informally
turns.consequence_b: Pyra continues monitoring quietly. The signal remains active and consistent.

academic_proposal.description: Academic funding approved for recon drone mission.

title: The Sermon in the Wall
location: Temple District -> The Old Concordat Wall

turns.consequence_a: All walls used the same shade of deep blue paint — a specific alchemical blend that under magnification contains a mineral tracer unique to Concordat ceremonial suppliers.

turns.consequence_b: A resident on the third street saw three hooded figures working quickly and quietly. They moved 'like they knew exactly where they were going.'

turns.choice_a: Treat this as a harmless act of religious expression and close the case
turns.consequence_a: Warden Gais is irritated but accepts. Elm's group are warned but not arrested.
turns.choice_b: Formally document the group's membership for the Temple Authority
turns.consequence_b: Warden Gais has the group registered as a recognised minority faith group — granting them limited legal protection.

turns.choice_a: Recommend leaving the walls as an act of faith tolerance

turns.choice_b: Help Elm's group repaint the walls as a proper mural with official permission
turns.consequence_b: A formal mural agreement is reached. The scripture is presented with civic pride rather than secrecy.

walls_as_landmark.description: Painted walls left as faith landmark.

official_mural.description: Walls repainted as approved civic mural.

turns.consequence_a: Cross-referencing with Artificer Ollen's journal (if known) or standard maps shows a sealed Fringe structure that matches Ora's description perfectly.

title: The Face in the Archive

turns.narrative: The portrait shows a Concordat official named Senna in formal ceremonial robes. The resemblance to a Market Ward fixture — a quiet, observant woman who tends a tea stall — is genuinely extraordinary. Same bone structure, same unusual light grey eyes.
turns.choice_a: Go directly to the Market Ward tea stall and speak with the woman
turns.consequence_a: The woman is startled but not frightened when you describe the portrait. She says her name is Senna, and she has been waiting for someone to find it.
turns.choice_b: Research the portrait's background through the Archive's records first
turns.consequence_b: Records show Senna was a senior Concordat Archivist who specialised in Cognitive Preservation — a now-lost branch of Concordat science.

turns.narrative: Senna — whether descended from or somehow the same person as the portrait subject — has a perfectly clear and detailed memory of the Pre-Scourge Concordat and the events leading to the Scourge. She is entirely cooperative but matter-of-fact about her nature.
turns.choice_a: Bring Elder Survivor Ora to meet Senna to verify her Pre-Scourge memories
turns.consequence_a: Ora is astounded. She confirms details from Senna that only someone who was actually there could know.
turns.choice_b: Ask Senna to document her memories in writing for the Archive
turns.consequence_b: Senna spends three days writing. The Archive receives its most complete Pre-Scourge first-hand account.

turns.choice_a: Recommend Senna be introduced to the Ward Council as a Living Archive resource

turns.choice_b: Keep Senna's existence quiet and let her continue as she was
turns.consequence_b: Senna thanks you genuinely. She continues her quiet life, now with someone who knows her secret.

senna_introduced.description: Senna introduced to the Ward Council as a Living Archive resource.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Senna introduced to the Ward Council as a Living Archive resource.

title: The Concordat Mark
location: Lower Ward -> The Old Spire Alley
description: Workers clearing rubble in the Lower Ward have uncovered a pre-Scourge building foundation with Concordat insignia burned into the cornerstone. Temple Authority Warden Gais wants the find assessed before developers cover it over. Locals are demanding it be preserved as a heritage site.

turns.narrative: The cornerstone is clearly a genuine Concordat primary foundation mark — the four-point emblem is pristine, preserved under fifty years of rubble. Developer Brask has already filed construction permits for the site. Local History Group leader Pem has gathered thirty signatures demanding preservation.
turns.choice_a: Inspect the full foundation area to determine the extent of the buried building
turns.consequence_a: The foundation is substantial — likely a Concordat administrative hall. The buried structure extends under two additional adjacent lots.
turns.choice_b: Research the Concordat land use records in the Deep Archive
turns.consequence_b: Records confirm this was a Concordat district welfare office — food distribution and civil record keeping — a significant civic building.

turns.narrative: You must navigate between Brask's legal permits and Pem's community push, with Warden Gais looking for a lawful settlement.
turns.choice_a: Argue that the archaeological significance outweighs the commercial permit and file an emergency heritage injunction
turns.consequence_a: The injunction is granted. Brask's permits are suspended pending a heritage survey.
turns.choice_b: Negotiate a compromise where Brask builds above grade while preserving the Concordat foundation as a viewable cellar exhibit
turns.consequence_b: Brask agrees — the exhibit adds commercial appeal to his development. Pem is satisfied.

turns.narrative: Regardless of outcome, the cornerstone should be properly documented.
turns.choice_a: Arrange for the Deep Archive to make rubbings and a detailed photographic record of all Concordat markings on site
turns.consequence_a: A comprehensive record is created. Pem's group is involved in the documentation.
turns.choice_b: Have the cornerstone itself carefully removed and placed in the Archive for safekeeping
turns.consequence_b: The cornerstone is removed with care and placed on permanent display in the Archive's Pre-Scourge collection.

heritage_injunction.description: Emergency heritage injunction filed. Permits suspended.

compromise_reached.description: Foundation preserved as viewable cellar exhibit.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Emergency heritage injunction filed. Permits suspended.

title: The Black Crop
description: A blight has swept the East Fields, turning the wheat heads black and hollow. Three farmer families stand to lose their entire harvest. Agronomist Liss believes the blight can be stopped but needs someone to identify the initial infected plot and isolate it.

turns.narrative: The blackened wheat crumbles to ash-like dust when you touch it. Liss examines a sample under a magnifying lens and identifies Ashfungus — a soil-borne pathogen that spreads through root contact. The initial infected plot is the key to stopping the spread.
turns.choice_a: Walk the field boundaries systematically looking for the furthest advanced blight pocket
turns.consequence_a: You find a corner of the south field where the blight is densest — a patch about twenty metres across showing total infection.
turns.choice_b: Ask Farmer Elder Wen which plot received new soil amendment this season
turns.consequence_b: Wen recalls that Plot Seven received an experimental composting treatment from a travelling agronomist three weeks ago — right when the blight started.

turns.narrative: The initial infected plot is identified. Liss says the only way to stop the spread is to burn it — and burn it now, before tonight's wind spreads the ash.
turns.choice_a: Burn the infected plot immediately with fire-starting tools
turns.consequence_a: The plot burns in forty minutes. Adjacent crops are saved.
turns.choice_b: Create a firebreak trench around the infected plot before burning to protect adjacent crops
turns.consequence_b: The trench takes two hours to dig but ensures no embers reach the healthy crop. A clean burn.

turns.narrative: Liss wants to test the soil before replanting to ensure the blight is fully extinguished.
turns.choice_a: Volunteer to help Liss collect soil samples from the burned patch and adjacent areas
turns.consequence_a: Samples show the adjacent soil is clean. Replanting can begin in a week.
turns.choice_b: Suggest the farmers rotate the burned plot to a different crop variety that is Ashfungus-resistant
turns.consequence_b: Liss agrees. She provides a seed variety from the Academic Quarter's agricultural vault.

soil_tested.description: Soil sampled and cleared for replanting.

crop_rotated.description: Ashfungus-resistant variety planted in burned plot.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Soil sampled and cleared for replanting.

title: Water Rights
description: Farmers Orel and Marta share an irrigation canal. Orel has installed a water gate that he opens only at times that consistently leave Marta's crops dry during peak irrigation hours. She has asked for mediation before this becomes a physical dispute.

turns.narrative: You meet both farmers at the disputed irrigation gate. It is currently closed. Marta's southern plots are visibly wilting. Orel stands to one side with his arms crossed. He insists he opens the gate on a schedule that was agreed years ago — though no written agreement exists.
turns.choice_a: Ask both farmers to describe their understanding of the original arrangement
turns.consequence_a: Their versions are almost identical except for a single disagreement on mid-day versus morning priority. This is a genuine misunderstanding, not malice.
turns.choice_b: Inspect the gate mechanism to see if it has been recently modified
turns.consequence_b: The gate has a new locking pin added recently — one that wasn't there under the original agreement.

turns.narrative: Water Authority Rep Coll arrives. She points out that the original canal grant allocated equal time and the current arrangement clearly gives Orel 70% of active irrigation hours.
turns.choice_a: Draft a new written schedule with Coll that gives equal hours to both farmers
turns.consequence_a: After some negotiation both farmers sign the new schedule. Orel removes the locking pin.
turns.choice_b: Recommend Coll install a regulated flow splitter that automatically divides canal flow equally at all times
turns.consequence_b: Coll approves installation. The hardware problem is solved permanently. No schedule disputes possible.

turns.narrative: With the water dispute resolved, Marta asks whether you can help her access this season's emergency crop subsidy to recover from the wilted plots.
turns.choice_a: Help Marta complete the subsidy application with Coll's assistance
turns.consequence_a: Marta receives 300 gold in emergency crop relief. She is deeply grateful.
turns.choice_b: Advise Marta on the process and let her handle her own application
turns.consequence_b: Marta submits the application herself. She receives the relief two weeks later.

schedule_signed.description: New equal water schedule signed by both farmers.

splitter_installed.description: Automated flow splitter installed. Dispute permanently resolved.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: New equal water schedule signed by both farmers.

title: The Intruder in the Field
location: Agricultural Zone -> The Northern Livestock Pens
description: Something has been raiding the northern livestock pens nightly — not stealing the animals, but eating only specific parts and leaving the rest. Three goats and a pig have been found in this state. Farmer Cord believes it may be a large Scourge-touched predator.

turns.narrative: The predator takes only organ meat — heart and liver — leaving everything else completely untouched. Tracker Selva crouches over a set of prints near the pen. They are large, six-toed, and show retractable claw marks — consistent with a large feline Scourge-variant, but the print pattern shows the animal is injured: its left rear foot drags slightly.
turns.choice_a: Follow the tracks immediately while they're fresh
turns.consequence_a: The tracks lead to a drainage culvert under the north wall where a large, emaciated creature has made a temporary den. It is clearly suffering.
turns.choice_b: Set a live trap baited with organ meat before following the tracks
turns.consequence_b: The trap works. By morning, you find the creature caught — a Scourge-feline, badly injured, unable to hunt normally.

turns.narrative: The creature is a Scourge-touched lynx variant, badly injured — likely from a trap or debris in the Fringe. It raided the pens out of desperation, unable to hunt wild prey. It is not threatening you directly but is clearly suffering.
turns.choice_a: Attempt to calm and treat the creature's injury
turns.consequence_a: A careful, tense interaction. The creature allows you to clean and bind the infected wound after you move very slowly.
turns.choice_b: Humanely put the creature down to end its suffering
turns.consequence_b: Selva agrees it is the responsible choice. She performs the action quickly. Farmer Cord is relieved.

turns.narrative: Cord wants his pens better protected going forward.
turns.choice_a: Help upgrade the pen fencing with reinforced stakes and motion-triggered noise makers
turns.consequence_a: The upgraded pens deter future intrusions effectively.
turns.choice_b: Recommend Cord apply to the Agricultural Zone for a Zone Guard patrol route that includes the north pens
turns.consequence_b: The Zone Guard agrees. Pens are added to the nightly patrol circuit.

creature_treated.description: Scourge-feline treated and released. Pens reinforced.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Scourge-feline treated and released. Pens reinforced.

title: Path Not Taken
description: A family of four went hiking in the High Forest three days ago and has not returned. The trails are not particularly dangerous in daylight but the forest has been unusually foggy this week. The family's eldest child, a boy named Finn, is eight years old.

turns.narrative: Ranger Nara joins you at the trailhead. The fog is thick enough that you can barely see thirty feet ahead. She gives you a whistle and says the family was heading for the Amber View overlook — a three-hour walk that should have been straightforward.
turns.choice_a: Follow the main trail at pace, calling out regularly
turns.consequence_a: Two hours in you hear a child's voice responding to your call — faint but clear. The family is about four hundred metres off-trail.
turns.choice_b: Use a systematic grid search covering the first-hour trail sections where fog is thickest
turns.consequence_b: Methodical work. You find the family's camp marker at the second grid intersection — they stopped and sheltered when the fog came in.

turns.narrative: The family is physically fine but emotionally exhausted. The mother has a minor ankle sprain from stepping off the path in the fog. Finn is entirely composed — he found edible berries and kept everyone's spirits up.
turns.choice_a: Carry the mother out on an improvised stretcher with the father's help
turns.consequence_a: A steady two-hour carry. Everyone makes it back to the trailhead safely.
turns.choice_b: Splint the ankle and have the family walk out slowly with Nara's support
turns.consequence_b: Slower but achievable. The family makes it out under their own power.

turns.narrative: Back at the trailhead, Dare asks if you can recommend better trail marking for the foggy forest sections.
turns.choice_a: Volunteer to help Nara place reflective trail markers on the High Forest routes
turns.consequence_a: You spend a half-day placing markers along the three primary trails. Future hikers will be significantly safer.
turns.choice_b: Draft a formal petition to the Ward Authority requesting funded trail improvements
turns.consequence_b: The petition is accepted. Funded trail improvements are scheduled.

markers_placed.description: Reflective trail markers placed on all primary routes.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Reflective trail markers placed on all primary routes.

title: The Restless Flock
description: The colony of Canopy-Bats that roosts in the High Forest's upper branches and pollinates the forest's medicinal plants has been behaving erratically — flying in daylight, refusing to roost, and appearing to flee from a specific section of the western canopy. Forest Keeper Vael wants to know why.

turns.narrative: You enter the western section Vael indicated. The canopy is strangely quiet — no bird calls, no insect sounds. The Canopy-Bats are nowhere to be seen. But a faint vibration in the tree trunks is perceptible when you press your palm flat against the bark.
turns.choice_a: Follow the vibration to its source deeper in the western section
turns.consequence_a: The vibration intensifies as you move west. You find a geothermal micro-fissure in the forest floor, newly opened, emitting a low-frequency hum that only animals can properly hear.
turns.choice_b: Climb into the upper canopy to search for displaced bats and evidence of what disturbed them
turns.consequence_b: Sixty feet up you find dozens of bats huddled on the outermost branches, as far from the west as possible. Their echolocation is clearly being disrupted.

turns.narrative: The micro-fissure is the source. The low-frequency hum is distressing the bats and other wildlife. Left alone it may widen into a proper vent — which would alter the forest floor ecology significantly.
turns.choice_a: Seal the fissure using packed clay and Vael's emergency repair kit
turns.consequence_a: A careful two-hour job. The fissure is sealed. The hum stops within an hour.
turns.choice_b: Report the fissure to the Ridge Authority's geological team for a proper assessment
turns.consequence_b: The geological team arrives the next morning. Their assessment confirms the fissure can be safely sealed.

turns.narrative: The bats return to their roost within a day. Vael wants to monitor the fissure site going forward.
turns.choice_a: Place visible marker stakes around the fissure site for ongoing monitoring
turns.consequence_a: Marker stakes are set. Vael schedules monthly inspections.
turns.choice_b: Recommend the Ridge Authority include the High Forest in their routine geological survey circuit
turns.consequence_b: The survey circuit is extended to include the forest. Future fissures will be caught much earlier.

fissure_sealed.description: Fissure sealed. Bats returned to roost.

survey_extended.description: Ridge geological survey extended to forest.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Fissure sealed. Bats returned to roost.

title: The Quiet Axe
description: Forest Keeper Vael has discovered evidence of illegal logging in the Protected Grove — over a dozen mature trees have been taken in the past month. The trees are irreplaceable medicinal specimens. You must identify the loggers before more trees are taken.

turns.narrative: The stumps are clean cuts — professional equipment, not scavenging. Vael shows you the sawdust analysis: it contains a specific teak oil finish consistent with commercially maintained heavy saw blades. The operation is organised.
turns.choice_a: Stakeout the grove overnight to catch the loggers in the act
turns.consequence_a: A four-man crew arrives at midnight with professional equipment. You observe the operation completely before stepping out.
turns.choice_b: Trace the specific saw equipment by checking timber merchant licensing records
turns.consequence_b: Three licences for heavy forest equipment in the Ward match the saw profile. One — Timber Merchant Gos — has no documented work orders for this month but still has active saw crews.

turns.narrative: Timber Merchant Gos, when confronted, initially claims licenses permit some forest use. But the Protected Grove has an absolute prohibition — a status Gos was legally required to know.
turns.choice_a: Report Gos to the Ward Authority with the evidence for immediate prosecution
turns.consequence_a: Gos is arrested and faces a substantial fine plus mandatory replanting orders.
turns.choice_b: Negotiate directly with Gos for a replanting agreement as a condition of not prosecuting
turns.consequence_b: Gos agrees. He funds the replanting of twenty-four Grove-appropriate saplings under Vael's supervision.

turns.narrative: The grove needs immediate assessment and protection going forward.
turns.choice_a: Help Vael install basic perimeter monitoring — trip-line alerts on the three access paths
turns.consequence_a: Trip-lines are set. Any future entry triggers a Ward alert beacon.
turns.choice_b: Recommend the Ward Authority post a rotating night warden to the grove
turns.consequence_b: A paid night warden position is created. The grove gets its first dedicated guard.

gos_prosecuted.description: Gos arrested. Replanting ordered by court.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Gos arrested. Replanting ordered by court.

title: The Price of Service
description: Three households in the High Ward have reported that their domestic servants have quietly organised and submitted a joint wage petition. The servants are asking for nothing illegal — just the Ward minimum wage rather than 'traditional' rates which are forty percent below it. The nobles have refused and several servants have been locked out of the houses they live in.

turns.narrative: Rella is articulate and calm. She presents the petition — eleven signatures, all requesting Ward minimum wage compliance. She is holding a copy of the Ward Labour Charter. Housemaster Berwick is furious and insists that 'household servants are not wage workers in the commercial sense.'
turns.choice_a: Review the Ward Labour Charter and determine if Berwick's interpretation is legally correct
turns.consequence_a: The Charter is unambiguous: household employment above thirty hours per week fully qualifies for minimum wage protection. Berwick is simply wrong.
turns.choice_b: Speak to the Labour Authority to get a binding interpretation of the Charter that Berwick cannot dispute
turns.consequence_b: The Labour Authority provides a written ruling within the day: the servants are fully protected workers.

turns.narrative: Armed with the legal ruling, you return to Berwick. He is embarrassed and defensive but has no legal basis to resist.
turns.choice_a: Present the ruling firmly and give Berwick twenty-four hours to comply or face an Authority complaint
turns.consequence_a: Berwick complies within twelve hours. All back-pay and rate corrections are implemented.
turns.choice_b: Propose a face-saving arrangement where Berwick implements the changes as a 'voluntary improvement program'
turns.consequence_b: Berwick accepts the framing. The servants are paid correctly. Berwick maintains the fiction that it was his idea.

turns.narrative: The locked-out servants need their accommodation restored immediately.
turns.choice_a: Accompany the servants back to collect their belongings or confirm readmission to their rooms
turns.consequence_a: Berwick is present. He is stiff and humiliated but allows them back in.
turns.choice_b: Arrange temporary accommodation at the Service District Resource House while the situation resolves
turns.consequence_b: The Resource House takes in all eleven servants for two nights. The situation resolves within three days.

compliance_demanded.description: Berwick complied within 24 hours. Full back-pay issued.

face_saving_deal.description: Changes implemented as voluntary program. Servants paid correctly.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Berwick complied within 24 hours. Full back-pay issued.

title: The Missing Silverware
description: Noble House Renn has reported a series of petty thefts — silverware, small decorative items, and a gold candlestick. They suspect one of their domestic staff. House Chamberlain Veli wants the matter resolved without public scandal or false accusations.

turns.narrative: The thefts began six weeks ago, always on evenings when a specific weekly social gathering is held at the house. Items go missing during the party chaos. Veli provides a list of all twelve staff members and notes that two have recently paid off personal debts significantly above their salary level.
turns.choice_a: Interview the two high-profile staff members first
turns.consequence_a: One — the scullery assistant Benn — becomes immediately flustered when asked about his debts. He is clearly not a good liar.
turns.choice_b: Review the household entry and exit logs for the six theft evenings
turns.consequence_b: The logs reveal a pattern: the same service corridor is used on every theft evening to reach the silverware cabinet by a route that bypasses the main serviced areas.

turns.narrative: Both paths lead to Benn, who is eventually identified as the thief. When confronted privately, he breaks immediately and explains: his mother is ill and the medical costs were beyond his means. He is deeply ashamed.
turns.choice_a: Report Benn to Veli and let the household decision govern the outcome
turns.consequence_a: Veli, moved by the explanation, arranges for the Medical Quarter to cover Benn's mother's costs and Benn repays the value of stolen goods through wage deductions rather than prosecution.
turns.choice_b: Negotiate a private restitution agreement yourself before involving Veli
turns.consequence_b: Benn agrees to return all items still in his possession and write an itemised restitution promise for the rest.

turns.narrative: Veli asks why the household's security allowed this to happen for six weeks unnoticed.
turns.choice_a: Recommend a basic staff possessions locker policy to prevent future incidents
turns.consequence_a: Lockers are installed. All staff store personal items there. Impromptu searches become standard.
turns.choice_b: Recommend Veli create a voluntary staff hardship fund that helps workers avoid desperation-driven theft
turns.consequence_b: Veli is moved by the suggestion and creates a small discretionary fund. Three other staff immediately apply for minor hardship support.

veli_decided.description: Veli handled Benn's case with surprising mercy.

hardship_fund.description: Staff hardship fund created. Three staff immediately helped.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Veli handled Benn's case with surprising mercy.

title: The Hidden Corridor
description: During a routine Service District utility inspection, a worker discovers a sealed passage beneath a noble house's service corridor. The passage extends for at least a hundred metres and ends in a locked iron door. The Ward Authority asks you to determine where the passage leads and whether it poses a security risk.

turns.narrative: The passage is clean and dry — not a sewer tunnel. The brickwork is Pre-Scourge quality and the passage has been maintained: no cobwebs, no dust, a faint smell of lantern oil. The locked iron door at the end bears the seal of the old Concordat Civil Service.
turns.choice_a: Force the door open to investigate what lies beyond
turns.consequence_a: Behind the door is a small chamber containing a map table and several sealed wooden boxes. The map shows a network of service passages beneath the entire noble quarter.
turns.choice_b: Return with Archive Researcher Winn before opening anything
turns.consequence_b: Winn identifies the door seal as belonging to the Pre-Scourge urban planning division. The passage is a legitimate infrastructure route.

turns.narrative: The boxes contain Pre-Scourge urban administrative records — property deeds, utility maps, and population surveys. Also included: a list of fifteen noble house lots that were never legally transferred from Concordat civil ownership, technically making them currently unowned under existing law.
turns.choice_a: Bring the ownership list to the Ward Legal Authority immediately
turns.consequence_a: A significant legal review is triggered. Several noble families receive letters questioning their property title.
turns.choice_b: Secure the documents in the Archive and let the legal question be handled through proper channels over time
