turns.choice_b: Surveil Pross's next home visit to identify whether she has any direct contact with the network's upper levels
turns.consequence_b: Pross's home visit is entirely genuine in manner — but the client's home is visited two days later by an unknown man who seems to assess the client's level of dependency and collect Pross's informal usage report from a planted listener.

turns.narrative: The planted listener discovery or Pross's cooperative testimony identifies the network's assessment layer: a mild-mannered man who poses as a follow-up charity worker, visiting clients to 'check in on their progress' while actually gauging addiction progression and adjusting supply quantities accordingly. He is the network's key analytics operative — the person who turns grief scouts into precision dosing programmes. His name is Aldren and he operates from a Transit Corridor address above a legitimate grief counselling charity that he has likely fully corrupted.
turns.choice_a: Enter the Transit Corridor charity premises undercover to assess Aldren's full operation
turns.consequence_a: The charity's basement contains a remarkable data operation: files on over a hundred Lower Ward residents organised by grief timeline, dependency assessment scores, and dosing histories. This is a pharmaceutical-grade addiction management system.
turns.choice_b: Watch Aldren make his rounds and follow his end-of-day route to identify where he reports back to
turns.consequence_b: Aldren's end-of-day route takes him to a High Ward private club where he spends forty minutes before emerging lighter — he has made a report or left documentation for someone above him.

turns.narrative: Whether through the basement files or Aldren's trail, you now have the scale: over a hundred active cases across three districts, dosing managed with clinical precision, and a High Ward connection. This is not a street-level operation — it is a sophisticated predation business run by someone with financial resources, alchemical expertise, and no conscience. The hundred active cases are being kept in a dependency window that maximises continued purchase while preventing acute crisis that would trigger medical intervention — a deliberately calibrated level of addiction.
turns.choice_a: Prioritise identifying the High Ward principal before acting on the dependency network
turns.consequence_a: You follow the High Ward trail. The private club is frequented by three individuals who could be principals — a physician, a minor noble, and a disgraced Academic Quarter researcher named Celle who was expelled for prohibited experimentation.
turns.choice_b: Prioritise breaking the supply chain first — protect the hundred active victims even if the principal escapes temporarily
turns.consequence_b: You work with Astrid to identify all supply points. Over forty-eight hours, six delivery routes are interrupted. The network's reliability drops immediately and victims begin seeking help as their supply becomes erratic.

turns.narrative: The disgraced Academic Quarter researcher Celle is the key figure. Her expulsion from the Academic Quarter six years ago was for conducting unauthorised Void-adjacent compound research on 'willing subjects' — who, when the investigation reached them, turned out to be poorly informed Lower Ward patients who did not understand what they had agreed to. She was expelled but not criminally charged due to a technicality in consent documentation. She has been running the same experiment at city-wide scale ever since, now calling it 'grief management research' and publishing coded findings in underground alchemical journals.
turns.choice_a: Confront Celle directly with the full evidence of her operation
turns.consequence_a: Celle is surprisingly calm. She argues that her research will ultimately produce anti-grief medication that saves thousands of lives and that the individual suffering of a hundred test cases is an acceptable cost. She offers her complete research notes in exchange for immunity.
turns.choice_b: Secure Celle's laboratory first — she will destroy evidence if she knows you're coming
turns.consequence_b: A tense raid on her High Ward laboratory apartment. She has already begun burning physical records but two data-crystal storage devices are recovered undamaged.

turns.narrative: With Celle either in direct negotiation or caught in the act, the immediate network falls apart rapidly. Aldren, when his basement operation is exposed, provides a full confession immediately — he is genuinely shocked by the scale of harm the operation caused and believed he was participating in legitimate compassionate research. Pross is cleared of criminal responsibility. The hundred active victims need intervention. Astrid begins coordinating a medical response but the Medical Quarter is stretched. You must personally oversee the most critical cases.
turns.choice_a: Work with the Medical Quarter to triage the hundred cases by dependency severity
turns.consequence_a: Dr. Vel's team accepts the case list prioritised by Aldren's own assessment scores — ironically, his clinical data makes the triage process faster and more effective.
turns.choice_b: Arrange for the F-Chamber's second chamber research team to assess whether the Pre-Scourge fermentation compound — a safer predecessor — could ease withdrawal
turns.consequence_b: The research committee grants emergency access. Three researchers work around the clock on withdrawal management.

turns.narrative: Celle's immunity offer or the recovered data crystals reveal her ten years of research. The research is genuine and genuinely useful — her understanding of Void-Wine's neurological mechanisms is the most sophisticated in existence. She has essentially solved the science of how Void compounds interact with grief-related brain function. This knowledge could form the basis of a legitimate therapeutic treatment — or could be used to produce even more effective predatory addiction compounds in the wrong hands.
turns.choice_a: Bring Celle's research to the Medical Quarter and Academic Quarter for ethical review and prosecution simultaneously
turns.consequence_a: Celle is tried for criminal negligence. Her research is partially classified and partially registered as a foundation for legitimate study.
turns.choice_b: Pursue immunity for Celle in exchange for her full cooperation with Medical Quarter-supervised research
turns.consequence_b: Celle is given a supervised research role. Her criminal charges are suspended pending a three-year research outcome review.

turns.narrative: The hundred victims' recovery is uneven. Most manage with Medical Quarter support. Nine cases require residential care that the Ward does not have infrastructure for. Pross — freed of charges but devastated — proposes converting the Community Hall's grief programme into a legitimate addiction recovery resource. She asks you to help her build the case for Ward funding.
turns.choice_a: Support Pross's proposal publicly and attend the Ward Council funding hearing
turns.consequence_a: The Council is moved by the story and by Pross's evident integrity. A modest recurring fund is approved for the Community Hall grief recovery programme.
turns.choice_b: Help Pross write the proposal and submit it but let her make the case independently
turns.consequence_b: Pross presents it herself and wins the funding on the strength of her own testimony. She is better for having done it alone.

turns.narrative: Celle's research notes contain a classified section she did not offer during negotiations — a second, deeper compound she was close to synthesising at the time of her expulsion. The Medical Quarter researcher reads the section at 3am and contacts you immediately. The compound is not a grief management tool. It is something else entirely: a chemical that causes Void-Wine dependency to transfer to a different substance — essentially a 'redirection agent' that could be used to break Void-Wine addiction by substituting a less harmful compound. Or, in the wrong direction, could be used to make any substance as addictive as Void-Wine.
turns.choice_a: Classify the second compound section and restrict access immediately
turns.consequence_a: The section is classified. Only Astrid, you, and the Medical Quarter director have access. The Vethaan connection in Astrid's files makes this the right call.
turns.choice_b: Commission immediate ethical research into the redirection agent's therapeutic applications
turns.consequence_b: A controlled research programme begins. The compound could revolutionise addiction treatment — it needs careful handling.

turns.narrative: A complication arrives: one of the nine residential-care patients goes missing from their temporary accommodation. The missing person is Rella, a servant's rights advocate from a previous case, who became addicted to Void-Wine after losing her partner. Her disappearance is reported to Astrid who suspects she has been taken — or has relapsed and gone back to a supply source. Either way, she cannot be in the residential system when she is gone. [TENSE INVESTIGATION ENCOUNTER — trace Rella across three district locations in under two hours before nightfall makes the search significantly more dangerous]
turns.choice_a: Retrace Rella's last known movements starting from the Community Hall
turns.consequence_a: Rella visited the Hall at midday, spoke with Pross, and then headed toward the Transit Corridor — toward Aldren's old address, which she knew from her case file. She is looking for supply.
turns.choice_b: Contact Rella's remaining network of servant-community acquaintances for her likely shelter options
turns.consequence_b: A contact identifies a Transit Corridor safe house used by servant-community members in crisis. Rella is there, distressed but not yet using.

turns.narrative: Rella is found and returned to care. She is frightened and ashamed but intact. Her crisis is a reminder that recovery timelines are not linear and the system needs more support resources than currently exist. Pross, when told, immediately finds ways to extend her programme's capacity. Meanwhile, the Grief Merchants operation is completely dismantled — Celle charged or under supervised research, Aldren cooperating with prosecutions, supply chains severed, the hundred cases in treatment. The Ward's bereavement community is safer. A small, proper grief processing network is emerging under Pross's guidance.
turns.choice_a: Help establish a formal protocol that flags recent-bereavement households for legitimate support outreach
turns.consequence_a: A new bereavement outreach protocol is formalised by the Ward Authority. It ensures legitimate contact before predatory networks can identify targets.
turns.choice_b: Recommend the protocol come from community organisations rather than Ward Authority to preserve trust
turns.consequence_b: Pross's Hall becomes the anchor institution for the protocol. Community trust is higher than it would be with a Ward-branded approach.

turns.narrative: Standing in Pross's Community Hall as it hosts its first properly-resourced grief circle, watching twelve residents — including Rella — participate in a session that is entirely genuine and entirely safe, you reflect on what the 'Grief Merchants' actually were: not a criminal enterprise driven by greed but something darker — a researcher willing to sacrifice real people to data, surrounded by a logistical engine that made it possible. Celle's research, however it is ultimately used, came at an enormous human cost. The Ward is incrementally safer. The void in the grief support infrastructure, if not filled, will simply attract the next Celle. You have begun filling it. Pross hands you a cup of tea and says: 'You stayed longer than most people do.' You are not entirely sure she is only talking about tonight.
turns.choice_a: Accept a formal role as Pross's operational adviser for the grief recovery programme
turns.consequence_a: The role is informal but real. Future events in the Void-Wine thread may connect through Pross's programme.
turns.choice_b: Decline any formal role but promise to return if needed
turns.consequence_b: Pross nods. She knows how to find you. The investigation is complete.

celle_charged.description: Celle prosecuted. Research partially registered. Recovery programme established.

celle_researching.description: Celle under supervised research. Recovery programme established. Redirection compound in development.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: Rella is not found. Celle's second compound section falls into Vethaan's network.

conclusion: Celle prosecuted. Research partially registered. Recovery programme established.

title: The Purple-Eyed
location: Temple District -> Undercity Fringe -> Lower Ward
description: An unusual phenomenon has appeared in the Temple District: a small but growing congregation gathers at dawn at the Shrine of St. Ova — all with eyes that have turned permanently violet, a known sign of chronic Void-Wine saturation. They do not appear distressed. They appear reverent. Their leader, a soft-spoken figure in grey robes called the Violet Shepherd, teaches that Void-Wine is not an addiction but a sacrament — a gift from the Void that allows humans to perceive a reality beyond physical suffering. Temple Authority Warden Gais wants the congregation understood before deciding how to respond. Brother Avel, Shrine keeper, is in over his head.

turns.narrative: The dawn congregation numbers about thirty people. Their violet eyes catch the morning light with extraordinary clarity — almost beautiful in an unsettling way. They move quietly and deliberately, displaying none of the distress or disorientation associated with Void-Wine addiction. The Violet Shepherd stands at the centre reading from what appears to be a self-produced text. When the reading ends, they distribute small measures of Void-Wine from a clay vessel in a ritual that mirrors the Concordat sacrament ceremony almost exactly. Brother Avel watches from his doorway looking deeply uncomfortable.
turns.choice_a: Approach the congregation openly and request to observe and ask questions
turns.consequence_a: The Shepherd welcomes you graciously. The congregation is mixed: some are clearly long-term Void-Wine users whose eyes have permanently changed; others are newer recruits with normal eyes who have just begun the 'sacrament.' All are polite, articulate, and genuinely at peace.
turns.choice_b: Observe from a distance and identify any members you recognise from previous investigations
turns.consequence_b: At least three members were referenced in Celle's dependency files from the Grief Merchants case — treated grief-related Void-Wine users who apparently found their way from recovery to congregation.

turns.narrative: The Violet Shepherd agrees to meet privately. They are a former Academic Quarter physician named Cord who experienced a profound Void vision during a severe grief episode twelve years ago. They believe the vision was real — a genuine perception of a post-death continuity — and have built a theology around the controlled use of Void-Wine to facilitate similar visions in others. They have developed a dosing protocol that maximises the visionary experience while preventing acute addiction crises. Their congregation has twenty chronically-saturated members and ten 'sacrament trainees.' Cord is intelligent, sincere, and from a medical standpoint, aware of exactly what they are doing.
turns.choice_a: Engage the Shepherd philosophically — understand the theology before assessing the safety
turns.consequence_a: The Shepherd's theology is sophisticated. The Void is described not as dangerous but as the understructure of reality that the Scourge briefly exposed — and which Void-Wine allows partial access to. This matches Academic Quarter theoretical frameworks in ways that are not coincidental.
turns.choice_b: Focus on the medical risk — ask Cord directly what happens to congregation members whose vision experience becomes dependency rather than practice
turns.consequence_b: Cord acknowledges this directly: seven previous trainees crossed i nto dependency and were released from the congregation and referred to Medical Quarter care. They appear to have a triage process.

turns.narrative: Alchemist Rynn, when you consult her, is fascinated. The Shepherd's dosing protocol is the most sophisticated she has encountered — and the theological framework around it may actually be reducing harm compared to street use by providing context and support. But the twenty chronically-saturated members concern her: their violet eyes indicate irreversible neurological changes. Rynn doesn't know if this causes harm beyond the visual change — and neither does anyone else because no one has studied long-term controlled Void-Wine saturation in a supportive community context.
turns.choice_a: Recommend Rynn and the Shepherd collaborate on a proper study of the congregation's health outcomes
turns.consequence_a: The Shepherd agrees immediately. They have always wanted external scientific validation. Rynn begins baseline assessments within a week.
turns.choice_b: Recommend Warden Gais classify the congregation as a low-risk monitored group pending further data
turns.consequence_b: Gais issues a monitored status — not suppression, not endorsement. The congregation continues while oversight begins.

turns.narrative: Two problems emerge simultaneously. First: three new 'trainees' appear at the congregation with no apparent grief history — they are young, healthy, and have been recruited via an underground pamphlet that describes the 'sacrament experience' primarily as a consciousness-expanding pleasure rather than a grief management tool. Someone is using the congregation's legitimacy to attract recreational users. Second: a Concordat remnant elder has identified the congregation's ritual as a direct theological appropriation of Pre-Scourge Concordat sacramental practice — and is preparing a formal protest.
turns.choice_a: Address the recreational recruitment problem first — it undermines everything the Shepherd has built
turns.consequence_a: The pamphlet's source is a fringe member who broke from the congregation's grief-only admission policy. Cord expels him immediately and issues an explicit counter-statement.
turns.choice_b: Address the Concordat elder first — their theological objection, if it gains traction, could trigger formal Temple Authority suppression of the congregation
turns.consequence_b: Elder Noss's objection is specific: the clay vessel used in the ritual is an exact replica of a Concordat sacramental vessel. Cord admits they modelled the ritual on Concordat sources. Noss is disarmed by the acknowledgement.

turns.narrative: Both problems handled, the congregation's existence becomes a genuine Ward policy question. Warden Gais must formally rule on whether the Purple-Eyed congregation can continue operating. She has the medical risk data, the Shepherd's cooperation record, the theological objection response, and your investigation report. She asks for your recommendation directly.
turns.choice_a: Recommend continued monitored legal operation with strict admission requirements and Medical Quarter oversight
turns.consequence_a: Gais adopts this recommendation. The congregation is registered as a therapeutic-spiritual community under Medical Quarter oversight.
turns.choice_b: Recommend dissolution of the sacramental element while permitting the grief support community to continue
turns.consequence_b: This is the harder needle to thread. Cord accepts it reluctantly. The grief circles continue without Void-Wine. Several members leave; several stay.

turns.narrative: Rynn's baseline assessments of the twenty chronically-saturated members yield unexpected findings: all twenty have elevated neurological activity in areas associated with spatial reasoning and pattern recognition. Their violet eyes are not merely cosmetic — they can perceive wavelengths of light slightly beyond normal human range. This appears to be an evolutionary response to Void saturation rather than degradation. The Academic Quarter researcher who receives Rynn's preliminary data requests immediate access to the congregation for further study and — without authorisation — contacts congregation members directly.
turns.choice_a: Intervene to protect the congregation from unsolicited Academic Quarter approaches
turns.consequence_a: The Academic Quarter is formally notified that all research contact must go through Rynn and Cord jointly. The researcher is reprimanded.
turns.choice_b: Use the Academic Quarter's interest to legitimise the congregation further — visibility helps protection
turns.consequence_b: Rynn negotiates a formal research partnership that grants the congregation Academic Quarter affiliated status — significant legal protection.

turns.narrative: The Violet Shepherd's congregation is, somewhat improbably, stabilising into a legitimate community institution. But a shadow falls: one of the seven previous trainees who were released after crossing into dependency — a man named Ferris — has disappeared. He was receiving Medical Quarter care and was improving. His counsellor reports he had become convinced that his dependency was not an illness but a sign that he was 'closer to the Void' than the congregation acknowledged. He may have gone seeking a deeper exposure somewhere in the Undercity.
turns.choice_a: Search the Undercity Fringe for Ferris personally — this could be dangerous if he has found a Void-proximate location
turns.consequence_a: Ferris is found in an Undercity pocket that has elevated Void-energy readings. He has been consuming raw, unprocessed Void-Wine — far beyond any safe level. He is alive but deeply disoriented.
turns.choice_b: Coordinate a Fringe search team and focus on processing the investigation's remaining policy work while others search
turns.consequence_b: A team finds Ferris after twelve hours. He is alive but medical intervention is needed immediately.

turns.narrative: Ferris is recovered and hospitalised. His case becomes pivotal: he is the proof that the congregation's triage process is imperfect — someone slipped through who needed more intensive support than they received. Cord is shaken. The Shepherd visits Ferris daily. The Medical Quarter designs a more intensive re-intake protocol for congregation releases. But politically, Ferris's story is being used by Concordat elders and Temple conservatives to argue that the congregation should be dissolved entirely.
turns.choice_a: Shield Cord and the congregation from the political backlash by presenting the Medical Quarter's response as proof the system works
turns.consequence_a: Director Sela appears before Warden Gais to confirm that Ferris's case has driven meaningful protocol improvements. The criticism is blunted.
turns.choice_b: Acknowledge the failure honestly in public — trust built through transparency will be stronger than defensive positioning
turns.consequence_b: Cord appears with Gais and makes a public statement acknowledging the failure and describing specific changes. The congregation loses some members but gains significant public respect.

turns.narrative: Ferris recovers. His case, processed with honesty or shielded with competence, leads to a genuinely better system. The congregation is now operating with Medical Quarter oversight, academic research partnership, controlled admission, and improved triage. The Violet Shepherd is scheduled to give a public address to the Temple District community — the first time they have stepped fully out of the congregation's private world. Before they speak, they pull you aside and say: 'There is something I should have told you from the beginning. The vision I received twelve years ago — it had a face in it. I drew what I could remember. I have never shown it to anyone.' They hand you a worn sketch.
turns.choice_a: Look at the sketch carefully
turns.consequence_a: The face in the sketch is indistinct but for one detail: a specific pattern of light around the eyes that Alchemist Rynn identifies, when you show her, as the visual signature of someone in deep Void-Wine saturation — but the sketch predates any known Void-Wine use by the Shepherd. The vision showed them someone who was already deep in the Void. The face has no name.
turns.choice_b: Accept the sketch without looking and bring it to Rynn and Astrid directly
turns.consequence_b: Rynn and Astrid study it together. The visual signature in the eyes matches recorded descriptions of Void visions from Celle's research files. The face may be a Void-echo — a real person visible through the Void layer.

turns.narrative: The sketch connects the Violet Shepherd's founding vision to Celle's Void-research data and potentially to the Void-echo phenomenon documented in the students' shared vision from EH_SQ_414. Multiple Void-users from different contexts have perceived something consistent in the Void layer. A pattern is forming that none of the individual investigations revealed alone. Warden Gais requests an urgent joint briefing with the Medical Quarter, the Academic Quarter, and the Temple Authority to assess what the combined data suggests. [PIVOTAL BRIEFING — how you present the combined data shapes the institutional response]
turns.choice_a: Present the combined data as evidence of a cognitive-Void phenomenon that requires serious structured scientific investigation
turns.consequence_a: A multi-institutional Void Perception Research Committee is formed. The Shepherd is invited to participate as a primary data source.
turns.choice_b: Present it cautiously — highlight the pattern's existence without overstating its significance, prioritising safety over discovery
turns.consequence_b: A smaller, more cautious investigation is authorised. The Shepherd's sketch is classified. Progress slower but institutional risk is lower.

turns.narrative: The Violet Shepherd gives their public address to the Temple District. It is not a sermon. It is a testimony — a careful, medically-informed account of their journey, the congregation's purpose, what went wrong with Ferris, what has been changed, and what they believe they are learning about the Void. Several Temple district residents weep. Three Concordat elders walk out. Brother Avel, who initially asked for help with a situation he couldn't understand, now watches from the shrine steps with what appears to be something close to respect. Cord speaks for ninety minutes and takes questions for another hour.
turns.choice_a: Step forward at the end to publicly acknowledge your role in supporting the congregation's development
turns.consequence_a: The public acknowledgement connects your name to the congregation's legitimisation. This has both protective and targeting implications.
turns.choice_b: Remain in the background — let this be entirely Cord's moment and the congregation's
turns.consequence_b: Cord receives the full credit. The congregation's identity is stronger for not depending on an outside figure.

turns.narrative: The Purple-Eyed congregation is now a Ward institution — imperfect, monitored, remarkable. Thirty-two people with violet eyes attend it. Seven more are in Medical Quarter care on improved protocols designed partly by Aldren's clinical data. Rynn's research is expanding. The sketch sits in the Void Perception Research Committee's files. The face with the saturated eyes waits in the Void, seen by multiple people across multiple events, unidentified and patient. You have not solved that thread. You have made it visible.
turns.choice_a: Formally accept a seat on the Void Perception Research Committee
turns.consequence_a: Your seat on the Committee will give you advance access to findings as the research develops.
turns.choice_b: Remain an external adviser rather than a formal member
turns.consequence_b: Flexibility is maintained. You can work across investigations without being bound to the Committee's formal processes.

congregation_legalised.description: Congregation registered under Medical Quarter oversight. Academic research partnership formed. Void Perception Committee formed.

congregation_reformed.description: Congregation continues without Void sacrament. Grief circles operational. Research ongoing.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: Ferris dies in the Undercity. The congregation is dissolved by force. The sketch is never found.

conclusion: Congregation registered under Medical Quarter oversight. Academic research partnership formed. Void Perception Committee formed.

title: The Vineyard's Roots
location: Transit Corridor -> Scourge Fringe -> The Glass Shelf
description: The Void-Wine Supplier Ledger recovered from the Canal Dock investigation contained one unresolved entry: 'Origin — GS/Shelf — See Issra.' Someone was using the Glass Shelf as a Void-Wine source long before Issra arrived. A primary underground production site must exist. Tracing it may reveal who has been controlling Void-Wine supply since the Scourge.

turns.narrative: Issra agrees to show you where she found the Deeproot Spice on the Glass Shelf — a location she has never revisited. Fringe Guide Selva accompanies you along with Dr. Vel for research purposes. The three-hour walk into the Fringe is quiet but tense. When you reach Issra's harvest location, the Deeproot Spice patch is gone — replaced by bare, glass-smooth stone bearing fresh tool marks. Someone has been actively working this area recently.
turns.choice_a: Follow the tool marks deeper into the extraction zone
turns.consequence_a: The marks form a cultivation grid extending a quarter-kilometre. Two zones are still active with fresh growth.
turns.choice_b: Search for concealed access beneath the Shelf surface
turns.consequence_b: Selva finds a hidden vertical shaft under a glass overhang — descending at least twenty metres into the Shelf.

turns.narrative: Whether you traced the cultivation grid or found the shaft, both lead to a sophisticated underground facility. Carved into Scourge-crystalline rock and lit by Void-reactive bioluminescent fungi, the space holds stone fermentation vessels, drainage channels, a cistern, and paper records stored in dry conditions. The facility is active — and occupied. An elderly woman in practical clothing emerges from a side chamber. She looks at you with weary recognition rather than panic.
turns.choice_a: Move to secure the records before addressing the occupant
turns.consequence_a: You retrieve three ledger books before she introduces herself. The records show forty-two years of production.
turns.choice_b: Address the occupant directly — you want information, not confrontation
turns.consequence_b: She steps forward without hesitation. 'I wondered how long it would take someone to find this. Forty-two years, as it turns out.'

turns.narrative: Essa is a former Concordat Alchemist who survived the Scourge in the Fringe. She discovered the naturally-occurring Void-vine and began producing Void-Wine forty-two years ago as treatment for Scourge-trauma survivors suffering neurological collapse. Her original patients died long ago, but demand never stopped. Through intermediaries she has never met, she has supplied the city's entire Void-Wine market for four decades, producing approximately 200 litres monthly. She has never seen profit from the distribution — coin arrives at a Transit Corridor dead drop and production notes are collected.
turns.choice_a: Focus on understanding Essa's full history before deciding what to do
turns.consequence_a: Her account is medically coherent and heartbreaking — a genuine healer whose work was consumed by the shadow economy.
turns.choice_b: Focus on identifying her intermediaries — they are the criminal network exploiting both her and her customers
turns.consequence_b: The dead drop location and production note system is carefully documented. A name appeared once in a slip of paper: 'V.'

turns.narrative: The name 'V.' at the dead drop is a direct connection to the Vethaan thread. If Vethaan controls Void-Wine distribution city-wide — having also touched the F-Chamber compound, the Grief Merchants network, and this source — Vethaan is not one criminal operation. Vethaan is infrastructure. You report the connection to Astrid by messenger immediately.
turns.choice_a: Secure the facility and Essa's records intact and await Astrid's investigators
turns.consequence_a: Astrid arrives six hours later. Her face as she surveys the underground facility is unreadable — then quietly stunned.
turns.choice_b: Begin copying Essa's forty-two years of production records immediately
turns.consequence_b: Three hours of work yields a distribution pattern spanning twelve Ward districts and predating every existing investigation by decades.

turns.narrative: Essa's legal situation is genuinely complex. Her production has been therapeutically valuable — the Violet Shepherd's congregation, Pross's clients, and thousands of others have depended on the quality she maintained. But the facility is unlicensed, in a restricted Fringe zone, and has been supplying an uncontrolled drug across the city. Dr. Vel argues passionately for preserving Essa's forty-two years of expertise.
turns.choice_a: Recommend a fast-track heritage medical licence for Essa's operation
turns.consequence_a: Essa becomes the city's only licensed Void-Wine production facility — regulated, monitored, no longer exploitable by intermediaries.
turns.choice_b: Recommend Essa be relocated to the Medical Quarter with the facility preserved as a research site
turns.consequence_b: Essa accepts with quiet relief. The facility becomes a research asset and her knowledge is formally recorded.

turns.narrative: The Transit Corridor dead drop is placed under surveillance. Four days pass before a carefully-dressed man retrieves Essa's latest production note and departs. Surveillance tracks him through the Transit Corridor and into an upper Market Ward private club. Not the High Ward — a different network than Serren operated.
turns.choice_a: Follow the operative into the club
turns.consequence_a: He is a mid-level Ward transport logistics administrator using legitimate cargo manifests to mask Void-Wine distribution routes.
turns.choice_b: Have Selva tail him after he exits the club
turns.consequence_b: He returns home and receives a visitor two hours later — the same High Ward courier seen during the Baker's Uprising investigation.

turns.narrative: The High Ward courier now links Vethaan's Void-Wine distribution to the Baker's Uprising case. OPERATION VETHAAN now has six documented touchpoints across four investigations. Astrid has assembled the pattern. The name is no longer a whisper — it is a map being drawn.
turns.choice_a: Intercept the courier aggressively — surveil, identify, detain if possible
turns.consequence_a: The courier is intercepted. Low-level, knows little directly. But his route logs show thirty-two stops across the city in the past month.
turns.choice_b: Continue building the map quietly without alerting the network
turns.consequence_b: All thirty-two route stops are documented over two weeks. A remarkably complete picture of Vethaan's logistics emerges undisturbed.

turns.narrative: Dr. Vel's analysis of Essa's records reveals a crucial finding: the Void-vine underwent a biological change approximately twenty years ago. Before the change, it produced purely sedative and grief-management compounds. After, it added the euphoric compound that creates recreational addiction. This change was not natural — and Essa was never informed it happened.
turns.choice_a: Investigate what physically changed in the facility twenty years ago
turns.consequence_a: An additional mineral channel was cut through the stone — connecting the cultivation grid to a deeper Void-energy source. Someone visited and modified the system without Essa's knowledge.
turns.choice_b: Cross-reference this timeline against Celle's research records
turns.consequence_b: Celle's classified files contain a journal entry from twenty-three years ago describing an 'observed field modification experiment' at an unspecified Fringe location. This was Celle.

turns.narrative: Celle modified Essa's vine without consent twenty years ago — transforming a therapeutic facility into an addiction factory and creating the city-wide Void-Wine dependency crisis that has unfolded ever since. Whether she was working alone or for Vethaan's network is the critical question now.
turns.choice_a: Confront Celle directly with the vine modification evidence
turns.consequence_a: Celle does not deny it. She was hired through an intermediary she never met. Given a location map and specific modification protocol. Told it was a Scourge-resilience study.
turns.choice_b: Present the evidence to the joint oversight committee before confronting Celle
turns.consequence_b: In a formal supervised setting, Celle provides a partial account only — but enough to confirm she acted at someone else's direction.

turns.narrative: Celle's confirmation closes the circle on twenty years of deliberate harm. OPERATION VETHAAN now has a provable twenty-year span of intentional city-wide manipulation. Astrid says quietly: 'We have never had a case this large.' She begins preparing a formal prosecution brief — but Vethaan has no documented personal identity. Every thread leads to a network node. No thread leads to a face. [KEY DECISION — how to build a prosecution when the target is deliberately nameless]
turns.choice_a: Search every documented Vethaan connection for a single persistent identifying characteristic
turns.consequence_a: A handwriting graphologist analyses three document sources and identifies consistent letter formation in the letter 'A' — distinctive enough to identify a single author across all three.
turns.choice_b: Build the case on the organisation rather than an individual — Vethaan as a network entity
turns.consequence_b: Astrid accepts this framing. The prosecution target becomes 'The Vethaan Network' — a novel legal approach that avoids requiring a named individual.

turns.narrative: With the prosecution strategy set, you return to Essa's facility one final time to complete the evidence documentation. Essa is cooperative and thoughtful. She says something that stops you: 'The person in the 'V.' notes — they always paid coin in old Press-minted denominations. Pre-Scourge mint marks. Who would have access to pre-Scourge currency in circulation today?' Astrid's numismatist is contacted. Three of the coins recovered from Essa's dead drop payments match a specific Concordat Treasury mint that was operational only in the last two decades before the Scourge.
turns.choice_a: Trace the mint-mark coins to determine if any current holder of pre-Scourge currency could be identified
turns.consequence_a: The Deep Archive has records of pre-Scourge Treasury distributions. Three living individuals in Emberheart are confirmed recipients of Concordat Treasury stores. One of them runs a High Ward import business.
turns.choice_b: Add the mint-mark evidence to the VETHAAN file without immediately acting — this is the kind of lead that must be approached with caution
turns.consequence_b: The coins are photographed and documented and Astrid agrees to sit on the lead until the full prosecution framework is ready.

turns.narrative: From Essa's underground chamber, now properly lit and under Medical Quarter oversight, forty-two years of careful therapeutic work is finally protected. The Void-Wine thread has reached its source. The production is legitimate. Twenty years of deliberate weaponisation is documented. Vethaan's network has a prosecution file. The mint-mark coins may represent the first truly personal thread leading to whoever Vethaan actually is. Selva looks at the cultivation grid carved into the Scourge crystal and says: 'Whoever built this knew what they were doing. They respected the material.' Essa nods. 'So did I. I think that was the problem.'
turns.choice_a: Formally open the mint-mark lead as OPERATION VETHAAN's primary active investigation strand
turns.consequence_a: The High Ward import business is placed under discreet surveillance. The investigation enters its deepest phase yet.
turns.choice_b: Submit the full file to Ward institutional investigators — the scale requires more resources than one person can manage
turns.consequence_b: A dedicated team is formed. The investigation continues at institutional scale.

essa_licensed_vethaan_file.description: Essa's facility licensed. Vine modification documented. Mint-mark lead identified.

essa_relocated_network_prosecution.description: Essa relocated. Vethaan Network as prosecutable organisation established.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: Essa destroys her records. The vine modification cannot be proven.

conclusion: Essa's facility licensed. Vine modification documented. Mint-mark lead identified.

title: The Deep-Mine Incident
location: Ridge -> Mine Section 9 / Pre-Scourge Concordat Facility
description: A mining crew in Section 9 of the Ridge deep mine has broken through into a sealed Pre-Scourge chamber — but this is not an artefact cache or survey workshop. The space beyond is intact, operational, and apparently powered: lights are on, mechanisms are turning, and a low hum of active machinery fills the newly opened gap. Three miners have already entered and cannot be reached by voice. The Ridge Authority has suspended all drilling within 200 metres and requested immediate assistance from whoever recovered the Resonant Crystal and Artificer Ollen's journal.
key_npcs: Concordat Engineer Senna (if found in EH_SQ_433)

turns.narrative: The breach point is a ragged hole in a basalt wall revealing a smooth-cut corridor beyond, lit by amber lights that pulse softly in a rhythm matching Resonant Crystal energy signatures. Mining Foreman Ness grips the edge of the breach and calls names into the corridor. Silence — then a faint sound, rhythmic and mechanical, that is definitely not human. Overseer Kell stands behind you. 'Three men are in there,' she says. 'The machinery is active. Tell me what I'm dealing with.'
turns.choice_a: Enter the corridor immediately to find the three miners
turns.consequence_a: The corridor extends forty metres before opening into a circular chamber where three miners stand completely motionless, staring upward at a central structure of rotating amber crystal rings suspended from the ceiling. They are conscious but unresponsive to your presence.
turns.choice_b: Examine the corridor from the breach point before entering — assess what you're walking into
turns.consequence_b: The amber lighting pulses in a pattern matching the 'Request Contact' signal from the machine in EH_SQ_458. This facility is the source of that signal — and it has been broadcasting for decades.

turns.narrative: The three miners are in a Resonant Crystal trance — the same crystal-based cognitive connection phenomenon that Ollen's journal described as 'deep resonance contact.' They are not harmed but are receiving a continuous audio-visual signal from the crystal array above them. Their eyes are tracking moving patterns only they can see. Similar to Void-Wine visions but structured, architectural, deliberate.
turns.choice_a: Attempt to physically interrupt the crystal trance by separating the miners from the array's direct signal
turns.consequence_a: Moving one miner out of the circular chamber's signal zone causes him to blink and return to full awareness, shaken but unharmed. The crystal arrays dim when he exits.
turns.choice_b: Try to receive the signal yourself to understand what the miners are experiencing before breaking the trance
turns.consequence_b: Standing beneath the crystal arrays, you experience ten seconds of structured architectural vision — a complete three-dimensional model of something vast underground before you step back deliberately.

turns.narrative: The three miners are recovered. Two are shaken. One — a man named Dorr — is profoundly moved and refuses to discuss what he saw except to say it was 'a gift.' The facility itself demands attention. This is clearly a Concordat communication and mapping station — designed to broadcast Resonant Crystal signals across deep terrain. The clockwork assembly machine (EH_SQ_458) has been receiving this signal. This station is its intended correspondent.
turns.choice_a: Document the facility thoroughly before anything is touched or activated further
turns.consequence_a: Six hours of careful documentation. The station contains four additional chambers — a control room, a signal records archive, a maintenance bay, and a sealed room with no visible door mechanism.
turns.choice_b: Attempt to communicate with the facility's systems using the Concordat Resonance Relay recovered in EH_SQ_458
turns.consequence_b: The Relay responds. A cascading activation sequence runs through the station — systems that have been in standby for decades beginning proper operation cycles.

turns.narrative: The sealed room's door opens automatically when the signal exchange is initiated, revealing an operations centre with stone-carved displays showing city maps — deep-layer maps of Emberheart's underground structure. The maps show features that do not match any current survey: passages, chambers, resource deposits, and three locations marked with the Concordat's highest security designation. One marked location is directly below the Scourge Fringe's most active zone.
turns.choice_a: Copy the deep-layer maps immediately — this is intelligence that could reshape the city's understanding of what lies beneath it
turns.consequence_a: Copying takes most of a day. The maps show seventeen unknown major underground structures beneath the city.
turns.choice_b: Secure the operations centre and brief only Overseer Kell and Astrid on what the maps show
turns.consequence_b: A controlled briefing is arranged. The maps' existence is classified at your recommendation pending security assessment of the three high-designation locations.

turns.narrative: The three high-designation locations represent a genuine dilemma. One is apparently a Concordat emergency resource cache — food, tools, and preserved infrastructure components stored before the Scourge in case of catastrophic surface damage. One appears to be an energy generation station still possibly operational. The third is labelled only 'CONTAINMENT' in Pre-Scourge script, with a designation that Concordat survivor Senna (if found in EH_SQ_433) identifies as their highest emergency risk classification.
turns.choice_a: Investigate the resource cache location first — the practical benefit is immediate and risk is low
turns.consequence_a: A careful descent to the resource cache finds it intact: preserved materials worth enormous practical value to city reconstruction, plus documentation dating from two weeks before the Scourge began.
turns.choice_b: Consult Senna (or the Archive's Concordat records) about the CONTAINMENT designation before going near any of the three
turns.consequence_b: CONTAINMENT in Concordat protocol means a sealed biological or energy hazard that was considered too dangerous to destroy and too dangerous to leave accessible. The Concordat's emergency standard was to seal it and pray.

turns.narrative: Whether you investigated the cache or consulted the records, the CONTAINMENT location now looms as the defining question of what this station revealed. Kell wants it investigated. Astrid wants it left alone. Dr. Vel has been contacted and is urgently requesting access. The miners who experienced the crystal trance — especially Dorr — are asking questions about what the station is. The ridge community is starting to hear rumours.
turns.choice_a: Recommend an authorised joint-institution survey of the CONTAINMENT location with full safety protocols
turns.consequence_a: A committee is formed: Medical Quarter, Academic Quarter, Ridge Authority. A careful approach is planned with three weeks of preparation.
turns.choice_b: Recommend all three locations be sealed under Ward emergency protocol until proper expertise can be assembled
turns.consequence_b: Emergency seals are applied to all three locations. No action until the committee the survey team formally constitutes.

turns.narrative: The communication station itself needs to be integrated into the city's infrastructure or closed. The clockwork assembly machine's operator (from EH_SQ_458) arrives at the Ridge, visibly excited, with Engineer Pyra (from EH_SQ_426). Together they believe the station can serve as a deep-city communication relay — providing a Concordat-era communication infrastructure for the Ridge, Undercity operations, and Fringe expeditions. The practical value is enormous. The energy system that powers it is still active and has been running for over a century.
turns.choice_a: Support integrating the station as a Ridge communication hub
turns.consequence_a: A working group is established. Within six weeks, the station is providing reliable deep-Ridge communication for the first time since the Scourge.
turns.choice_b: Recommend the station be fully studied before any new use is added — it has been running for a century without human management
turns.consequence_b: A six-month study period is authorised. The station continues its existing broadcast patterns undisturbed.

turns.narrative: Dorr, the miner who refused to discuss his trance experience, approaches you privately. He has been drawing what he saw during his ten minutes beneath the crystal array — detailed architectural drawings of spaces he had never seen, filled with devices he cannot name. His drawings match three of the seventeen underground structures on the deep-layer maps with extraordinary accuracy. The crystal array showed him real places. He wants to know if you can find a way to get him back in — controlled, with understanding of what is happening.
turns.choice_a: Work with Rynn and the Academic Quarter to design a safe supervised trance session for Dorr
turns.consequence_a: A controlled session yields twelve additional architectural drawings of extreme detail. Dorr emerges moved, productive, and fully intact.
turns.choice_b: Counsel Dorr that the trance was a one-time experience and re-entry cannot be guaranteed safe
turns.consequence_b: Dorr accepts this but continues drawing from memory. His sketches become part of the deep-map archaeological record.

turns.narrative: The energy generation station — the second of the three high-designation locations — is assessed by the joint committee. It is a geothermal-to-Resonant-Crystal energy conversion system, using the same heat sources that the modern Ridge vent arrays tap for heating. It has been running continuously for over a century, maintenance-free, at approximately 40% of its original capacity. If restored to full capacity it could double the Ridge's usable energy output.
turns.choice_a: Recommend a restoration programme for the energy station
turns.consequence_a: Concordat-era engineering documentation found in the station's archive guides a careful restoration. Within three months, Ridge energy output increases by 65%.
turns.choice_b: Recommend leaving it at current capacity — a system running for a century should not be disrupted without fully understanding it first
turns.consequence_b: The station continues at 40% capacity. Its documentation is studied by the Academic Quarter for two years before any modification is recommended.

turns.narrative: The CONTAINMENT location is the final question. With the resource cache secured, the energy station addressed, and the communication station integrated, the committee turns to the third designee. Their report arrives: the CONTAINMENT location is a sealed chamber approximately 200 metres below the active Scourge Fringe. The seal is Concordat-grade and shows no integrity failure after a century. What is inside is not documented — only the classification level. A decision must be made. [HIGH-STAKES CHOICE — one of this questline's most significant decisions]
turns.choice_a: Open the CONTAINMENT seal using the Resonant Relay and the station's access protocols
turns.consequence_a: A team descends. The seal opens. The chamber within is not empty: a perfectly preserved Concordat-era entity — not human, not Scourge-touched — is suspended in a crystal matrix, apparently dormant. It is alive. Barely. Breathing cycles once per three minutes.
turns.choice_b: Leave the CONTAINMENT sealed and formally classify it as a Ward-level restricted site
turns.consequence_b: A Ward restricted-site designation is applied. The location receives permanent monitoring by the Ridge Authority. The sealed entity, whatever it is, remains undisturbed.

turns.narrative: Whether you opened the CONTAINMENT or sealed it formally, the immediate mine incident is resolved. The three miners are fully recovered. The station is integrated or under study. The maps are documented and partially acted on. The Ridge community is processing the reality that there is an entire Pre-Scourge infrastructure layer beneath them that has been running autonomously for a century. Foreman Ness looks at the breach point, now properly reinforced with a door installed, and says: 'The miners are asking if there are other stations.'
turns.choice_a: Commission a systematic deep-mine survey to identify other Concordat stations using the maps
turns.consequence_a: A survey programme is launched. Four more potential sites are identified within the first month.
turns.choice_b: Use the maps to identify the three most strategically important sites and assess those first
turns.consequence_b: Three priority sites are assessed over the following six weeks. One is another communication station. One is a secondary resource cache. One appears to be a manufacturing facility.

turns.narrative: The Deep-Mine Incident has transformed the Ridge from a geothermal energy district into something much more: the entry point to a century of hidden Concordat infrastructure that has been keeping itself alive beneath the city's feet. Kell stands at the communication station's signal display — a wall of animated deep-maps — and says: 'The Concordat didn't die. They just went underground.' The mining crew who broke through the wall have been given formal engineering commendations. Dorr has been offered a position as the Deep Survey's primary cognitive cartographer. The resource cache has fed two thousand people for a month. The sealed entity breathes once per three minutes in the dark.
turns.choice_a: Formally request a senior institutional appointment to oversee the Concordat infrastructure integration programme
turns.consequence_a: Kell appoints you as liaison between the Ridge Authority and the multi-institutional Concordat Infrastructure Committee.
turns.choice_b: Step back from formal involvement and let the institutions manage what has been found
turns.consequence_b: The institutions are capable. The discovery runs its own course. You remain available for specific consultations.

containment_opened.description: Entity discovered in CONTAINMENT. Station integrated as communication hub. Resource cache secured.

containment_sealed.description: CONTAINMENT classified. Station under study. Resource cache secured.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: A miner triggers the station's defensive systems. Two are severely injured.

conclusion: Entity discovered in CONTAINMENT. Station integrated as communication hub. Resource cache secured.

title: The Ridge-Lord Summit
location: Ridge -> The Summit Hall / Ridge-Lord Estate Row
description: The discovery of the Concordat underground infrastructure and the resource cache has made the Ridge the most strategically significant district in the city overnight. Three Ridge-Lords — Fenn (whose labour violations you exposed), Darrow (ambitious and newly arrived), and Elder Voss (the oldest and most established) — are now competing to control the infrastructure programme. Overseer Kell has called a formal Summit to prevent a factional breakdown. She asks you to attend as a neutral adviser. The session will determine who controls the most significant find in a generation.

turns.narrative: The Summit Hall is a vaulted chamber at the Ridge's administrative peak, reserved for significant multi-Lord negotiations. All three Ridge-Lords arrive with advisers and legal representatives. Fenn is over-dressed and nervous — your earlier exposure of his labour violations clearly damaged his standing. Darrow is younger and direct, presenting an immediate commercial proposal. Elder Voss sits with quiet patience and says nothing for the first twenty minutes. Kell opens by stating that the Ward Council has not yet designated control authority — this Summit is meant to produce a recommendation.
turns.choice_a: Begin by proposing that control should be determined by institutional mandate rather than Lord authority
turns.consequence_a: Voss nods immediately. Fenn bristles. Darrow pivots rapidly to present himself as the most institutionally aligned Lord.
turns.choice_b: Listen to each Lord's opening argument before offering any framework
turns.consequence_b: Fenn argues property rights — the mine section is under his licence area. Darrow argues first-mover advantage — his survey investment was largest. Voss argues that historical Ridge-Lord authority predates all of them.

turns.narrative: Labour Representative Renia has requested and been granted observer status at the Summit. She does not have a vote but she does have the legal right to address the assembly on behalf of the 847 miners who work the deep sections. When she stands to speak, the room becomes extremely still. She says: 'The miners broke through that wall. The find belongs to the Ridge community — not the Lords.' This is not legally binding. But the room's response to it reveals who actually has moral authority here.
turns.choice_a: Support Renia's statement openly and propose a community governance model
turns.consequence_a: Voss supports this immediately. Fenn looks calculating. Darrow objects — his investment has no return under a community model.
turns.choice_b: Remain neutral but ensure Renia's statement is formally entered into the Summit record
turns.consequence_b: The formal record inclusion gives her argument legal weight in any subsequent Ward Council consideration.

turns.narrative: Darrow makes a bold proposal: he will fund the entire infrastructure integration programme — communication station restoration, energy station upgrade, resource cache management — in exchange for a forty-year exclusive licensing arrangement over the infrastructure network's commercial output. The proposal is financially sound. It is also a private takeover of a public discovery. The other two Lords are silent, assessing whether to compete or cooperate.
turns.choice_a: Formally oppose Darrow's proposal and propose Ward Council oversight as the only appropriate governance for a discovery of this magnitude
turns.consequence_a: Kell is visibly relieved. Voss supports. Fenn, sensing the political wind, supports. Darrow's proposal fails in the room.
turns.choice_b: Negotiate amendments to Darrow's proposal that limit the exclusivity and add community benefit mandates
turns.consequence_b: A twenty-year, non-exclusive arrangement with mandatory worker profit-sharing is counter-proposed. Darrow considers for two hours.

turns.narrative: Fenn, sensing the political dynamics shifting against his property-rights argument and seeing an opportunity, makes a private approach. He quietly reveals that he has documentation suggesting Darrow's survey investments were funded through a shell company with connections to the same High Ward trading families involved in the Bread Cartel commodity manipulation. Fenn is offering this as an exchange for your support of his governance model. His information may be valuable. His motivation certainly is not altruistic.
turns.choice_a: Take Fenn's documentation to Astrid for verification independently of the Summit
turns.consequence_a: Astrid confirms the shell company connection within twenty-four hours. Darrow's institutional credibility collapses when this is formally documented.
turns.choice_b: Decline to use private information as Summit leverage — report the approach to Kell as witness intimidation
turns.consequence_b: Kell is furious at Fenn's conduct. He is formally sanctioned and his governance model is disqualified on grounds of bad faith conduct during Summit proceedings.

turns.narrative: With Darrow's model failed or discredited and Fenn sanctioned or outmanoeuvred, Elder Voss makes his move. His proposal is the most sophisticated of the three: a Ridge Mining Heritage Authority, jointly governed by the three Ridge-Lords in rotating chairmanship, with mandatory worker representation and Ward Council liaison. The proposal was clearly pre-prepared — Voss came to this Summit knowing what he wanted and waited for the other two to exhaust themselves.
turns.choice_a: Support the Heritage Authority model with modifications to ensure worker representative parity
turns.consequence_a: Renia stands again: 'If we receive genuine parity — not a single seat as token — yes.' The model is agreed with parity governance.
turns.choice_b: Raise concerns about rotating lordly chairmanship as merely redistributing control rather than genuinely sharing it
turns.consequence_b: Voss is surprised but listens carefully. After a thirty-minute recess, he returns with a modified model in which the chair is selected by secret ballot among all governance participants — including worker representatives.

turns.narrative: The governance model is agreed in principle. The Summit breaks for the night with a working document to be finalised the next morning. During the dinner recess, you overhear a brief exchange between Darrow and an aide that stops you cold. They say a name — not clearly, not fully — but enough to suggest 'V-something' and refer to 'the timing problem at the mine.' This could be nothing. Or Darrow's shell company connection runs further than the Bread Cartel families.
turns.choice_a: Confront Darrow directly before the Summit reconvenes in the morning
turns.consequence_a: Darrow is smooth and convincingly dismissive. But he contacts someone by messenger within twenty minutes of your conversation — Astrid's surveillance team tracks the messenger to a High Ward address not in any existing file.
turns.choice_b: Add the overheard fragment to your OPERATION VETHAAN notes and say nothing at the Summit
turns.consequence_b: The fragment joins the growing archive. Darrow proceeds through the Summit's conclusion unaware you noted it.

turns.narrative: The Summit's second morning. The governance document is ready for signing. But overnight, Foreman Ness has discovered that someone attempted to access the communication station without authorisation — boot prints, a disturbed door seal, and an abandoned piece of equipment identified as a sophisticated listening device. One of the Summit participants, an adviser's aide, cannot be accounted for.
turns.choice_a: Halt the signing until the security breach is investigated
turns.consequence_a: Kell agrees. A two-hour investigation identifies the aide — employed by Darrow's organisation — as the intruder. Darrow claims ignorance.
turns.choice_b: Proceed with the signing but ensure the security breach is in the formal record
turns.consequence_b: The signing proceeds. The breach is documented. Two weeks later, the listening device is traced to a High Ward manufacturer with connections the investigators find significant.

turns.narrative: The Ridge Mining Heritage Authority is formally constituted. Voss is the first chair by ballot. Renia holds one of three worker seats. The breach investigation continues in the background. The Concordat infrastructure integration programme has its governance and begins proper execution. The Ridge community — miners, maintenance workers, the Vapour Lark Zone's residents — quietly celebrates. A district that was being stripped of resources and exploited for cheap labour is now in genuine institutional transformation.
turns.choice_a: Help formulate the Heritage Authority's first six-month operational plan
turns.consequence_a: Six priorities are set including worker safety standards, resource cache management, and the energy station restoration.
turns.choice_b: Step back from day-to-day governance and trust the Authority to run its own affairs
turns.consequence_b: The Authority operates well without continued intensive involvement. Kell provides monthly briefing summaries.

turns.narrative: Dorr, the miner with the crystal trance experience, has been appointed as the Deep Survey's lead cartographer — his trance-derived architectural knowledge supplementing the technical survey teams. In his first week he identifies three additional Concordat facility locations that the technical teams had not found. He presents his findings in the Heritage Authority's first formal session with a quiet confidence that has nothing to do with his previous modest miner's identity. The crystal experience changed him — made him something new.
turns.choice_a: Advocate for Dorr to receive formal training support for his new cartographic role
turns.consequence_a: The Academic Quarter offers a six-month accelerated programme. Dorr is the first Ridge miner to receive academic credentials.
turns.choice_b: Simply ensure Dorr's contribution is properly credited in the Heritage Authority's records
turns.consequence_b: Dorr's contributions are formally credited. He asks for nothing more and seems entirely at peace.

turns.narrative: A problem from the CONTAINMENT decision surfaces — if you opened the chamber, the entity's presence becomes harder to keep from public knowledge as more people cycle through the station. If you sealed it, Voss privately reveals that his family records include a Pre-Scourge Concordat notation about 'the preserved witnesses' — entities sealed in crystal suspension beneath the Ridge as insurance against the Scourge consuming all institutional memory. Either version converges on the same truth: the CONTAINMENT chamber holds a Concordat institutional memory keeper, sealed for over a century. [SIGNIFICANT TURNING POINT — how this information is managed shapes the city's relationship with the Pre-Scourge past]
turns.choice_a: Bring the full truth about the preserved entity to the Heritage Authority and Ward Council
turns.consequence_a: Extraordinary institutional meetings follow across three weeks. The entity is carefully awakened using Senna's guidance. It is — as Voss's records suggested — a Concordat Knowledge Keeper, designed specifically to survive catastrophic events and provide institutional continuity.
turns.choice_b: Keep the preserved entity's nature restricted to a small inner circle until there is a clear plan for managing the implications
turns.consequence_b: A five-person inner circle is formed. Planning begins for a carefully managed disclosure.

turns.narrative: Whether the entity is publicly disclosed or managed in a small circle, its significance is undeniable: a living bridge to Pre-Scourge institutional memory in the same category as Senna — but designed for the purpose, complete, and carrying records that Senna's personal memory cannot match. The Concordat did not die. It waited. The Heritage Authority's first major challenge is now its most significant: integrating Pre-Scourge institutional memory with a century of Scourge-era experience. Voss says quietly: 'We were always going to need to reckon with this eventually.'
turns.choice_a: Facilitate a formal integration protocol — the Knowledge Keeper's records assessed systematically against current Ward knowledge
turns.consequence_a: A five-year integration programme is designed. The Knowledge Keeper agrees to participate. The programme begins immediately.
turns.choice_b: Recommend that integration happen slowly and organically rather than institutionally — the Knowledge Keeper is a person, not a database
turns.consequence_b: The Knowledge Keeper is granted full citizen status and allowed to engage on their own terms. Deep institutional learning happens at a human pace.

turns.narrative: The Ridge is unrecognisable from the district that existed three months ago. Underground infrastructure is being mapped and integrated. Worker governance is real and functional. A Pre-Scourge entity with institutional memory is cooperating with the Heritage Authority's knowledge integration programme. Dorr drafts city maps in the communication station's amber light. Renia chairs a worker safety working group that is rewriting Ridge employment standards. Kell stands in the station's operations centre looking at the deep-layer display and says: 'We thought we were mining the past. It turns out we were building the future.' The Ridge thread is alive in ways it has never been.
turns.choice_a: Accept formal Ward recognition for your role in the Discovery and Summit
turns.consequence_a: A Ward commendation is issued. The Ridge's transformation is publicly credited to a collaborative effort with your name foremost.
turns.choice_b: Decline formal recognition — point to Renia, Dorr, Voss, and Kell as the Summit's real architects
turns.consequence_b: Recognition goes to the community. It is entirely appropriate. You remain available for the next problem.

heritage_authority_public.description: Heritage Authority constituted. Knowledge Keeper publicly integrated. Ridge in institutional transformation.

heritage_authority_inner_circle.description: Heritage Authority constituted. Knowledge Keeper managed by inner circle initially. Framework building.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: Darrow's model passes. The infrastructure programme is privately captured.

conclusion: Heritage Authority constituted. Knowledge Keeper publicly integrated. Ridge in institutional transformation.

title: The Geothermal Collapse
location: Ridge -> The Deep Vent Nexus / Lower Ward adjacency
description: Three months after the Heritage Authority's formation, Engineer Pyra's atmospheric sensors detect an anomaly in the Ridge's geothermal pressure network: the primary vent nexus — the convergence point of all eight major geothermal lines — is showing a pressure accumulation pattern that has no precedent in modern records. Pyra calculates an 85% probability of catastrophic release within 96 hours unless the pressure is actively managed. A full collapse of the nexus would vent superheated steam and geothermal gas across an area covering the Ridge and adjacent Lower Ward, potentially killing hundreds.

turns.narrative: Pyra's presentation to the Heritage Authority Emergency Session is precise and frightening. The pressure accumulation began forty-eight hours ago — the same period during which the energy station restoration work (from EH_SQ_521) has been running at elevated output. The two are connected: increasing the energy station's throughput has altered the geothermal flow balance across the network. The restoration crew inadvertently destabilised the system that has been in equilibrium for a century. Pyra says: 'We have about ninety hours to either equalise the pressure or evacuate a twelve-block radius including most of the Lower Ward adjacency.' Both are necessary — evacuation as insurance, pressure management as real solution.
turns.choice_a: Prioritise immediate pressure management — focus all resources on solving the technical problem
turns.consequence_a: Kell assigns every available maintenance resource. Dara has a theory about controlled release valves on sections 3 and 7 that could begin pressure equalisation within six hours.
turns.choice_b: Evacuate the at-risk zone first before attempting the technical fix — protect people before property
turns.consequence_b: Ward Guard begins coordinating with Lower Ward residents. Approximately 1,400 people need to relocate temporarily to safe Ward facilities.

turns.narrative: Dara's controlled release theory requires accessing three valve stations simultaneously — one of which is Valve Station 3, which was repaired during a previous incident. The other two are in sections 5 and 7, neither of which has been inspected in over two decades. Section 7's access route goes through the Concordat communication station, which is currently in active operation mode. Disrupting its signal patterns risks complications with the Resonant Crystal arrays.
turns.choice_a: Route through the communication station carefully, coordinating with Dorr to minimise crystal disruption
turns.consequence_a: Dorr guides you through the station's signal patterns during a ninety-second window between broadcast cycles. The route is navigated without incident.
turns.choice_b: Find an alternative route to Section 7 even if it takes additional time
turns.consequence_b: An older service route exists — unused for decades and partially blocked by debris. It takes three hours to clear but preserves the communication station's integrity.

turns.narrative: At Section 5, the valve station's equipment is operational but the pressure seals are degraded — they will only handle two controlled releases before they need replacement. You have four release events planned for full pressure equalisation. You must either find replacement seals or redesign the release sequence to work within the two-release limit.
turns.choice_a: Send Dara to retrieve replacement seals from the energy station's supply cache
turns.consequence_a: The energy station's Concordat-era supply cache contains pressure seal components that are a far superior quality to modern equivalents — they fit perfectly and exceed the original specifications.
turns.choice_b: Redesign the release sequence to work within the two-release limit at Section 5
turns.consequence_b: Pyra calculates that a modified two-release approach at Section 5, combined with adjusted timing at Sections 3 and 7, can achieve 70% of necessary pressure reduction.

turns.narrative: Forty-eight hours into the incident, a second complication emerges: the geothermal pressure spike is not just accumulation from the energy station increase. Pyra's refined models show that a deep fault 400 metres below the nexus has been slowly shifting for six months — long before the energy station work began. The energy station restoration accelerated a process that was already underway. This fault shift is a structural geological event that the controlled release valves can only delay, not solve.
turns.choice_a: Consult the Concordat deep-station maps for any infrastructure designed to manage deep-fault events
turns.consequence_a: The deep maps show a fault stabilisation array at approximately 350 metres depth — a Concordat-era system for managing exactly this type of geological event. It requires the Resonant Relay to activate.
turns.choice_b: Accept that the valve approach is a temporary measure and focus on permanent evacuation and zoning changes in the affected area
turns.consequence_b: Kell authorises a permanent zoning review for the twelve-block radius. Evacuation becomes a permanent partial-resettlement rather than a temporary measure.

turns.narrative: The fault stabilisation array — if accessible — represents the only permanent solution. Its depth requires a descent through the communication station's lower access system. Dorr, who knows the crystal array architecture better than anyone, says he believes the Resonant Relay can interface with the stabilisation array's control system. The Knowledge Keeper (if awakened) confirms this: the stabilisation array was built to be remotely managed from the communication station exactly for this type of geological emergency.
turns.choice_a: Activate the fault stabilisation array through the communication station
turns.consequence_a: A tense forty-minute operation. Dorr manages the crystal interface. The array activates — a deep vibration felt throughout the Ridge that slowly resolves into steady quiet over the following hour. The fault stabilises.
turns.choice_b: Deploy a physical team to the 350-metre depth to manually trigger the stabilisation array
turns.consequence_b: A three-person team descends with Concordat-era access documentation. The array is found operational. Manual activation triggers successfully after forty minutes of equipment interfacing.

turns.narrative: With the stabilisation array active, pressure readings begin declining across all eight nexus lines. Pyra watches the monitors with red-rimmed eyes and says: 'We're going to be okay.' The 1,400 evacuated residents begin returning home. Valve Station repairs are completed at Sections 3, 5, and 7. The energy station is throttled back to 40% output — its current safe maximum given the fault dynamics — while the stabilisation array runs parallel support. No lives were lost. A few structural wall cracks in the Lower Ward adjacency require repair.
turns.choice_a: Commission an immediate structural assessment of all Lower Ward buildings in the adjacency zone
turns.consequence_a: Seventeen buildings have meaningful structural damage. Six require temporary shoring before residents can return. Two need partial reconstruction.
turns.choice_b: Focus on the geological assessment — understanding the full extent of the fault shift before anything else
turns.consequence_b: Pyra's extended assessment takes seventy-two hours. The fault shift has stabilised but shows ongoing micro-adjustment that requires monthly monitoring.

turns.narrative: The energy station's throttled output has reduced the Ridge's heating capacity below the level committed to Lower Ward housing agreements — the supply shortfall that Ridge-Lord Fenn originally exploited is now a structural reality rather than deliberate manipulation. The Lower Ward's housing association is notified. Ward Councillor Dain contacts you privately saying this is 'a political disaster waiting to happen' unless creative solutions are found quickly.
turns.choice_a: Engage the Heritage Authority in emergency supplemental heat solutions for the affected Lower Ward blocks
turns.consequence_a: Portable geothermal units sourced from the resource cache provide emergency supplemental heating. The shortfall is covered for ninety days while permanent solutions are designed.
turns.choice_b: Be transparent with affected residents — explain the geological situation and the timeline for restoration
turns.consequence_b: A public meeting is held. Residents are frustrated but respond far better to honesty than most Ward officials expected. A community monitoring group is formed.

turns.narrative: The fault stabilisation array's successful activation raises a significant question: what other emergency infrastructure exists in the deep Concordat system that has not yet been mapped or activated? Dorr's cartographic team, now working from the communication station's deep-map displays, has identified four more structural emergency systems in the Layer 3 deep zone. Any one of them could be relevant to future crises. The Heritage Authority must decide on a proactive assessment programme.
turns.choice_a: Launch a proactive assessment of all four identified emergency systems
turns.consequence_a: Two are found fully operational. One is partially damaged. One has been naturally sealed by geological movement over the past century.
turns.choice_b: Prioritise the one system closest to active geothermal operations first
turns.consequence_b: The closest system — a pressure distribution manifold — is found operational and is immediately integrated into the Ridge's safety monitoring network.

turns.narrative: Dr. Vel has accompanied the lower-level survey teams as a medical observer.
