turns.choice_b: Brute force parry (Str Save DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You catch the bone-blade on your steel, feeling the strength of the Void behind it.
turns.convergence: The cultist's mask falls, revealing a face warped by Star-Dust exposure.

turns.narrative: Injured, the cultist attempts to ignite a rune on the cavern floor—a 'Ruin-Scream' that could collapse the tunnels.
turns.choice_a: Counter-spell the rune (Arcana DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The violet light fizzles and dies. The creature let's out a dry rasp of despair. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: End the threat before the chant finishes (Attack AC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: Your blade finds its mark. The cultist slumps against the altar.
turns.convergence: The humming stops. The silence of the deep stone returns, absolute and heavy.

turns.narrative: The cultist’s belongings are scattered. A heavy bronze key and a flask of 'Weaver's Ichor' lie among the debris.
turns.choice_a: Loot the remains
turns.consequence_a: Success: You take the key and several high-grade crystal vials. (+1 Gear)
turns.choice_b: Examine the altar's construction
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find it was built atop an ancient pre-Scourge survey point. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: The tremors from the pipes above signal that the camp has restored pressure.

turns.narrative: You emerge from the vents, the cold Ridge air stinging your lungs after the humid salt-cavern. The Steward is waiting, his face tight with concern.
turns.choice_a: Deliver the Weaver’s Notebook
turns.consequence_a: Success: Your standing with the Council rises as they study the threat patterns. (+2 Influence)
turns.choice_b: Keep the Void-Glass for your own research
turns.consequence_b: Success: The Council is none the wiser, and you have a new source of power. (+1 Secret)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The cultist of 'The Weaver' has been purged from the geothermal depths, but his notes suggest he was but a single eye of a much larger web.

risk_matrix.penalty: The pressure bursts. -1 Settlement Stability and half-pay for the next three days.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Automatic on session start

title: The Overgrown Silo
description: Grain Silo 4 in the Lower Ward's agricultural perimeter has been overtaken overnight by a rapidly growing, parasitic synthetic ivy that emits a faint, sickening lavender glow. The local rats are not fleeing the infestation; they are cultivating it. The silo's contents are at risk of being consumed, and the party must eradicate the synthetic growth, stop the augmented vermin orchestrating its spread, and uncover the source of this accelerated biological hazard.

turns.narrative: Under the pale night sky, Silo 4 resembles a gargantuan tumor of vine and leaf rather than an agricultural storage unit. The ivy doesn't merely grow; it writhes with an unnatural, synthetic elasticity, the sound of its rubbing leaves mimicking a dry, collective whisper. A sickly lavender glow pulses through the thickest veins of the plant, illuminating the rusted maintenance door.
turns.choice_a: Auscultate the vines (Nature DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Pressing your ear to the cold steel beneath the vines, you hear the unnatural sap-flow. It's perfectly synchronized with the local mana-grid's rhythmic thrum, revealing that this plant is feeding directly off the ward's power infrastructure.
turns.choice_b: Prune a path with a silvered blade (Athletics DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: You hack furiously at the thick, rubbery vines. They bleed a viscous, glowing violet sap that smells sharply of ozone and rotting fruit, but you manage to carve a bloody path directly to the sealed maintenance door.
turns.convergence: With the exterior vines temporarily pushed back or understood, you stand before the maintenance door. It groans under the immense pressure of the growth within, ready to give way.

turns.narrative: The violet sap has filled the keyhole and fused the heavy iron hinges tight. The smell in the immediate vicinity is sweet, almost intoxicating, attempting to lull your survival instincts into a state of lethargic compliance. Beyond the steel, you can hear the frantic, organized scratching of dozens of tiny claws.
turns.choice_a: Sledgehammer the hinges (Strength DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: You swing with brutal, focused force. The warped metal screams and finally gives way, blowing the door inward and showering you in a burst of cold, bioluminescent nectar that sticks to your armor like glue.
turns.choice_b: Burn the sap with a controlled torch
turns.consequence_b: You carefully apply heat. The synthetic sap flares an aggressive blue and vaporizes instantly, leaving behind a charred, brittle residue that allows the door to be kicked open. The heat slightly damages the internal locking mechanism.
turns.convergence: You step inside the cavernous silo. The air is instantly thick with floating, glowing spores that shimmer like radioactive snowfall, coating everything in a faint purple dust.

turns.narrative: The internal humidity is near absolute saturation. Your breath comes in ragged, wet gasps as the spore-fog attempts to coat the lining of your lungs. Every step you take on the dense pile of ruined grain feels spongy, like walking across a shallow grave. Movement stirs in the shadows above.
turns.choice_a: Steady your breathing (Con Save DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: You force your heart rate down, taking shallow, disciplined breaths. The spores fail to take root in your respiratory tract, allowing you to maintain your focus and visual acuity in the dim, shifting light.
turns.choice_b: Improvise a filter mask from salt-cloth
turns.consequence_b: You quickly tie a salt-soaked cloth tightly over your mouth and nose. The acrid bite of the salt immediately neutralizes the cloying sweetness of the spores, granting you a safe, if uncomfortable, breathing environment.
turns.convergence: At the very center of the ruined grain-pile, a massive, bulbous 'Star-Heart' root pulses with a rhythmic, sickly light, acting as the central nexus for the entire infestation.

turns.narrative: The pulsing bulb is the source of the synthetic ivy—fed by a sprawling network of thick root-ropes that have violently pierced the grain sacks, draining them of all nutritional value. The roots flex and tighten like muscle tissue, pumping captured mana into the central node.
turns.choice_a: LANCE the bulb's core (Attack AC 10)
turns.consequence_a: You drive your weapon deep into the fleshy center of the pulsing bulb. A high-pressure spray of noxious violet gas erupts as the core violently shrivels, instantly killing the immediate network of vines.
turns.choice_b: Salt the root-vines (Herbalism DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: You strategically apply a heavy desiccant salt mixture to the primary arterial roots. The vines immediately turn a sickly black and become brittle, severing the bulb's connection to the silo's stolen nutrients.
turns.convergence: As the central bulb dies, a furious, synchronized screech echoes from the rusted catwalks above. The cultivators of this toxic harvest are exceptionally unhappy.

turns.narrative: Dozens of rats, their natural fur replaced by highly organized rows of tiny, glowing synthetic sprouts, scurry down the rusted pipes in precise, military formation. Their eyes are frantic, violent pinpricks in the dark, and they move with absolute, coordinated intent to defend their dying crop.
turns.choice_a: Ignite a 'Sun-Flare' (Spell/Cantrip)
turns.consequence_a: You detonate a blinding flash of pure, concentrated light. The heavily adapted rats, accustomed to the dim violet glow, are instantly blinded, tumbling helplessly from the high catwalks to the silo floor below.
turns.choice_b: Trust your ears (Survival DC 12)
turns.consequence_b: You close your eyes and listen past the echoes. You hear the metallic scrape of claws on iron and dive aside perfectly, dodging a coordinated ambush from three rats that drop from the ceiling.
turns.convergence: The surviving mutated rats land heavily in the grain surrounding you, baring sharpened teeth that glow like hot coals, completely unbothered by the loss of their kin.

turns.narrative: You realize with sudden horror that the rats are physically connected by thin, glowing threads of the synthetic ivy interwoven into their nervous systems. They move with terrifyingly singular purpose, attacking not as individuals, but as a single, multi-bodied organism defending its territory.
turns.choice_a: Sever the connecting ivy (Dex DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: You strike with surgical precision, slicing the glowing threads that link the creatures together. Without their hive-mind coordination, the rats immediately fall into chaos, snapping wildly at each other in sudden confusion.
turns.choice_b: Intimidate the swarm (Intimidation DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: You let out a terrifying roar, hoping to break their morale. The rats do not even flinch. Connected by the synthetic mind of the ivy, they feel absolutely no fear, only an all-consuming hunger.
turns.convergence: The largest of the connected rats—a swollen monstrosity acting as the local control node—lunges directly for your unprotected throat.

turns.narrative: Combat in the silo becomes a visceral blur of bloody fur and snapping fangs, illuminated only by the dying violet light of the torn ivy. The rats fight with suicidal ferocity, completely ignoring their own grievous wounds to ensure their fangs find your flesh.
turns.choice_a: Sweeping Area Attack
turns.consequence_a: You swing your weapon in a massive, continuous arc, clearing a wide circle of absolute safety around you. You sever multiple controlling vines and crush the vanguard of the rat swarm simultaneously.
turns.choice_b: Target the alpha rat (Attack AC 12)
turns.consequence_b: You bypass the swarm and drive your weapon directly through the skull of the swollen control node. Without its central command, the remaining rats break their formation and flee rapidly back into the darkest shadows.
turns.convergence: The surviving rats yield the floor, vanishing into the grating. The silo finally falls into a heavy, sap-scented silence, the immediate threat neutralized.

turns.narrative: In the darkest corner of the newly abandoned rat-nest, you spot the dull glint of tarnished metal. Approaching, you realize it belongs to the skeletal remnants of the silo maintenance worker who went missing last month, his bones completely picked clean and wrapped in dead ivy.
turns.choice_a: Sift through the nest
turns.consequence_a: You carefully dig through the foul-smelling debris of the nest and recover a heavy 'Ridge-Walker's Signet' ring, alongside a small leather pouch containing a handful of uncorroded silver coins.
turns.choice_b: Burn the infestation with oil
turns.consequence_b: You douse the entire nesting area in heavy lamp oil and set it ablaze. You ensure that the synthetic ivy and the corrupted rodents have absolutely no refuge to return to once you leave.
turns.convergence: With the interior secured, you climb the rusted iron ladder to the upper ventilation grates to assess the exterior perimeter and prevent any immediate re-emergence.

turns.narrative: The moon is setting, casting long, bruised shadows across the agricultural sector. To ensure this infestation is truly eradicated, you must treat the soil surrounding the silo's foundation, neutralizing the latent synthetic spores before they can germinate at dawn.
turns.choice_a: Spread quick-lime around the silo foundation
turns.consequence_a: You heavily distribute caustic quick-lime across the damp earth. The violent chemical pH shift instantly kills the remaining subterranean root-nodes, leaving a dead, barren ring of absolute safety around the silo.
turns.choice_b: Install 'Glow-Warding' lamps on the exterior
turns.consequence_b: You mount high-intensity mana-lamps around the perimeter. The piercing light acts as a modern repellant against the nocturnal blight, though the constant drain severely depletes your portable battery reserves.
turns.convergence: As the perimeter is secured, the local farm-foreman, a ragged man named Harlen, approaches cautiously with a flickering lantern and a look of desperate, terrified hope.

turns.narrative: Harlen stares at the smoking, ruined ivy and back to you. He hands you a small, heavy pouch of silver, his hands shaking noticeably. He knows better than anyone that these silos are the settlement's lifeblood, and you have just pulled them back from the brink of total starvation.
turns.choice_a: Accept the coin (50 Gold)
turns.consequence_a: You take the heavy pouch without hesitation. You performed dangerous, highly specialized labor, and the transaction is cleanly concluded. The gold is a necessary buffer against the harsh realities of the ward.
turns.choice_b: Decline the coin but take the 'Star-Ivy' samples
turns.consequence_b: You refuse his silver, instead securely packing several viable samples of the synthetic ivy into your kit. Your reputation for selfless effectiveness grows significantly, and you secure a rare, highly potent alchemical ingredient.
turns.convergence: With the grain secured and the immediate threat burned to ash, you leave the foreman to survey his surviving crop. Quest Complete.

conclusion: The synthetic ivy infestation is burned out, and the grain supply is secured. The discovery that the rats were deliberately cultivating the hazard hints at an organizing intelligence behind the ward's vermin, elevating them from pests to an active, engineered threat.

risk_matrix.penalty: Crop failure spreads. -2 Settlement Food stocks and -1 Health for the Refugee camp.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Scourge-fog event active

location: The Ember-Wreck Wastes — South of Settlement

title: The Missing Courier
description: An iron-bound messenger from the Lower Ward mines has vanished in the 'Dusty Mile' canyon.

turns.narrative: The 'Dusty Mile' is a jagged scar in the Ridge, where the wind screams like a banshee through the narrow gaps. Footprints in the silt are partially obscured by fresh sand.
turns.choice_a: Follow the boot-scuffs (Survival DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You find signs of a struggle—drag marks leading behind a massive boulder. (+1 Clue)
turns.choice_b: Shout the courier's name into the wind
turns.consequence_b: Failure: The echo alerts the vultures above—and the men who hunt with them. (-1 Stealth)
turns.convergence: You find the courier's leather satchel, sliced open and bleeding loose parchment.

turns.narrative: The sand here is stained a deep, rusty red. The missing reports were about 'The Iron-Tongue Merchants'.
turns.choice_a: Quick-read the scattered reports (Investigation DC 11)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You find a list of pay-offs to the Wardens. Corruption runs deep. (+1 Intel)
turns.choice_b: Secures the loose mail immediately
turns.consequence_b: Success: You gather the evidence before the wind can claim it. (+1 Item)
turns.convergence: A whistling sound—an arrow thuds into the sand inches from your boot.

turns.narrative: Iron-Tongue Mercenaries line the canyon rim. They wear the colors of the Trade Guild, but their eyes are the cold gray of professional killers.
turns.choice_a: Demand their surrender (Intimidation DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: They hesitate, unnerved by your steel. (+1 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Roll for the shade of a rock shelf (Stealth DC 12)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You disappear into the shadows, making them waste their next volley.
turns.convergence: Their leader, a scarred veteran with a notched axe, shouts: 'Give up the satchel and walk, or stay and rot!'

turns.narrative: The mercenaries have closed the exits. You are pinned in the canyon floor while they prepare to charge.
turns.choice_a: Return fire with your ranged weapon (AC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You take down a lookout, causing the others to shift cover. (+1 Tactical Adv)
turns.choice_b: Hunker behind your shield and advance (Str DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You cross the kill-zone, the arrows clattering harmlessly off your guard. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: You reach the base of the canyon wall where the trail leads up to their camp.

turns.narrative: The path up is steep and slick with loose shale. The mercenaries are rolling boulders down to crush you.
turns.choice_a: Scale the vertical flank (Athletics DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You ascend the impossible wall, emerging behind their line. (+Combat Advantage)
turns.choice_b: Sunder the boulders with magic or steel
turns.consequence_b: Success: You shatter the rocks into gravel, clearing your path. (+1 Morale)
turns.convergence: You crest the ridge. The camp is set in a cave mouth, where the courier is chained to an ore-grinder.

turns.narrative: The Scarred Leader lunges, his notched axe swinging in a wide, decapitating arc.
turns.choice_a: Disarm him mid-swing (Str Save vs DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You catch his handle and twist; the axe clatters into the abyss below. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Lethal riposte (Attack AC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: Your blade finds a gap in his plate. He stumbles back, clutching his side.
turns.convergence: The mercenaries retreat as their leader falls. The courier, a young man named Elian, gasps for air.

turns.narrative: Elian's legs are crushed by the grinder. He tries to point to the cave's inner depths.
turns.choice_a: Free Elian immediately
turns.consequence_a: Success: You break the chains. Elian is safe, but his legs are useless. (+1 Rep)
turns.choice_b: Interrogate the dying Leader (Insight DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: He coughs up a name: 'The Silent Merchant' in the High Ward. (+1 Intel)
turns.convergence: You have the courier and the documents, but the canyon is filling with a desert storm.

turns.narrative: The sandstorm reduces visibility to three feet. You must navigate the 'Dusty Mile' with a wounded man on your back.
turns.choice_a: Apply a 'Quick-Heal' or Medicine (DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: Elian's pain recedes enough for him to help guide you. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Brute-force the carry (Strength DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You trudge through the biting sand, your muscles burning. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: You reach the canyon mouth as the militia arrives with torches and steel.

turns.narrative: The Captain of the Guard looks at the bloody satchel. He knows what's inside.
turns.choice_a: Hand over the satchel to the Militia
turns.consequence_a: Success: You choose justice. The Iron-Tongue merchants are arrested by morning. (+2 Rep)
turns.choice_b: Demand a 'delivery fee' before relinquishing the logs
turns.consequence_b: Success: The Captain scowls but pays. You gain gold, but lose his trust. (+75 Gold)
turns.convergence: The courier is taken to the apothecary. The reports are processed.

turns.narrative: The Iron-Tongue plot involved sabotaging the mines to drive down prices. You are given a choice in the final deposition.
turns.choice_a: Testify against the Merchant Guild
turns.consequence_a: Success: The merchants are stripped of their licenses. (+3 Influence)
turns.choice_b: Take a bribe to 'misplace' certain names
turns.consequence_b: Success: You gain a massive payout, but the corruption continues. (+250 Gold, -5 Morale)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: Elian will never walk again, but his life was spared, and the Iron-Tongue conspiracy has been hamstrung—for now.

risk_matrix.penalty: Courier dies. -1 Settlement Stability and a 'Bribe' of 50 Gold is taken from the treasury to keep the incident quiet.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Council reports missing supply convoy

title: The Rat King's Crown
description: A massive, deliberate blockage of 'shining refuse' has critically jammed the main arterial drain of the High Ward. Scout teams sent to clear it report organized resistance and 'voices in the dark.' The party must navigate the effluent tunnels, breach the barricade made of stolen noble wealth, and confront the Rat King—a horrifyingly intelligent, augmented escapee from Concordat-era experiments who demands a life-price for the city's flow.

turns.narrative: The primary sewers of Warden-Keep are a sprawling labyrinth of weeping stone, rusted iron grates, and the suffocating smell of ancient, undisturbed decay. The blockage ahead is not merely accumulated trash; it is a meticulously constructed, structural dam built entirely from the stolen silver, jewelry, and polished bone of the Upper Ward.
turns.choice_a: Navigate the effluent flow (Con Save DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: You grit your teeth and wade waist-deep into the dark sludge. You manage to keep your footing in the oily water, successfully avoiding the toxic sickness lurking within the sluggish, contaminated flow.
turns.choice_b: Apply a sweet-smelling oil to your mask
turns.consequence_b: You smear a thick paste of concentrated jasmine oil under your nose. The overwhelming floral scent completely masks the harsh ammonia, keeping your head incredibly clear and your stomach stable.
turns.convergence: You finally reach the edge of the cavernous main cistern, where millions of small, yellow eyes reflect your light, watching you in absolute silence from the shadows overhead.

turns.narrative: The structural 'dam' is built entirely from the stolen wealth that the High Ward didn't realize it had lost. You see gold rings, silver spoons, and even a heavy ceremonial mace expertly woven into the sludge to provide load-bearing support. This is engineering, not hoarding.
turns.choice_a: Inspect the markings on the silver (Investigation DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: You wipe a tarnished silver platter clean. You instantly recognize the pristine crest of House Valerius—this wasn't opportunistic theft, it was a highly targeted, organized raid on a specific noble vault.
turns.choice_b: Sunder the blockade with a heavy pick (Strength DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: You bring a heavy pickaxe down on the keystone of the dam. The structure shatters, releasing a massive torrent of trapped water alongside a deafening, incredibly angry chorus of rat squeaks.
turns.convergence: As the water rapidly recedes, pulling the silver with it, a massive albino rat, easily the size of a fully grown mountain lion, steps slowly into the center of the light.

turns.narrative: The Rat King does not look natural. It wears a grotesque crown of fused copper wire physically bolted into its skull, and a glowing sapphire ring is clamped around its foreleg. Its tail is a heavy silver chain. It doesn't hiss; it projects a voice directly into your mind, thick and resonant.
turns.choice_a: Offer a tribute of dried meat (Animal Handling DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: You slowly toss a heavily salted slab of high-quality meat forward. The creature's primal hunger momentarily overrides its intelligence; it feeds, and the crushing psychic pressure in your head immediately relaxes.
turns.choice_b: Intimidate the 'Abomination' with fire
turns.consequence_b: You brandish an intensely burning torch, sweeping it aggressively. The lesser rats cower in terror, but their King does not flinch. Its red eyes burn with a deeply human, hateful intelligence.
turns.convergence: The Rat King's voice echoes brutally in your skull: 'The surface-men take the sun. We are owed the shine. Balance, little knight. We maintain the balance.'

turns.narrative: The Rat King demands a strict 'Life-Price' for removing the blockage and allowing the city's waste to flow again. It requires either a massive tribute of untarnished silver, or the literal blood of a High Ward citizen freely given. It considers both to be of perfectly equivalent value.
turns.choice_a: Negotiate for a partnership (Insight DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: You carefully appeal to its obvious strategic intelligence, convincing it that a cleanly flowing sewer provides better long-term security for its kingdom than a stagnant pool. It slowly agrees to clear the path.
turns.choice_b: Strike at the King's copper crown
turns.consequence_b: You predictably lunge for the visible hardware. The copper crown instantly acts as a defensive focusing lens, blasting your mind with a physical wave of pure, agonizing psychic feedback that drops you to your knees.
turns.convergence: Whether insulted or realizing the negotiation is a stalling tactic, millions of smaller rats begin to swarm the walls, forming a literal, living carpet of vibrating fur and teeth.

turns.narrative: The 'Rat-Swarm' does not attack as individual vermin. It acts as a single, massive organism—a tidal wave of unified hunger that attempts to physically drag you down into the darkest, deepest water of the cistern.
turns.choice_a: Unleash an explosive alchemy/spell
turns.consequence_a: You hurl a highly volatile explosive charge directly into the center of the mass. The swarm is violently scattered in a deafening flash of heat and concussive sound, breaking their coordinated assault.
turns.choice_b: Target the 'Neural Nodes' (Perception DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: You quickly identify the slightly larger rats exhibiting the glowing copper wiring. You strike these 'neural nodes' precisely, causing the entire swarm network to instantly collapse in chaotic confusion.
turns.convergence: With the swarm broken and scattered, the Rat King is suddenly left isolated, cornered aggressively against the rusted iron bars of the main sluice gate.

turns.narrative: Cornered, the Rat King rears up onto its hind legs, fully exposing a pale belly horribly scarred by complex human surgical experimentation. This creature is not a magical monster; it is a brilliant, tortured escapee from a laboratory that existed long before the Scourge.
turns.choice_a: Offer mercy and a sanctuary (Persuasion DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: You lower your weapon and speak with genuine calm. The King slowly lowers its head, accepting your mercy. In exchange, it points a scarred claw toward a completely hidden access lever behind the heavy gate.
turns.choice_b: Lethal execution for the good of the Keep
turns.consequence_b: You strike without hesitation, severing the creature's head. You end the intelligent threat once and for all. The leaderless rats scatter immediately, ensuring they will never organize to this degree again.
turns.convergence: Regardless of its fate, you approach the massive creature and retrieve the glowing sapphire ring clamped to its leg. It is deeply enchanted—a 'Band of the Tides.'

turns.narrative: With the main sluice gate finally open, the effluent begins to drain aggressively. Behind the gate, you find the true source of the stolen refuse: a perfectly circular, cleanly bored secret tunnel leading directly under the Royal Bank's deepest vaults.
turns.choice_a: Scout the tunnel entrance
turns.consequence_a: You carefully investigate the bore-hole. You find undeniable signs of modern, extremely precise excavation equipment. Someone is using the intelligent rat infestation as a perfect cover for a massive heist.
turns.choice_b: Seal the tunnel with rubble (Strength DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: You use heavy iron beams to collapse the tunnel entrance entirely. You ensure that absolutely no future bank heists can be conducted from this specific subterranean angle, securing the High Ward's wealth.
turns.convergence: You finally emerge from a heavy iron manhole near the High Ward's central square, thoroughly soaked in foul sewer-water but undeniably victorious in your objective.

turns.narrative: The High Ward sewage workers, gathered nervously around the manhole, are terrified of your smell but incredibly grateful for the restoration of service. The veteran Head Scout pulls you aside to offer a quiet token of profound appreciation.
turns.choice_a: Accept the 'Sewer-Scout' Cape
turns.consequence_a: You graciously accept a rugged, heavily oiled waterproof cape. It is perfectly designed to help maintain absolute stealth while moving through wet, echoing Sub-Ward environments.
turns.choice_b: Ask for the story of the missing experiments
turns.consequence_b: You press him for rumors. He looks around nervously and whispers about a 'Doctor Vane,' a brilliant, horrifying man who supposedly conducted horrific biological experiments in the deepest pits before the Scourge fell.
turns.convergence: In your pocket, the heavy sapphire ring pulses with a rhythmic, cool energy. It seems to faintly recognize the proximity of the city's central mana-grid.

turns.narrative: The City Council formally summons you. They demand a complete report on the 'Rat Threat' to determine budget allocation. How you frame this intelligence will heavily decide the immediate fate of the sewers and the public's perception.
turns.choice_a: Frame it as a natural infestation
turns.consequence_a: You report it as a simple, unusually large natural blockage. The council immediately orders a general, mundane cleaning. Safety briefly increases, though the underlying, intelligent threat remains thoroughly hidden.
turns.choice_b: Reveal the Rat King's intelligence
turns.consequence_b: You detail the copper wiring and organized sentience. The council is utterly horrified, immediately ordering a heavily militarized purge of all subterranean life, causing massive panic and plunging ward morale.
turns.convergence: The political maneuvering concludes. The High Ward arterial drain flow is fully restored to 100% operational capacity, removing the immediate civic crisis.

turns.narrative: Before resting, you must make a final decision regarding the highly enchanted 'Band of the Tides' sapphire ring you recovered from the King. It bears noble markings but holds significant magical power that could aid your survival.
turns.choice_a: Return it to House Valerius
turns.consequence_a: You formally hand the valuable heirloom over to the noble house. They are eternally grateful for its return, immediately offering you a highly coveted, permanent seat at their political table.
turns.choice_b: Keep it for its Water-Walking enchantment
turns.consequence_b: You slip the powerful ring onto your own finger. You sacrifice massive political influence, but gain a continuous, highly rare tool that will prove invaluable when navigating the flooded sectors of the wastes.
turns.convergence: With your rewards chosen and the drain flowing clearly beneath the city, the operation concludes. Quest Complete.

conclusion: The High Ward drain is cleared, and the Rat King is dealt with. However, the discovery of his copper-wire crown and the obvious signs of organized, intelligent malice among the vermin prove that the rats are not acting on animal instinct, but on a terrifying, inherited sentience.

risk_matrix.penalty: Disease outbreak. -2 Settlement Health and a loss of -5% Trade income for the next week.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Reports of aberrant behavior in the Hollow

mercy_path.description: Offer mercy and sanctuary to Rat King

consequences.random_encounters: Rat King may appear as ally in future conflicts

justice_path.description: Execute Rat King for the good of Warden-Keep

consequences.random_encounters: Rats in city become permanently hostile

title: The Silent Smithy
description: The Great Forges of Warden-Keep have gone cold. The Master Smith’s main bellows-core has been sabotaged.

turns.narrative: The forge is usually the heart of the settlement—a place of heat and noise. Today, it is as cold as a tomb. Master Smith Korgun sits by the silent anvils, his face buried in soot-stained hands.
turns.choice_a: Examine the Bellows-Core for signs of oil (Investigation DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You find a trace of 'Night-Shade Oil', a substance used by the High Ward assassins. (+1 Clue)
turns.choice_b: Rally the exhausted smiths (Persuasion DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: They reveal that a hooded figure was seen leaving through the coal-chute. (+1 Morale)
turns.convergence: The sabotage was precise, designed to paralyze the settlement’s weapon production.

turns.narrative: A trail of coal-dust leads from the smithy toward the Trade District. You find a dropped pouch—it contains coins from the rival city-state of Oakhaven.
turns.choice_a: Track the dust-prints (Survival DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You trace the culprit to the back alley of 'Iron-Tooth’s Imports'. (+1 Clue)
turns.choice_b: Question the coal merchants
turns.consequence_b: Success: They describe a man named Silas, a disgruntled former apprentice. (+1 Intel)
turns.convergence: The trail of sabotage is leading toward a corporate rivalry that has turned lethal.

turns.narrative: Iron-Tooth’s shop is a facade for a smuggling ring. Two guards in unmarked leather stand by the door, their hands resting on the pommels of their shortswords.
turns.choice_a: Bribe your way in (25 Gold)
turns.consequence_a: Success: They pocket the coin and look the other way. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Infiltrate via the roof-vent (Stealth DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You drop into the rafters, unseen by the thugs below. (+1 Tactical Adv)
turns.convergence: Inside, you see Silas delivering a crate of stolen blueprints to a man in a velvet mask.

turns.narrative: The Velvet-Masked Man is 'The Merchant Lord'. He is examining the blueprints for Warden-Keep’s new 'Siege-Buster' ballistae.
turns.choice_a: Confront them from the shadows (Intimidation DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: Silas panics, knocking over a stack of crates and creating an opening. (+1 Tactical Adv)
turns.choice_b: Assassinate Silas before he speaks
turns.consequence_b: Success: You remove the liability, but the Merchant Lord calls for his personal guard. (Combat Initiated)
turns.convergence: Four heavy guards in Oakhaven plate encircle your position.

turns.narrative: The guards move as a unit, their shields overlapping. These aren't common thugs; they are disciplined specialists.
turns.choice_a: Target the shield-gaps (Dex DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You find the openings, staggering their line. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Use a 'Thunder-Clap' spell/item to break the formation
turns.consequence_b: Success: The guards are sent flying, their heavy armor their own undoing. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Merchant Lord tries to flee with the blueprints through a secret bookshelf-door.

turns.narrative: The blueprints are more than just designs; they contain the frequency-codes for the settlement’s shields.
turns.choice_a: Tackle the Merchant Lord (Athletics DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You pin him to the floor, the documents spilling across the rug. (+1 Item)
turns.choice_b: Ignite the blueprints from range
turns.consequence_b: Success: You destroy the secrets so they can't be used, but lose the evidence. (+1 Morale)
turns.convergence: With the guards defeated and the Lord captured, you retrieve the stolen Bellows-Core.

turns.narrative: You return to the forge with the core, but the City Watch blocks your path—they claim they have orders to seize 'illegal artifacts'.
turns.choice_a: Show the Master Smith’s seal (Persuasion DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The Watch realizes they were following a corrupt officer’s orders. (+1 Influence)
turns.choice_b: Bluff your way through (Deception DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You convince them you are delivering 'urgent medical supplies'.
turns.convergence: You reach Korgun just as the final ember in the forge is about to die.

turns.narrative: Installing the bellows-core is an act of engineering as much as strength. The metal is still superheated from the oil.
turns.choice_a: Assist in the install (Dexterity DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You guide the core into place perfectly. The first blast of air makes the fire roar. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Pour 'Cool-Water' on the joints
turns.consequence_b: Failure: The sudden temperature shift cracks the casing. (-1 Resource)
turns.convergence: The forge returns to life, the rhythm of the hammers starting like a heartbeat.

turns.narrative: Master Smith Korgun is overjoyed. He offers you a choice of the finest steel currently cooling in the rack.
turns.choice_a: Take the 'Dusk-Iron' Shortsword (+1)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You gain a masterwork weapon of exceptional balance. (+1 Rare Gear)
turns.choice_b: Ask for the 'Smith's Secret' technique
turns.consequence_b: Success: You learn how to maintain your gear in the field. (+1 Permanent Skill)
turns.convergence: The settlement's defense production is back on schedule.

turns.narrative: The Merchant Lord awaits trial. His connections could be useful, or his silence could be justice.
turns.choice_a: Turn him over for public execution
turns.consequence_a: Success: Your reputation for justice is cemented. (+5 Reputation)
turns.choice_b: Exile him in exchange for a 'Shadow-Tithes' agreement
turns.consequence_b: Success: You gain a steady stream of Oakhaven intel and gold. (+Gold/Turn, +1 Intel)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Silent Smithy speaks once more. The plot to sell Warden-Keep's shield frequencies has been thwarted, but Oakhaven's interest in the settlement is now undeniable.

risk_matrix.penalty: The forge remains silent. -3 Settlement Production and -5% to all Military defense scores until fixed.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with significant consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Tavern rumors about missing livestock

title: The Glass Sentry
description: A deactivated pre-Scourge guardian has been unearthed in the 'Wailing Sands'. It is bleeding a viscous blue fluid.

turns.narrative: The 'Wailing Sands' earn their name from the wind whistling through the porous red rock. The Sentry is half-buried, its translucent glass frame reflecting the harsh sun in blinding, prismatic streaks.
turns.choice_a: Siphon the blue fluid (Investigation DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You collect 'Liquid Chronos'. It feels like time is slowing down around the vial. (+1 Rare Material)
turns.choice_b: Scrape the sand from its ocular sensors
turns.consequence_b: Success: The glass eye flickers with a low, amber light. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Sentry’s internal processors grind with the sound of breaking ice.

turns.narrative: The Sentry’s torso is etched with coordinates that match no modern map. A panel on its chest contains a series of star-charts.
turns.choice_a: Sync your 'World-Spark' with its core (Arcana DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: A holographic map of the Old World projects into the dust. (+1 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Reinforce the glass frame with steel braces (Engineering DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The structure stabilizes, preventing a collapse. (+1 Stability)
turns.convergence: Suddenly, a series of clicks emanates from the surrounding dunes—Scourge-Strider ambush.

turns.narrative: Scourge-Striders—spindly, multi-legged horrors—emerge from the sand. They are attracted to the Sentry’s leaking energy.
turns.choice_a: Activate the Sentry's defensive pulse
turns.consequence_a: Success: A wave of blue energy vaporizes the nearest Strider. (+1 Tactical Adv)
turns.choice_b: Form a defensive circle (Athletics DC 12)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You hold the line, your steel clashing against their obsidian carapaces.
turns.convergence: The Striders' leader, a massive 'Grave-Walker', screeches from the ridge.

turns.narrative: The Grave-Walker is a patchwork of bone and shadow. It targets the Sentry’s exposed core with a beam of necrotic energy.
turns.choice_a: Reflect the beam with your shield (Dex Save DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The beam bounces back, blinding the Grave-Walker. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Interpose yourself to protect the artifact
turns.consequence_b: Failure: Your armor is scorched. (-10 HP)
turns.convergence: The Sentry begins to stand, its glass limbs moving with a slow, crystalline grace.

turns.narrative: The Sentry is now fully active, but its logic centers are damaged. It sees everything—you included—as a threat from the 'Era of Silence'.
turns.choice_a: Recite the ancient 'Loyalty Frequency' (Insight DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The Sentry’s eyes turn from red to blue. It identifies you as 'Command'. (+1 Powerful Ally)
turns.choice_b: Strike the reset button on its neck (Sleight of Hand DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The Sentry shuts down safely, its secrets preserved. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: The Grave-Walker lunges for a final, desperate strike.

turns.narrative: The Grave-Walker's claws are made of 'Shatter-Steel', designed to penetrate even the strongest glass.
turns.choice_a: Parry and Riposte (Str Save DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You shatter its claw and bury your blade in its core. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Evade into the sand-fog (Stealth DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The creature misses, and the Sentry crushes it under a crystalline fist.
turns.convergence: The Grave-Walker dissolves into black dust. The sands go silent.

turns.narrative: The Sentry stands in the center of the battlefield. It offers its right hand, which contains a data-shard.
turns.choice_a: Take the Data-Shard
turns.consequence_a: Success: You possess the blueprints for 'Glass-Plate' armor. (+1 Rare Schema)
turns.choice_b: Instruct it to defend the Oasis Mines
turns.consequence_b: Success: The Sentry marches away, increasing settlement defense. (+3 Defense)
turns.convergence: The sandstorm begins to bury the site once more.

turns.narrative: You return to the settlement with the Sentry's 'Chrono-Fluid'. The alchemists are in awe of its properties.
turns.choice_a: Sell the fluid to the Trade Guild (200 Gold)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You gain a massive payout. (+200 Gold)
turns.choice_b: Use it to create a 'Static-Field' for the hospital
turns.consequence_b: Success: Patients heal twice as fast. (+2 Settlement Health)
turns.convergence: The Council hears of your discovery in the Sands.

turns.narrative: A representative from Oakhaven offers to 'buy' the Sentry's coordinates from you.
turns.choice_a: Decline with a warning (Intimidation DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: They retreat, though they will surely watch you. (+1 Influence)
turns.choice_b: Agree to a joint expedition
turns.consequence_b: Success: You gain resources, but lose the Sentry’s exclusivity. (+1 Resource, -1 Security)
turns.convergence: The Sentry’s internal clock has been reset to the modern day.

turns.narrative: You stand on the ridge, looking back at the Wailing Sands. Something has changed in the frequency of the wind.
turns.choice_a: Record the new 'Wind-Frequency' (Insight DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You find a pattern that leads to the 'City of Glass'. (+1 Secret)
turns.choice_b: Ponder the Sentry's warning: 'The Silence returns.'
turns.consequence_b: Success: You gain a deep understanding of the Scourge's cycle. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Glass Sentry is no longer an artifact of the past, but a guardian of the future. The secrets of the Wailing Sands are beginning to surface.

risk_matrix.penalty: The Sentry self-destructs. -1 Settlement Morale and a permanent -2 to all future 'Sand Search' rolls.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Merchant guild petitions Council about smuggling
unlock_conditions.event_trigger: Player has witnessed time-skip phenomenon in North-Ward

title: The Poisoned Well
description: The 'Deep-Well' of the Lower Ward has been tainted with a slow-acting paralysis toxin. Panic is rising.

turns.narrative: The Lower Ward is a chaotic mess of coughing citizens and frantic water-bearers. The well itself is surrounded by City Watch, their iron-shod boots splashing in the spilled, oily water.
turns.choice_a: Taste the water (Con Save DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: Your iron stomach identifies the toxin: 'Spider-Root Pulp'. (+1 Clue)
turns.choice_b: Inspect the bucket mechanism (Investigation DC 12)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find a small, deliberately placed pouch of roots tied to the rope. (+1 Clue)
turns.convergence: Someone wanted the Lower Ward immobile, not dead.

turns.narrative: Spider-Root grows only in the 'Sunless Alcoves'—the territory of the 'Silk-Hand' gang.
turns.choice_a: Interrogate the local water-merchant (Intimidation DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: He admits he was paid to 'look away' for five minutes last night. (+1 Intel)
turns.choice_b: Follow the trail of wet footprints (Survival DC 12)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The prints lead into the cellar of the 'Rusty Spoke' tavern. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Rusty Spoke is a known Silk-Hand safehouse.

turns.narrative: The tavern is quiet—too quiet. The patrons are all Silk-Hand enforcers, their hands hidden beneath the tables.
turns.choice_a: Order a drink and listen (Insight DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You overhear plans for a 'Grand Heist' while the guards are sick. (+1 Intel)
turns.choice_b: Intimidate the bartender (Str DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: He coughs up the key to the back room. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: A massive enforcer named 'The Bruiser' stands up, blocking the exit.

turns.narrative: The Bruiser cracks his knuckles. He carries a club wrapped in barbed wire.
turns.choice_a: Sweeping Kick (Dex vs DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: He falls like a felled oak, his head hitting the floor with a satisfying thud. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Brawl him (Str vs DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You trade blows, eventually overwhelming him with sheer grit.
turns.convergence: With the Bruiser down, the rest of the gang flees through the windows.

turns.narrative: In the back room, you find several crates of 'Spider-Root' and a map of the Royal Bank’s ventilation system.
turns.choice_a: Seize the map and evidence
turns.consequence_a: Success: You have proof of the Silk-Hand’s plan. (+1 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Set fire to the stock of roots
turns.consequence_b: Success: You prevent any future poisoning, but the smoke alerts the rest of the ward. (+1 Morale)
turns.convergence: A hidden door in the floor reveals the gang leader, 'Silk-Eyes' Sarah.

turns.narrative: Sarah is armed with hand-crossbows tipped with the same poison. She isn’t interested in talking.
turns.choice_a: Disarm with a well-aimed throw (Dex DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You knock the crossbow from her hand. (+1 Tactical Adv)
turns.choice_b: Hide behind a heavy table for cover
turns.consequence_b: Success: The bolts thud into the wood. You close the distance. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: Sarah retreats into the sewers beneath the tavern.

turns.narrative: The sewers are a labyrinth. Sarah is faster here, using the pipes like a jungle gym.
turns.choice_a: Predict her path (Insight DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You cut her off at the primary junction. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Light a flare to flush her out
turns.consequence_b: Success: She screams as the bright light ruins her 'Silk-Eyes' night vision.
turns.convergence: Sarah is cornered. She offers the 'Antidote' in exchange for her freedom.

turns.narrative: The antidote is a blue vial. The poisoning is progressing; dozens of children in the Ward will be paralyzed for life without it.
turns.choice_a: Agree to the deal
turns.consequence_a: Success: You take the antidote, and Sarah vanishes. (+1 Item, -2 Reputation)
turns.choice_b: Snatch the vial and arrest her (Sleight of Hand DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You have both the criminal and the cure. (+5 Influence, +1 Item)
turns.convergence: You race back to the well as the sun begins to set.

turns.narrative: The Ward Physician is losing hope. You arrive with the blue vial just in time.
turns.choice_a: Distribute the cure personally
turns.consequence_a: Success: The grateful families cheer your name. (+5 Morale, +3 Reputation)
turns.choice_b: Hand the cure to the Physician and leave
turns.consequence_b: Success: You prefer to work in the shadows. (+1 Influence)
turns.convergence: The poisoning event is over, but the Silk-Hand gang is now your sworn enemy.

turns.narrative: The well is scrubbed and purified. The Lower Ward returns to its busy, noisy self.
turns.choice_a: Demand the City Watch increase patrols
turns.consequence_a: Success: Security increases. (+1 Security)
turns.choice_b: Interview Silk-Eyes Sarah in her cell
turns.consequence_b: Success: She reveals the bank heist wasn't for gold, but for 'The Warden’s Ledger'. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Deep-Well is safe. The Silk-Hand's plot was thwarted, but the revelation of the 'Warden’s Ledger' suggests a traitor high in the Council.

risk_matrix.penalty: Mass paralysis. -4 Settlement Labor and -2 Settlement Health for two weeks.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Refugee camp reports sickness outbreak
unlock_conditions.event_trigger: Player has consumed Void-Wine and witnessed its effects

permanent_effects.settlement: -5 die-off if cured in time; +1 Population

branching_outcomes.result: Outbreak slows but recurs in 2 weeks

title: The Lost Expedition
description: A group of 'Ley-Line Seekers' has vanished in the 'Singing Gorges'. They were carrying a portable World-Spark tuner.

turns.narrative: The 'Singing Gorges' hum with a dissonant, bone-vibrating sound. The air is thick with a yellow haze that tastes of sulfur and ancient dust.
turns.choice_a: Listen for the dissonance (Insight DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You isolate a human scream hidden within the gorge's song. (+1 Clue)
turns.choice_b: Use a 'Frequency-Tuner' (Item)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The needle points toward a cave mouth higher up the cliff. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: You find the remains of their basecamp—tents shredded from the inside out.

turns.narrative: The camp is covered in Frost-Burned markings. These aren't animal tracks; they are glyph-prints left by 'Echo-Ghouls'.
turns.choice_a: Identify the glyphs (Arcana DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: These ghouls feed on the memories of those who die in the gorge. (+1 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Search the shredded tents (Investigation DC 12)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find a journal detailing a 'Massive Frequency Spike' from the cave. (+1 Clue)
turns.convergence: A voice calls out from the dark of the cave—familiar, yet hollow.

turns.narrative: It is the voice of Elara, the expedition leader. She stands at the cave's edge, but her movements are jerky, like a marionette.
turns.choice_a: Approach with your 'Holy-Light' or torch
turns.consequence_a: Success: The light reveals three Echo-Ghouls clinging to her back. (+1 Tactical Adv)
turns.choice_b: Call out to her (Persuasion DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Failure: The Ghouls sense your empathy and lunge.
turns.convergence: The Ghouls are translucent, flickering in and out of phase with reality.

turns.narrative: Echo-Ghouls are immune to normal steel while phased out. You must strike when they solidify to feed.
turns.choice_a: Wait for the 'Feeding Phase' (Perception DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You time your strike perfectly, cleaving a Ghoul in two. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Imbue your blade with magic/spirit
turns.consequence_b: Success: Your weapon glows, tearing through the ethereal forms. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Ghouls shriek in a frequency that hurts your ears, fleeing back into the cave.

turns.narrative: Elara is comatose, but her 'World-Spark Tuner' is still active, pulsing with a dangerous violet energy.
turns.choice_a: Calibrate the Tuner (Intelligence DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The tuner stabilizes, acting as a beacon for other survivors. (+1 Item)
turns.choice_b: Drag Elara to safety (Strength DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You carry her out just as the cave ceiling begins to vibrate violently. (+1 Morale)
turns.convergence: Deep in the cave, a 'Frequency-Abomination'—a mass of sound and shadow—begins to emerge.

turns.narrative: The Abomination is the source of the Singing Gorges' power. It radiates a 'Sorrow-Aura' that triggers your worst memories.
turns.choice_a: Focus on your duty (Wis Save DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You push through the mental noise, your resolve hardening. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Attack the Abomination's core
turns.consequence_b: Failure: Your blade passes through the sound, dealing no damage.
turns.convergence: The Tuner in your hand begins to glow. It can be used to 'shatter' the sound-beast.

turns.narrative: The Abomination lunges, its mass vibrating so fast it looks like a blur of gray static.
turns.choice_a: Overload the Tuner (Dex DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: A blast of pure, white frequency shatters the Abomination into harmless echoes. (+500 XP)
turns.choice_b: Lead it toward the cave exit
turns.consequence_b: Success: The natural sunlight weakens the creature, allowing a final strike. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Gorge falls silent for the first time in centuries.

turns.narrative: You find the rest of the Seekers trapped in a webbing of crystallized sound. They are weak, but alive.
turns.choice_a: Free them with the Tuner
turns.consequence_a: Success: You rescue the entire team. They offer you their 'Seeker’s Compass'. (+1 Item)
turns.choice_b: Harvest the 'Sound-Crystals'
turns.consequence_b: Success: They can be used as high-energy batteries. (+3 Resources)
turns.convergence: Elara wakes up, her eyes clear. She remembers a 'Hidden Gate' deeper in the Gorge.

turns.narrative: The Hidden Gate is sealed with a frequency-lock that requires the Tuner. Elara asks if you want to open it.
turns.choice_a: Open the Gate (DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You discover a vault containing 'Pre-Scourge Knowledge'. (+5 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Leave it sealed for the Council to decide
turns.consequence_b: Success: You choose caution. (+2 Reputation)
turns.convergence: The expedition returns to Warden-Keep as heroes.

turns.narrative: Back at the settlement, the Council is split on what to do with the Frequency-Abomination's remains.
turns.choice_a: Recommend weaponizing the tech
turns.consequence_a: Success: Settlement military increases, but at a cost to morale. (+5 Defense, -2 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Recommend destroying the tech
turns.consequence_b: Success: Morale rises as the threat is truly gone. (+5 Morale)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Ley-Line Seekers are safe, and the Singing Gorges have become the 'Silent Gorges'. The discovery of the pre-Scourge vault has changed everything.

risk_matrix.penalty: Expedition lost. -100 Reputation and -2 Settlement Lore progress.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Ley-Line Seekers send distress signal

location: The Singing Gorges — Far Eastern Frontier

title: The Bandit King's Toll
description: A group of self-styled 'Ridge-Lords' has blockaded the main trade road to the High Ward.

turns.narrative: The blockade is a wall of spikes and overturned wagons. In the center sits a man on a throne of rusted shields—the Bandit King, 'Iron-Jaw' Jax.
turns.choice_a: Negotiate a 'Trade Passport' (Charisma DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You convince him that a tax-paying road is better than a blockaded one. (+1 Stability)
turns.choice_b: Scout their flank for a weak point (Perception DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find their stores of oil are dangerously close to their barracks. (+1 Tactical Adv)
turns.convergence: Jax is not a common thug; he wears the armor of a fallen City Warden.

turns.narrative: Jax demands 10% of the settlement's monthly income or 'the head of the current High Warden'.
turns.choice_a: Refuse and challenge him to a duel
turns.consequence_a: Success: The bandits respect the old laws. A circle is formed. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Pay a 'One-Time' fee (100 Gold)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The road is cleared temporarily. (-100 Gold)
turns.convergence: Jax steps down from his throne, his giant 'Sunder-Mace' sparking against the stone.

turns.narrative: The duel is to first blood or yield. The bandits chant Jax’s name, their weapons beating a rhythm on their shields.
turns.choice_a: Defensive Stance (Str Save DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You weather the giant mace's impact, your shield arm numbing but holding. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Aggressive Lunge (Attack AC 16)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find a gap in his Warden-plate. Jax grunts in surprise. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: Jax laughs. 'You've got spirit, pup. But I've got the Ridge on my side!'

turns.narrative: Jax uses a smoke-bomb, the thick gray cloud filling the dueling circle. He moves with surprising silence for a man of his size.
turns.choice_a: Trust your ears (Insight DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You hear the air-displacement and duck. (+1 Tactical Adv)
turns.choice_b: Sweeping strike to clear the air
turns.consequence_b: Failure: You strike only smoke, leaving your back exposed. (-5 HP)
turns.convergence: Jax emerges from the fog behind you, his mace high.

turns.narrative: Jax’s mace misses your head by an inch, shattering a nearby wagon-wheel. He is breathing heavy now.
turns.choice_a: Disarm him (Str vs DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You twist the mace from his grip.jax falls to his knees. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Lethal execution during his recovery
turns.consequence_b: Success: You end the threat. The bandits disperse in fear. (+1 Rep)
turns.convergence: The Bandit King yields. He offers you his 'Ridge-Lord' ring as a sign of respect.

turns.narrative: With the King defeated, the Trade Road is open. Caravans begin to move again, their drivers giving you a wide berth.
turns.choice_a: Offer Jax a job in the City Guard
turns.consequence_a: Success: You gain a powerful, if untrustworthy, lieutenant. (+5 Defense, -2 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Exile Jax from the Ridge
turns.consequence_b: Success: He leaves, but his legend will grow in the wastes. (+3 Rep)
turns.convergence: You find a hidden stash of trade goods in the King’s throne.

turns.narrative: The stash contains 'Oakhaven Spices'—luxury items that have been missing for months.
turns.choice_a: Return the spices to the Merchant Guild
turns.consequence_a: Success: They reward you with a share of the profits. (+150 Gold)
turns.choice_b: Distribute the spices to the refugees
turns.consequence_b: Success: A rare taste of luxury boosts camp hope significantly. (+5 Morale)
turns.convergence: A Trade Envoy from the High Ward arrives, looking for Jax.

turns.narrative: The Envoy is clearly working with Jax. He realization that Jax is gone makes him reach for a hidden knife.
turns.choice_a: Subdue the traitor (Sleight of Hand DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You capture the man before he can react. (+1 Intel)
turns.choice_b: Bribe the Envoy for information (50 Gold)
turns.consequence_b: Success: He reveals the Trade Guild was 'paying' Jax to block certain rivals. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: The conspiracy is deeper than simple banditry.

turns.narrative: Back at the settlement, the Council asks for your final recommendation on a 'Permanent Road Guard'.
turns.choice_a: Establish 'The Ridge Rangers' militia
turns.consequence_a: Success: A dedicated force for the trade roads. (+2 Stability, -1 Resource/turn)
turns.choice_b: Hire the remaining Bandits as mercenaries
turns.consequence_b: Success: Cheap security, but high risk of corruption. (+1 Security)
turns.convergence: The Trade Road is now the 'Warden’s Way'.

turns.narrative: Final decision on Jax’s Sunder-Mace.
turns.choice_a: Keep it for yourself
turns.consequence_a: Success: You gain a weapon capable of shattering stone walls. (+1 Heavy Weapon)
turns.choice_b: Display it in the City Hall
turns.consequence_b: Success: A trophy of your triumph for all to see. (+5 Reputation)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Ridge-Lords are broken. Jax is either an ally or a memory, and the trade road is once again the lifeblood of Warden-Keep.

risk_matrix.penalty: Road remains blocked. -10 Settlement Income and -2 Morale.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Merchants report road blockade

location: The Ridgeback Trade Road — Iron-Jaw Pass

title: A Union of Ash
description: A Romeo & Juliet situation between a Miner's son and a Refugee's daughter.

turns.narrative: Fathers are arguing in the street. Violence imminent.
turns.choice_a: Intervene (Persuasion DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: Consperated.
turns.choice_b: Restrain them (Strength DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: Forced apart.
turns.convergence: Kids are missing.

turns.narrative: They ran away to the 'Old Chapel'.
turns.choice_a: Track them
turns.consequence_a: Found trail.
turns.choice_b: Ask friends
turns.consequence_b: Found location.
turns.convergence: Chapel is in a dangerous zone.

turns.narrative: Wolves prowling the path.
turns.choice_a: Fight wolves
turns.consequence_a: Combat.
turns.choice_b: Scare them off
turns.consequence_b: Success.
turns.convergence: Reach Chapel.

turns.narrative: Kids are cornered by a Bear.
turns.choice_a: Distract Bear
turns.consequence_a: Bear chases you.
turns.choice_b: Kill Bear
turns.consequence_b: Bear dead.
turns.convergence: Kids saved.

turns.narrative: They refuse to return. 'They won't let us be together.'
turns.choice_a: Counsel them (Insight DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: They listen.
turns.choice_b: Drag them back
turns.consequence_b: Failure: Resentment.
turns.convergence: You escort them back.

turns.narrative: Return to town. Fathers waiting.
turns.choice_a: Mediate truce
turns.consequence_a: Success: Temporary peace.
turns.choice_b: Scold fathers
turns.consequence_b: Success: Shamed them.
turns.convergence: Council gets involved.

turns.narrative: Council decision on Refugee integration.
turns.choice_a: Advocate for marriage
turns.consequence_a: Success: Union approved.
turns.choice_b: Suggest waiting
turns.consequence_b: Success: Keep peace.
turns.convergence: Tension diffuses.

turns.narrative: Wedding planning?
turns.choice_a: Help
turns.consequence_a: +Rep.
turns.choice_b: Leave
turns.consequence_b: Neutral.
turns.convergence: Events proceed.

turns.narrative: Wedding day / Ceremony.
turns.choice_a: Give gift
turns.consequence_a: -10 Gold.
turns.choice_b: attend
turns.consequence_b: Free food.
turns.convergence: Celebration.

turns.narrative: Quest Complete.
turns.choice_a: Accept thanks
turns.consequence_a: Heartwarming.
turns.choice_b: Demand payment
turns.consequence_b: +20 Gold.
turns.convergence: Unity increased.

conclusion: The union of the two families helps bridge the gap between Miners and Refugees.

risk_matrix.penalty: Couple runs away forever. -1 Population.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Fathers fighting in the market square

title: The Prophet of Geometrics
description: A man in the Market Square is screaming that the 'Sky is a Mosaic' and that the 'Weaver' is coming to reclaim the grout.

turns.narrative: The Prophet stands on a crate of rotten melons, his eyes rolled back so far they show only white. He is drawing perfect, glowing circles in the air with a finger that has been stripped of skin. The air smells of ozone and burnt hair.
turns.choice_a: Listen to the frequency of his chant (Insight DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The chant is a mathematical sequence that matches the settlement's defense perimeter. (+1 Secret)
turns.choice_b: Subdue him before the crowd panics (Athletics DC 12)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You tackle him, but he whispers 'The grout is dry' into your ear. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Prophet has a shifting ink tattoo on his forearm that is actually moving, flowing like liquid mercury.

turns.narrative: The tattoo is a map of the 'Grey-Spire' range, but it's actively updating. It shows a 'Void-Mass' approaching the town, represented by a black smudge that eats the ink.
turns.choice_a: Duplicate the map onto parchment (Dex DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You have a live tracking device for the coming storm. (+1 Intel)
turns.choice_b: Question his sanity in the guardhouse
turns.consequence_b: Success: He reveals he was a 'Void-Watcher' from the Old World. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: Suddenly, the Prophet's eyes turn into black glass, reflecting a sky that is shattered into thousand-mile triangles.

turns.narrative: The Prophet's body begins to stretch and fold in ways that violate Euclidean geometry. His limbs detach and reattach at impossible angles.
turns.choice_a: Strike his geometric core (Attack AC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You shatter the glass-like ribs. He screams in the sound of breaking mirrors. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Banish the entity (Arcana DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You force the entity back into the 'Between-Places'. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Prophet collapses, his body returning to a brittle, husk-like state, but the air around him remains 'fractured'.

turns.narrative: The 'fractures' in the air look like ripples in a pond made of static. Through them, you can see a version of the market where the buildings are made of bone.
turns.choice_a: Reach into the fracture (Dex DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You pull out a shard of 'Bone-Glass'. (+1 Gear)
turns.choice_b: Seal the rift with silver-wire (Repair DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The vision of the bone-city fades. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: The Prophet gasps his final breath, handing you a 'Star-Glass Prism'. 'Look through the dark,' he wheezes.

turns.narrative: The Prism feels cold, almost freezing, in your palm. Looking through it, the world is devoid of color, replaced by glowing ley-lines.
turns.choice_a: Follow a ley-line (Perc DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You find a hidden cache of 'Void-Capacitors' beneath the market. (+1 Loot)
turns.choice_b: Analyze the ley-line nodes (Int DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You realize the town is built on a massive 'Logic-Lock'. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: A representative from the 'Silent Order'—draped in heavy, sound-dampening velvet—arrives.

turns.narrative: The Order representative doesn't speak; they use a sign language that leaves trails of dim light in the air. They want the Prophet's remains and the Prism.
turns.choice_a: Refuse and protect the Prophet's dignity
turns.consequence_a: Success: The crowd rallies behind you. (+5 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Negotiate for information (Persuasion DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: They reveal the Prophet was their escaped 'Living Archive'. (+1 Intel)
turns.convergence: The representative's velvet hood slips, revealing a face composed entirely of clockwork gears.

turns.narrative: The clockwork face ticks with a frantic, uneven rhythm. 'The Mosaic... is incomplete,' it chirps in a voice of grinding metal.
turns.choice_a: Offer a drop of 'Weaver's Ichor' to the gears
turns.consequence_a: Success: The ticking stabilizes. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Lash out at the machine (Str DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You disrupt the Order's focus. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Order retreat into the shadows, but they leave behind a 'Sanctified Data-Slug'.

turns.narrative: The Data-Slug is a slug-like entity made of soft lead, pulsed with mana. It's trying to 'speak' to your gear, vibrating your weapons.
turns.choice_a: Connect the slug to your gauntlet (Tech DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: Your weapon gains a 'Geometric-Edge' (+1 Damage for 2 turns).
turns.choice_b: Crush the slug to extract its core
turns.consequence_b: Success: You gain a 'Lead-Core' (Value: 200g). (+1 Loot)
turns.convergence: The Prophet's crate begins to float, the rotten melons inside freezing into perfect, crystalline spheres.

turns.narrative: The Market Square is now a zone of 'Static Gravity'. People are floating, their screams unheard in the vacuum-like silence.
turns.choice_a: Anchor the area with a 'Gravity-Well' (Int DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You restore normal physics to the ward. (+5 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Ride the static to the rooftops (Dex DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You escape the zone and can see the 'Mosaic' clearly from above. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: The phenomena dissipates as the Prophet's soul finally departs.

turns.narrative: The sun rises, its light hitting the Prism in your hand. For a second, the whole market is bathed in a golden, logical clarity.
turns.choice_a: Keep the Prism
turns.consequence_a: Success: You have a permanent tool for seeing through Void-illusions. (+1 Gear)
turns.choice_b: Give the Prism to the Council
turns.consequence_b: Success: You are hailed as a hero of the state. (+100 Reputation)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Prophet's death was transition, not ending. The geometric truth he screamed is now a matter of public record, and the Silent Order is watching you from the grout.

risk_matrix.penalty: Geometric madness spreads. -5 Settlement Morale and a permanent -2 to all future 'Wisdom Save' rolls in town.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Market Square disturbance reported

permanent_effects.settlement: Silent Order awareness; permanent Void-watcher in city
permanent_effects.world: Star-Glass Prism added to loot pool

title: The Iron-Widow's Silk
description: The 'Black-Forge' is being choked by a silver, metallic silk that's harder than steel. The Widow is hungry.

turns.narrative: The forge's furnace is a dim, cooling orange. Thick, glistening strands of 'Iron-Silk' are wrapped around the bellows, pulsing with a slow, metallic heartbeat.
turns.choice_a: Test the silk's tension (Athletics DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You snap a minor strand, but your hand is stained with cold mercury. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Heat the silk with a blowtorch
turns.consequence_b: Success: The silk resists the heat, absorbing the energy. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: A series of clicking sounds echoes from the rafters—something large is moving up there.

turns.narrative: An 'Iron-Widow'—a spider-construct the size of a shield, made of bolted plates—descends on a single, heavy thread. Its eyes are red-hot embers.
turns.choice_a: Dodge the pounce (Dex DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You roll beneath the anvil, the Widow's legs striking the floor with a heavy 'thud'. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Raise your shield
turns.consequence_b: Success: The Widow's fangs leave deep gashes in your wood. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: The Widow retreats to the ceiling, trailing a web that is beginning to conduct the forge's remaining heat toward its nest.

turns.narrative: The heat is being sucked out of the room. The Widow's nest—a massive sphere of silk above the furnace—is starting to glow white-hot.
turns.choice_a: Target the nest with a water-bomb (Dex DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The steam explosion disrupts the silk. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Cut the widow's support thread (Attack DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The construct falls into the cooling furnace. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: A swarm of 'Spiderlings'—tiny, clicking gear-bugs—pours out of the silk vents.

turns.narrative: The Spiderlings are everywhere, trying to crawl into the gaps of your armor. They smell of hot oil and charcoal.
turns.choice_a: Spin and strike (Atk DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You crush scores of them. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Use a magnetic pulse (Tech DC 12)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The tiny automatons freeze and drop. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Iron-Widow rises from the furnace, its plates now glowing a dangerous bright-orange.

turns.narrative: The Widow is superheated. Its very presence is making the metal tools on the wall begin to soften and sag.
turns.choice_a: Lure it to the cooling-tank (Str DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You position yourself so it charges toward the water. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Stun it with a 'Chilling-Flask'
turns.consequence_b: Success: The thermal shock cracks its carapace. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Widow hits the water with a deafening hiss, filling the room with blinding steam.

turns.narrative: In the white mist, you can only see the glowing red eyes of the Widow. It's moving slower, but its silk is now steaming and toxic.
turns.choice_a: Filter the air (Con DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You maintain your breath through the vapor. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Track the eyes (Perc DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You anticipate its next lunge. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: You catch the Widow's main gear-joint in a vice-like grip.

turns.narrative: The construct is struggling, its hydraulic fluid leaking like dark blood onto the floor.
turns.choice_a: Execute a finishing blow (Atk DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You sever the head-piece. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Dismantle it for parts (Tech DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You salvage the 'Widow's Heart-Gear'. (+1 Loot)
turns.convergence: The main construct goes silent, but the silk nest above is still humming.

turns.narrative: The 'Heart' of the Widow was just one part of the web. The silk is now vibrating in a specific frequency—a distress signal.
turns.choice_a: Muffle the signal with sand (Repair DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The vibration stops. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Trace the signal's destination (Int DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: It's pointing to the 'Main Cog-Works' in the High-Ward. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: The Blacksmith enters, looking at the wreckage of his forge with a mixture of horror and awe.

turns.narrative: The Blacksmith offers you his 'Master-Work Hammer' in exchange for the silk you've cleared.
turns.choice_a: Accept the Hammer
turns.consequence_a: Success: You gain a weapon that can repair as well as destroy. (+1 Gear)
turns.choice_b: Exchange the silk for 'Hardened Scales'
turns.consequence_b: Success: You gain material for superior armor. (+1 Gear)
turns.convergence: The furnace is relit. The fire burns steady and blue.

turns.narrative: As you leave, you see a small, silver strand trailing from your boot. The silk is persistent.
turns.choice_a: Burn the strand away
turns.consequence_a: Success: You are clean. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Keep it as a trophy
turns.consequence_b: Success: It pulses when constructed objects are near. (+1 Luck)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Iron-Widow has been dismantled, and the Black-Forge is back in production. But the signal it sent suggests a 'Mother-Widow' may be waiting in the foundations.

risk_matrix.penalty: Forge stays cold. -5 Resources and -2 to all future 'Gear-Repair' rolls.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Black-Forge reports production halt

title: The Salt-Sump Siphon
description: The 'Salt-Sumps' are overflowing with a brine that is corrosive to the soul. A rogue siphon is pumping the liquid into the drinking water.

turns.narrative: The sumps are a series of deep, stone vats filled with a thick, iridescent white liquid that tastes like copper and tears. The air is so salty it makes your eyes sting and your skin itch.
turns.choice_a: Identify the brine's origin (Alchemist DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You realize the salt is 'Condensed Despair'. (+1 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Follow the siphon pipe (Perc DC 11)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find the pipe leading into a hidden sub-basement. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The floor tiles here are covered in a thin, white crust of salt that crunches like bone.

turns.narrative: A man is hunched over the main valve, his clothes white as ghosts. He's talking to the brine, whispering secrets that make the liquid bubble.
turns.choice_a: Confront the Saboteur
turns.consequence_a: Success: He looks at you with eyes that have been bleached white. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Sneak closer (Stealth DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You see he's using a 'Void-Siphon'—a device prohibited by the Council. (+1 Secret)
turns.convergence: The Saboteur screams and kicks a lever, causing a high-pressure jet of brine to spray toward you.

turns.narrative: The brine is corrosive. It's not just eating your armor; it's eating your memories. You feel a sudden, sharp pang of loss for a childhood friend whose name you can't remember.
turns.choice_a: Hold on to your identity (Con Save DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You maintain your sense of self through the mental rot. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Dodge the spray (Dex DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You avoid the worst of the liquid. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: The room is filling with brine. The Saboteur has locked the exit and is laughing hysterically.

turns.narrative: The water is at your knees. You see the Saboteur attempting to merge with the brine, his skin turning into translucent salt-crystals.
turns.choice_a: Pull him out of the vat (Str DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You save him from 'The Great Dissolve'. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Smash the Siphon (Atk DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The mechanism shatters, and the flow stops. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The brine begins to drain away, but it's leaving behind a 'Salt-Phantom'—a humanoid figure made of swirling crystals.

turns.narrative: The Salt-Phantom moves with a jerky, unnatural rhythm. It speaks with the voices of a thousand grieving mothers.
turns.choice_a: Dispel the phantom (Religo DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The brine-spirit evaporates into a cloud of steam. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Shatter its form (Atk DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The phantom explodes into a thousand harmless shards. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Saboteur is unconscious on the ground, his body a living map of salt-burns.

turns.narrative: You find a journal on his belt. It contains a list of every person he intended to 'Purify' with the brine.
turns.choice_a: Read the names (Int DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You find several Council members on the list. (+1 Intel)
turns.choice_b: Burn the journal
turns.consequence_b: Success: You decide some truths are better left buried. (+1 Morale)
turns.convergence: The local guards arrive, led by a Sump-Captain who looks suspicious of your presence.

turns.narrative: The Captain demands to know if you were working with the Saboteur. He's looking at the Void-Siphon in your hand.
turns.choice_a: Persuade him of your innocence (Charisma DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: He accepts your story and thanks you. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Intimidate him into silence (Str DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: He backs down, but his loyalty is now zero. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: He offers you a 'Salt-Guard's Pouch' as a bribe or a reward, depending on your tone.

turns.narrative: The Sump is safe, but the damage to the water supply will take days to fix. The townspeople are thirsty and angry.
turns.choice_a: Provide a clean water source (Survival DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You find an old, forgotten well in the ruins. (+5 Morale)
