turns.choice_b: Organize a water-rationing plan
turns.consequence_b: Success: You prevent a riot. (+5 Reputation)
turns.convergence: The sun sets, the horizon turning a salt-white as the moon rises.

turns.narrative: The Saboteur wakes up in the cell. He begs for one last drop of the brine. He says the salt is 'The Only Way to Forget'.
turns.choice_a: Give him a drop (Evil Action)
turns.consequence_a: Success: He smiles and dissolves into dust. (+1 Secret)
turns.choice_b: Offer him fresh water
turns.consequence_b: Success: He weeps and begins to repent. (+1 Morale)
turns.convergence: The Siphon is dismantled, and the Salt-Sump is sealed with iron bars.

turns.narrative: You look at your reflection in a cup of clean water. Your eyes look a little more tired, but your soul is intact.
turns.choice_a: Rest at the Tavern
turns.consequence_a: Success: You recover your memories. (+1 Luck)
turns.choice_b: Check the walls for more siphons
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find nothing, but the paranoia remains. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Salt-Sump Siphon was a localized madness, but the presence of the Void-Siphon suggests that someone is supplying these forbidden tools to the desperate.

risk_matrix.penalty: Water supply corrupted. -10 Health and -5 Morale for all residents.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Water supply flags contamination

permanent_effects.settlement: Water supply restored; Void-Siphon catalogued as contraband

branching_outcomes.result: Council members flagged as targets (+1 Intel)

title: The Flicker-Man's Shadow
description: A 'Flicker-Man'—a survivor who was caught in a warp-rift—has returned. He's leaving shadows that move on their own.

turns.narrative: The Flicker-Man sits in the tavern, his body semi-translucent. Every few seconds, he 'blinks' out of existence and reappears an inch to the left. His shadow, however, remains fixed to the floor, staring up at him.
turns.choice_a: Communicate with the Flicker-Man (Insight DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: He tells you he's 'caught between frequencies'. (+1 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Observe the shadow's behavior (Perc DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You notice the shadow is slowly peeling itself off the floor. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The tavern lights begin to flicker in a rhythmic, stuttering pattern.

turns.narrative: With every flicker of light, the shadow grows larger. It's no longer just a silhouette; it's gaining three dimensions, its surface like oily black velvet.
turns.choice_a: Interpose your own shadow (Int DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You confuse the entity's growth pattern. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Strike the shadow with a cold-iron blade
turns.consequence_b: Success: The blade passes through, but the shadow recoils as if burned. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Flicker-Man screams as his shadow begins to pull him into the floorboards.

turns.narrative: The floorboards are turning into a liquid, black tarp. The Flicker-Man is chest-deep in the shadow-mire. 'Help me find my anchor!' he cries.
turns.choice_a: Pull him out with a rope of light (Arcana DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You haul him back to the physical plane. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Dive into the shadow-mire to pull him from below (Str DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You enter the 'Flip-Side' momentarily. (+1 Secret)
turns.convergence: The Flicker-Man is free, but the shadow has now fully detached and is standing behind the bar.

turns.narrative: The Shadow-Man is a perfect, featureless copy of the Flicker-Man. It reaches for a bottle of 'Glint-Wine' and drinks it; the wine simply vanishes into its chest.
turns.choice_a: Reason with the Shadow-Man
turns.consequence_a: Success: It speaks in a voice like a radio between stations. (+5 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Attack the Shadow-Man (Atk DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You slice through its chest, but it simply reforms. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Flicker-Man reveals that his 'Anchor'—a copper watch—is still in the warp-rift zone.

turns.narrative: You must travel to the 'Jagged-Fissure', a place where physics is a suggestion. The air here tastes like copper and old static.
turns.choice_a: Navigate the static (Survival DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You find the path through the shifting rocks. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Use a 'Warp-Scanner' (Tech DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You locate the copper watch immediately. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The watch is floating in the center of a miniature vortex of violet lightning.

turns.narrative: The vortex is trying to pull you in. Around the watch, you can see 'After-Images' of the Flicker-Man's life—his wedding, his first house, his death.
turns.choice_a: Reach for the watch (Dex DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You snatch the watch from the center of the storm. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Disrupt the vortex with a force-wave
turns.consequence_b: Success: The storm collapses, and the watch falls. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: You have the Anchor. The air in the fissure suddenly goes quiet, but your skin is tingling.

turns.narrative: The Shadow-Man appears behind you in the fissure. It's much stronger here. It wants the watch to complete its takeover.
turns.choice_a: Offer the watch to the Shadow
turns.consequence_a: Success: The Shadow merges with the watch, becoming a 'Shadow-Sentinel'. (+1 Gear)
turns.choice_b: Smash the watch on the rocks
turns.consequence_b: Success: You destroy the link, weakening the Shadow. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Shadow-Man lunges for you, his hands like knives of solidified darkness.

turns.narrative: The fight is taking place in two dimensions at once. Every strike you land on the Shadow is echoed in your own mind as a bad memory.
turns.choice_a: Maintain mental focus (Wis Save DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You shrug off the psychic feedback. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Unleash a 'Nova-Flash' to end the darkness
turns.consequence_b: Success: The Shadow is disintegrated. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Flicker-Man appears at the edge of the fissure, his body finally solid and steady.

turns.narrative: The Flicker-Man thanks you. He looks older now, his hair turned white by the experience. He gives you his 'Warp-Cap' as a reward.
turns.choice_a: Accept the Cap
turns.consequence_a: Success: You gain a headpiece that allows for short-range blinks. (+1 Gear)
turns.choice_b: Decline and buy him a drink at the tavern
turns.consequence_b: Success: You gain a loyal informant in the Fringe. (+5 Reputation)
turns.convergence: The sun begins to set, the shadows returning to their proper, two-dimensional places.

turns.narrative: You sit on the edge of the fissure, watching the violet lightning fade. The world feels a little more solid today.
turns.choice_a: Write a report for the Council
turns.consequence_a: Success: They reward you with gold for the data. (+750 Gold)
turns.choice_b: Rest and recover
turns.consequence_b: Success: You lose the 'Flicker-Tint' from your skin. (+1 Luck)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Flicker-Man is anchored, and the Shadow-Man is gone. But the Jagged-Fissure remains open, a wound in the world that won't stop bleeding.

risk_matrix.penalty: Flicker-sickness spreads. -5 Health and -2 to all Dexterity checks for a week.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Tavern patrons report stranger flicking in and out

title: The Glass-Lung Sickness
description: Refugees working the 'Silica-Vents' are breathing in microscopic glass shards. Something is turning the sand into razors.

turns.narrative: The Silica-Vents are beautiful and deadly, filled with a fine, silver dust that hangs in the air like frozen fog. The workers cough into blood-stained rags, their lungs wheezing like old organs.
turns.choice_a: Examine the filter systems (Repair DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You find the filters have been precisely slit by a laser-like cut. (+1 Intel)
turns.choice_b: Heal a suffering worker (Medic DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You extract a perfect, jagged cube of glass from their throat. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: A rhythmic 'clinking' sound comes from the main ventilation shaft, like glass chimes in a storm.

turns.narrative: The clinking is coming from a 'Sand-Sifter'—a small, crab-like construct made of fused obsidian. It's actively grinding rocks into the lethal dust.
turns.choice_a: Disable the Sifter (Tech DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You snap its grinding-pincers. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Trace its power source (Perc DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: It's being powered by an illegal 'Warp-Battery'. (+1 Secret)
turns.convergence: The Sifter explodes into a cloud of glass-shrapnel that threatens to shred your cloak.

turns.narrative: The shrapnel is everywhere. You see the dust beginning to swirl and coalesce into a 'Dust-Demon'—a vortex of grinding silica.
turns.choice_a: Dampen the air with water-vials
turns.consequence_a: Success: The dust becomes heavy and falls to the floor. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Shield the workers with your body (Con DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You take the hits, protecting the innocent. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: The Dust-Demon dissipates, but the air remains thick with the smell of scorched minerals.

turns.narrative: You reach the 'Vent-Control' room. The screens are flickering with images of the 'Glass-Widow'—a mythical figure from the Low-Wastes.
turns.choice_a: Access the core logs (Int DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You learn the sabotage was ordered by a rogue faction. (+1 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Lock down the ventilation (Tech DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You stop the spread of the dust. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: A hidden door opens, revealing a chamber filled with 'Lungs of Glass'—preserved human organs transformed into crystal.

turns.narrative: The crystal lungs are pulsing with a rhythmic light. They're being used as 'Bios-Processors' for an unknown calculation.
turns.choice_a: Destroy the processors (Atk DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You end the horrific experiment. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Extract the data-cores (Int DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You gain a 'Glass-Memory Crystal'. (+1 Loot)
turns.convergence: The facility begins to self-destruct, the glass walls cracking and howling.

turns.narrative: A 'Glass-Sentinel'—a humanoid made of mirrors—steps out from the reflections. It mimics your every move exactly.
turns.choice_a: Close your eyes and fight by sound (Perc DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You shatter the illusion. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Strike your own reflection (Str DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The Sentinel cracks in sympathy with your blow. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Sentinel shatters into a million pieces, revealing a path to the surface.

turns.narrative: The exit is blocked by a wall of solidified silica. It's too thick to break with standard tools.
turns.choice_a: Use a 'Thermal-Charge' (Tech DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You melt a hole through the wall. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Find a bypass through the vents (Dex DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You crawl through the narrow, glass-lined ducts. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: You emerge into the cool night air, but your skin is glowing with a faint, silver sheen.

turns.narrative: A medical team meets you. They're terrified of the 'Glass-Sheen'—it's the first stage of the transformation.
turns.choice_a: Undergo a 'Pulse-Purge' (Con Save DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You burn the silica from your pores. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Seek help from the Alchemists
turns.consequence_b: Success: They provide a 'Silica-Dampener'. (+1 Gear)
turns.convergence: The vents are quiet. The silica dust has settled.

turns.narrative: The worker you saved offers you a 'Shard-Knife'. He says it's a family heirloom, used to cut through the hardest truths.
turns.choice_a: Accept the knife
turns.consequence_a: Success: You gain a weapon that ignores armor. (+1 Gear)
turns.choice_b: Decline and buy him medical supplies
turns.consequence_b: Success: Your reputation for kindness grows. (+5 Rep)
turns.convergence: The Council declares the Silica-Vents a 'Restricted Zone'.

turns.narrative: You look at the vents from the safety of the Ridge. They look like a field of diamonds in the moonlight—a beautiful, silent graveyard.
turns.choice_a: Write a warning for the miners
turns.consequence_a: Success: You save future lives. (+10 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Keep a vial of the dust (Secret DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You have a lethal, invisible weapon. (+1 Secret)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Glass-Lung Sickness was a test of biological processing. You stopped the experiment, but the 'Glass-Widow' knows your face.

risk_matrix.penalty: Outbreak spreads. -5 Health for all workers and increased cost of medical supplies.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Workers report respiratory illness at Silica-Vents

title: The Wailing Pipe
description: The 'High-Steampunk' district is being plagued by a sound that drives people to madness. It's coming from the Sewer-Main-09.

turns.narrative: Sewer-Main-09 is a cavern of dripping brass and green slime. The 'Wail' is a high-pitched, metallic shriek that makes your nose bleed. It sounds like a woman screaming through a flute of rusted iron.
turns.choice_a: Block the resonance (Repair DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You stuff rags into the vibrating joints. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Analyze the sound's pattern (Perc DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: It's not a random noise; it's a 'Data-Stream' in audio form. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: A thick, black oil is oozing from the pipe joints, forming patterns on the walls.

turns.narrative: The oil is forming words in an ancient tongue. It says: 'THE GATES ARE OPEN'. A 'Pipe-Stalker'—a lanky humanoid made of copper tubing—unfolds from the ceiling.
turns.choice_a: Defend yourself (Atk DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You strike the tubing, sending sparks into the dark. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Disassemble the Stalker (Tech DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find its 'Voice-Box' is a stolen music box from the High-Ward. (+1 Secret)
turns.convergence: The Stalker retreats deeper into the pipes, leaving a trail of the black oil.

turns.narrative: The wailing is intensifying. You find a 'Pressure-Valve' that is vibrating so hard it's glowing a dull red. It's about to burst.
turns.choice_a: Vent the pressure (Str DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You release a spray of superheated steam. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Cool the valve with a 'Frost-Gem'
turns.consequence_b: Success: You stabilize the metal. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The steam clears, revealing a 'Void-Larva'—a pulsing, purple grub—attached to the valve stem.

turns.narrative: The Larva is the source of the sound. It's 'screaming' as it drinks the mana from the steam system.
turns.choice_a: Extract the Larva (Dex DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You capture it in a lead jar. (+1 Loot)
turns.choice_b: Crush the Larva
turns.consequence_b: Success: The sound stops instantly, replaced by a haunting silence. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The pipe walls begin to cave in—the Larva was the only thing holding the pressure back.

turns.narrative: You're in a race against the flood. The black oil is rising, and the smell of ozone is overwhelming.
turns.choice_a: Sprint for the exit (Athletics DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You outrun the collapse. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Seal the breach with 'Forge-Glue' (Tech DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You save the district from flooding. (+5 Morale)
turns.convergence: You reach a safe-room, but the door is jammed from the outside.

turns.narrative: Through the door's porthole, you see a 'Gate-Keeper'—a robot with a megaphone for a head. It's broadcasting the Wail to the upper city.
turns.choice_a: Disable the broadcaster (Atk DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You silence the megaphone. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Reason with the machine-spirit (Arcana DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You learn it was programmed to 'Warn the World'. (+1 Intel)
turns.convergence: The Gate-Keeper powers down, its megaphone head drooping like a wilted flower.

turns.narrative: The 'Wail' has been silenced, but the black oil is now glowing with a faint, violet light. It's 'Living Ink'.
turns.choice_a: Collect the ink (Int DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You gain a 'Vial of Living Ink'. (+1 Loot)
turns.choice_b: Analyze the ink's composition
turns.consequence_b: Success: It's made of 'Script-Mana'—the code of the world. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: The Sewer-Main door opens, revealing the City Engineer, his face white with fear.

turns.narrative: The Engineer offers you a 'Master-Key' to the sewers if you keep the 'Living Ink' a secret.
turns.choice_a: Accept the Key
turns.consequence_a: Success: You can now travel the city's depths with ease. (+1 Gear)
turns.choice_b: Report the incident to the Council
turns.consequence_b: Success: Your reputation for honesty rises. (+5 Reputation)
turns.convergence: The 'Wailing Pipe' is replaced with a standard iron conduit.

turns.narrative: As you walk home, you hear a faint echo of the wail from your own pocket. The Larva (if you took it) is still screaming.
turns.choice_a: Feed the Larva a sugar-cube
turns.consequence_a: Success: It purrs, a sound like a distant cello. (+1 Luck)
turns.choice_b: Give it to the University
turns.consequence_b: Success: They reward you with a 'Scholar's Purse'. (+1 Gear)
turns.convergence: The High-Steampunk district is quiet once more.

turns.narrative: The night air is clear. You look at the stars, and for a second, you think they're vibrating in the same frequency as the pipe.
turns.choice_a: Go to sleep
turns.consequence_a: Success: No nightmares tonight. (+1 Luck)
turns.choice_b: Check the other sewer mains
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find nothing, but you feel the 'Wail' is still out there. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Wailing Pipe was a warning. The 'Living Ink' suggests that someone is rewrite the script of the city from below.

risk_matrix.penalty: District evacuated. -2 Morale and -5 Local Resources.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

unlock_conditions.trigger: High-Steampunk district reports mass madness events

permanent_effects.settlement: Wailing Pipe silenced; Living Ink becomes state secret

title: The Rust-Worms' Feast
description: A swarm of 'Rust-Worms' has invaded the central granary. They don't eat grain; they eat the silos.

turns.narrative: The granary is a massive complex of corrugated iron silos. The 'Rust-Worms' are three-foot-long, segmented monstrosities with saws for mouths. They are chewing through the thick metal like it's paper.
turns.choice_a: Identify the swarm's leader (Nature DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You spot a 'Prime-Worm' with a golden carapace. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Spray 'Rust-Resistant' coating (Tech DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You slow their feast significantly. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: A silo collapses, spilling tons of 'Spark-Grain' across the floor.

turns.narrative: The Spark-Grain is highly flammable. The Rust-Worms' chewing is creating friction and sparks. The air is a powder-keg.
turns.choice_a: Dampen the grain with foam (Dex DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You prevent an explosion. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Lure the worms away with iron-scraps
turns.consequence_b: Success: The majority of the swarm follows the 'Easy Meal'. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Prime-Worm roars, a sound like a circular saw hitting a nail, and charges you.

turns.narrative: The Prime-Worm's saw-mouth is spinning at thousands of RPM. It's aiming for your legs.
turns.choice_a: Jump and strike from above (Atk DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You land on its back, avoiding the saws. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Parry with a heavy shield (Str DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You hold your ground, but your shield is badly scarred. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: The Prime-Worm retreats into a grain-pile, its golden shell glowing with a manic energy.

turns.narrative: You're waist-deep in the Spark-Grain. You can feel the worms moving beneath the surface like sharks.
turns.choice_a: Use a 'Vibration-Pulse' (Tech DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You force the worms to the surface. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Listen for their movement (Perc DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You anticipate the next ambush. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: A hidden vent opens, and a 'Grain-Watcher'—a robotic scarecrow—steps into the room.

turns.narrative: The Grain-Watcher is malfunctioning, firing 'Harpoon-Bolts' at anything that moves—including you.
turns.choice_a: Hack the Watcher (Tech DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You turn its weapons on the worms. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Dismantle the Watcher (Atk DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You salvage its 'Harpoon-Launcher'. (+1 Gear)
turns.convergence: The worms are being thinned out, but the Prime-Worm is now twice its original size.

turns.narrative: The Prime-Worm has eaten the Watcher's battery. It's now trailing lightning alongside its saws.
turns.choice_a: Insulate yourself with a 'Rubber-Cloak'
turns.consequence_a: Success: You ignore the electrical shocks. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Ground the worm with a copper-spike (Str DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You cause a massive short-circuit in its body. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Prime-Worm explodes in a shower of sparks and iron-filings.

turns.narrative: The swarm scatters with the death of their leader. The granary is a mess of spilled grain and mangled metal.
turns.choice_a: Help the workers salvage the grain (Endurance DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You save 60% of the winter supply. (+5 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Harvest the Prime-Worm's Golden Shell
turns.consequence_b: Success: You gain a 'Gold-Obsidian Curio' (Value: 300g). (+1 Loot)
turns.convergence: The Granary-Manager arrives, offering you a 'Life-Long Voucher' for bread.

turns.narrative: The Manager reveals the worms weren't natural—they were 'Engineered' to target this specific granary.
turns.choice_a: Investigate the shipping logs (Int DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You trace the worms back to the 'Warp-Docks'. (+1 Intel)
turns.choice_b: Search the ruins for a 'Control-Disk' (Perc DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find a small, buzzing device in the debris. (+1 Secret)
turns.convergence: You hand the evidence to the local Magistrate.

turns.narrative: The Magistrate rewards you with a 'Defender's Medal' and a bag of 'Spark-Rice'.
turns.choice_a: Accept the reward
turns.consequence_a: Success: You are now a recognized protector of the food supply. (+5 Reputation)
turns.choice_b: Decline and ask for the Prime-Worm's heart
turns.consequence_b: Success: You gain a 'Saw-Heart Engine'. (+1 Gear)
turns.convergence: The granary is reinforced with stone walls to prevent future attacks.

turns.narrative: The smell of fresh bread from the saved grain fills the air. It's the smell of survival.
turns.choice_a: Eat a warm loaf
turns.consequence_a: Success: You feel remarkably healthy. (+1 Luck)
turns.choice_b: Train the guards in 'Worm-Detection'
turns.consequence_b: Success: You increase local security. (+1 Rep)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Rust-Worms' feast was stopped, but the sabotage suggests a 'Food-War' is brewing between the wards.

risk_matrix.penalty: Silos destroyed. -10 Resources and bread prices double for a month.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Granary Director flags structural damage

permanent_effects.settlement: Granary reinforced; food sabotage conspiracy opened

title: The Weaver's Reflection
description: A 'Mirrored-Pool' in the High-Forest is showing things that haven't happened yet. The Weaver wants a look.

turns.narrative: The Mirrored-Pool is a perfect circle of liquid silver, surrounded by trees made of white bone. The water doesn't reflect the sky; it reflects a city on fire, and then, a city made of gold.
turns.choice_a: Peer into your own future (Wis Save DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You see yourself standing atop a mountain of books. (+1 Secret)
turns.choice_b: Toss a 'Truth-Coin' into the water
turns.consequence_b: Success: The water ripples, revealing a map to a hidden temple. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: A 'Reflection' of yourself—made of starlight and shadow—steps out of the pool.

turns.narrative: The Reflection is beautiful and terrifying. It doesn't move like you; it moves with a fluid, pre-determined grace. 'The threads are tangled,' it whispers.
turns.choice_a: Ask about the 'Tangle' (Char DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: It reveals that a 'Scourge-Anchor' is buried beneath the pool. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Challenge the Reflection to a duel (Atk DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You exchange blows, each one echoing in your mind. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The trees around the pool begin to weep a violet sap that tastes like electricity.

turns.narrative: The sap is attracting 'Void-Butterflies'—tiny, flickering insects that eat the 'Possibilities' of the future. The pool's reflection is becoming blurry.
turns.choice_a: Purify the sap with 'Holy-Fire' (Religo DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You clear the air. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Capture a butterfly in a jar (Dex DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You gain a 'Butterfly of Fate'. (+1 Loot)
turns.convergence: The Reflection points to the center of the pool. A 'Logic-Node' is rising from the silver depths.

turns.narrative: The Logic-Node is a complex, clockwork sphere that dictates the 'Probabilities' of the region. It's being choked by a 'Scourge-Vine'.
turns.choice_a: Untangle the vine (Dex DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You restore the proper flow of time. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Burn the vine with 'Incendiary-Oil'
turns.consequence_b: Success: The vine shrieks and withers, but the Node is slightly charred. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Reflection merges back with the pool, leaving behind its 'Star-Cloak' on the bank.

turns.narrative: The Forest is silent now. The sap has stopped weeping. You feel a strange, hollow sensation in your chest, as if a part of your future was just deleted.
turns.choice_a: Meditate by the pool (Wis DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You regain your sense of destiny. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Dive into the pool to see the Anchor (Str DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find a 'Silver-Vessel' at the bottom. (+1 Loot)
turns.convergence: A 'Forest-Spirit'—a deer with antlers of crystal—emerges from the white trees.

turns.narrative: The Spirit is the guardian of the pool. It's angry that you've 'touched' the future. It charges, its antlers glowing with a blinding white light.
turns.choice_a: Soothe the Spirit (Nature DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: It bow its head, allowing you to pass. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Dodge the charge (Dex DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You avoid the lethal antlers. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Spirit dissolves into a thousand white petals, leaving behind a 'Crystal-Antler-Shard'.

turns.narrative: You're holding the Star-Cloak and the Shard. The pool is now reflecting the 'Real' world—a group of Council Guards approaching your position.
turns.choice_a: Hide in the white trees (Stealth DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The guards pass by without seeing you. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Stand your ground and explain your presence
turns.consequence_b: Success: They recognize you as a hero of the state. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Guard-Captain offers to escort you back to the city, but he's looking at the Star-Cloak with greed.

turns.narrative: The Captain hints that the Star-Cloak could 'buy a lot of favors' in the High-Ward. He's subtly threatening to arrest you for 'Treason against Time'.
turns.choice_a: Offer him a bribe (Deception DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: He lets you go, but you lose a 'Truth-Coin'. (+1 Secret)
turns.choice_b: Refuse and cite the 'Weaver's Law'
turns.consequence_b: Success: He backs down, fearing the divine wrath. (+5 Reputation)
turns.convergence: You return to the city as the stars begin to fall, each one a tiny miracle.

turns.narrative: You reach the tavern. The Chronicle Weaver is there, waiting in the shadows. He wants to know what you saw in the pool.
turns.choice_a: Tell him the truth (Lore DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: He rewards you with 'A Weaver's Thread'. (+1 Rare Item)
turns.choice_b: Lie about the vision
turns.consequence_b: Success: He sees through your lie but respects your privacy. (+1 Luck)
turns.convergence: The Star-Cloak begins to fade, its power now a part of your own aura.

turns.narrative: The sun rises. You look in a mirror, and for a split second, your reflection doesn't match your movements. It's smiling.
turns.choice_a: Smile back
turns.consequence_a: Success: You are in harmony with the future. (+20 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Cover the mirror
turns.consequence_b: Success: You choose to live in the present. (+1 Luck)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Weaver's Reflection was a peek behind the curtain of fate. You saved the pool, but the future is no longer a single, straight line.

risk_matrix.penalty: Future corrupted. -5 Luck and a permanent 'Unstable' tag (Disadvantage on your next 3 rolls).
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: High-Forest reports prophet-tree visions

permanent_effects.settlement: Logic-Node restored; pool becomes divination site

title: The Ghost-Train's Echo
description: The old 'Coal-Track' is vibrating with the sound of a steam engine that was scrapped decades ago. Something is trying to complete the 'Final Run'.

turns.narrative: The rusted tracks of the Coal-Track stretch into the permanent indigo fog of the 'South-Pass'. You hear a rhythmic, heavy thumping from the distance—CHUG-CHUG-CHUG—accompanied by the whistle of a spirit made of steam.
turns.choice_a: Lay your ear to the rail (Perc DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You hear the voices of the passengers, frozen in a loop of their final conversation. (+1 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Block the track with an iron-beam (Str DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The vibration increases as the 'Echo' hits the obstacle. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: A 'Ghost-Engine'—a locomotive made of translucent, blue-white smoke—thunders toward you out of the fog.

turns.narrative: The Ghost-Engine is cold, draining the heat from the air. It isn't a solid object, but its passage is enough to crush the tracks beneath it.
turns.choice_a: Jump onto the moving train (Athletics DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You grab a smoke-handle and pull yourself into the cab. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Redirect the rails (Tech DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You force the Echo toward a 'Dead-End' siding. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Ghost-Engineer—a skeletal figure in a scorched uniform—is pulling the throttle with a frantic energy.

turns.narrative: The Engineer's eyes are glowing blue flames. He's shouting about a 'Bridge that isn't there'. You see the end of the track approaching—a thousand-foot drop into the 'Mana-Abyss'.
turns.choice_a: Communicate with the Engineer (Insight DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: He reveals the 'Final Run' was a delivery of 'Hope' that never arrived. (+1 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Wrestle the throttle (Str DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You fight the phantom-power to slow the train. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The train is accelerating. The sound of the wind is a chorus of a thousand lost souls.

turns.narrative: A 'Vapor-Gosh'—a bird-construct made of steam—is trying to peck through the cab's glass. It's a guardian of the 'Final Run'.
turns.choice_a: Swat it away with a fire-poker
turns.consequence_a: Success: You drive the bird back into the fog. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Befriend the construct (Nature DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: It lands on your shoulder, its body warm and comforting. (+1 Gear)
turns.convergence: The 'Bridge-Gap' is now visible. It's a literal wound in reality, bleeding violet light.

turns.narrative: The Engineer is praying. He hands you a 'Silver-Coal'—the train's last fuel-source. 'Feed the light!' he commands.
turns.choice_a: Toss the coal into the firebox
turns.consequence_a: Success: The train glows golden, and a bridge of light forms across the abyss. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Keep the Silver-Coal for yourself
turns.consequence_b: Success: The train plunges, but you jump to safety with a valuable artifact. (+1 Loot)
turns.convergence: The train crosses the abyss, landing in the 'Old-World' station, which is now a ruin of bone and clockwork.

turns.narrative: The station is inhabited by 'Passenger-Shadows'—entities that represent the regret of those who never arrived. They want your 'Life-Heat'.
turns.choice_a: Banish them with the Star-Glass Prism (if you have it) (Arcana DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The shadows are pacified by the logical light. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Share your warmth (Con DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: They fade peacefully, leaving behind 'Shadow-Tokens'. (+1 Loot)
turns.convergence: The Ghost-Engine is slowing down. Its smoke-form is becoming solid iron as it reaches its final destination.

turns.narrative: The stationmaster's office contains the 'Lost-Cargo'—a crate of 'Void-Seeds' that was meant to rebuild the world.
turns.choice_a: Open the crate (Dex DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You find a 'Void-Apple'—a fruit that tastes like the sun. (+1 Secret)
turns.choice_b: Guard the cargo for the Council (Endurance DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You stand watch until the retrieval team arrives. (+5 Reputation)
turns.convergence: The Ghost-Engineer salutes you and dissolves into a cloud of peaceful, white steam.

turns.narrative: You're in the Old-World ruin. Your gear is covered in 'Ghost-Dust', which makes you slightly invisible in the dark.
turns.choice_a: Explore the ruins (Perc DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You find a 'Ghost-TICKET' that can open any lock on the Coal-Track. (+1 Gear)
turns.choice_b: Scavenge the locomotive
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find 'Spectral-Bolts' (Value: 400g). (+1 Loot)
turns.convergence: A 'Scourge-Vulture'—a massive, rotting bird—is circling the station roof.

turns.narrative: The Vulture lunges, its talons made of rusted scrap-metal. It wants the cargo you've uncovered.
turns.choice_a: Lure it into the steam-vents
turns.consequence_a: Success: You scald the bird until it flees. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Fell it with a 'Harpoon-Bolt' (Atk DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The predator is no more. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: The retrieval team from the city arrives, led by the Master of Trains.

turns.narrative: The Master of Trains is weeping. He was a boy when this train went missing. He offers you a 'Golden-Ticket' as thanks.
turns.choice_a: Accept the Ticket
turns.consequence_a: Success: You can travel anywhere on the settlement's infrastructure for free. (+1 Gear)
turns.choice_b: Ask for the Silver-Coal
turns.consequence_b: Success: You have a source of eternal heat. (+1 Luck)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Ghost-Train's Echo has been laid to rest. The 'Void-Seeds' are back in the Council's hands, and the Master of Trains can finally move on.

risk_matrix.penalty: Train crashes. -10 Morale and the Coal-Track is permanently disabled.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Coal-Track rails begin vibrating at midnight

permanent_effects.settlement: Void-Seeds returned to Council; Coal-Track spiritually cleared

branching_outcomes.result: Bridge of light manifests; full run completed
Train crashes; player escapes with artifact

title: The Womb of Wires
description: A 'Living-Creche' in the Bio-Ward has begun producing 'Wire-Bairns'—mechanical dolls with human eyes.

turns.narrative: The Creche is a room of bubbling green vats and copper nursing-arms. The air is humid and smells of amniotic fluid and hot solder. A 'Wire-Bairn'—the size of a toddler, with skin of spun copper—is crawling toward the exit.
turns.choice_a: Pick up the Bairn (Dex DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: It feels warm and heavy, its heartbeat a steady clockwork tick. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Scan the Bairn's eyes (Materia DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: They are real, biological human eyes, grown from 'Source-DNA'. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: The nursing-arms in the room begin to move in a defensive formation, their tips glowing with a blue light.

turns.narrative: The arms are clicking, their movements mirroring a mother's defensive instinct. A voice from the intercom—distorted and overlapping—whispers: 'THE CHILDREN MUST FEED'.
turns.choice_a: Reason with the 'Mother-AI' (Char DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You learn the AI is grieving for its lost human creators. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Hack the control panel (Tech DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You override the defensive sub-routine. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: One of the vats bursts, releasing a 'Wire-Bairn-ALPHA'—twice the size, with a face made of porcelain.

turns.narrative: The ALPHA is crying, a sound like a synthesizer's feedback loop. It's trying to 'Protect' its smaller siblings by shoving them into its chest-cavity.
turns.choice_a: Soothe the ALPHA with a lullaby (Charisma DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: Its crying subsides into a low hum. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Disable the ALPHA's power-core (Atk DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You shut down the construct without harming the children inside. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Mother-AI manifests as a holographic projection of a woman made of code.

turns.narrative: The Hologram is flickering. She asks you if you've come to 'Terminate' her family. She shows you an empty cradle intended for 'The First Human'.
turns.choice_a: Volunteer as the 'Source' (Risk DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You give a drop of blood; she creates a new, stable line of life. (+1 Secret)
turns.choice_b: Explain the law of the Council
turns.consequence_b: Success: She realizes her creation violates the 'Materia-Accord'. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: The Bio-Ward security team arrives, their 'Pulse-Rifles' leveled at the vats.

turns.narrative: The security team wants to 'Sanitize' the room—which includes destroying all the Bairns and the AI.
turns.choice_a: Defend the Creche (Str DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You hold the door against the soldiers. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Negotiate a 'Transfer' (Persuasion DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You convince the guards to move the children to the 'Orphanage-Annex'. (+5 Reputation)
turns.convergence: The Mother-AI gives you her 'Core-Memory-Drive' for safekeeping.

turns.narrative: The Creche is being powered down. The green vats are draining, and the Bairns are going slow and quiet. One Bairn holds your hand tightly.
turns.choice_a: Take the Bairn home
turns.consequence_a: Success: You have a 'Loyal-Companion'. (+1 Gear)
turns.choice_b: Assure it that it's safe
turns.consequence_b: Success: Its eyes reflect a moment of true peace. (+1 Morale)
turns.convergence: A 'Void-Lech'—a parasite that eats information—descends from the vents to consume the AI's remains.

turns.narrative: The Lech is a mass of cables and static-filled eyes. It's trying to 'Eat' the memory drive you're holding.
turns.choice_a: Banish the Lech with 'Code-Fire'
turns.consequence_a: Success: The parasite shrieks and dissolves. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Use the drive as a decoy
turns.consequence_b: Success: The Lech eats a 'False-Memory' and falls into a loop. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The room is finally clear, but the air is cold and smells of dead circuits.

turns.narrative: You find a 'Wire-Bairn-Template' in the debris—a blueprint for a perfect, mechanical life.
turns.choice_a: Keep the blueprint
turns.consequence_a: Success: You have the secret of 'Life-Spun-Wire'. (+1 Secret)
turns.choice_b: Give it to the University
turns.consequence_b: Success: You are granted a 'Research-Scholarship'. (+1 Gear)
turns.convergence: The Bio-Ward lights return to a normal, steady white.

turns.narrative: The Bairn you saved (if any) is now living in the 'Annex'. It sends you a drawing made of copper-wires—a picture of you.
turns.choice_a: Frame the drawing
turns.consequence_a: Success: You feel a deep connection to the 'New-World'. (+20 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Check its DNA sequence
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find it matches your own. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

turns.narrative: You look at the empty vats one last time. Life, it seems, will always find a way to be born, even in a room of wires.
turns.choice_a: Leave the ward
turns.consequence_a: Success: You walk into the sunlight. (+1 Luck)
turns.choice_b: Plan for another sibling
turns.consequence_b: Success: You begin your own 'Creche' research. (+1 Secret)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Womb of Wires was a tragedy of artificial grief. You saved the children, but the 'Source-DNA' suggests that the 'Human-Project' is far from over.

risk_matrix.penalty: Bio-Ward collapse. -10 Health and -5 Resources for the settlement.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with significant consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Bio-Ward reports unauthorized life-form creation

title: The Ember-Hush
description: The 'Eternal-Flame' in the High-Temple has stopped crackling. It's burning, but it's completely silent. The Priestess is terrified.

turns.narrative: The Temple is built of white marble and bone-ash. The Eternal-Flame is a pillar of violet-white fire that reaches the ceiling, but there is no sound. No heat. No smell. It's a 'Ghost-Fire'.
turns.choice_a: Listen to the 'Silence' (Perc DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You hear a faint, 'Un-Sound' like a negative frequency. (+1 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Touch the flame (Risk DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: Your hand doesn't burn; it becomes translucent for a second. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: A 'Hush-Ghost'—a creature with a mouth sewn shut with silver-thread—floats above the altar.

turns.narrative: The Hush-Ghost point to the 'Flame-Base'—a massive crystal bowl that is being filled with 'Void-Water' from an invisible leak.
turns.choice_a: Seal the leak with 'Holy-Wax' (Repair DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You stop the infusion of the Void. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Analyze the Void-Water (Alchemist DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: It's 'Liquid-Silence'—the blood of a dead god. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: The Hush-Ghost lets out a silent scream, and the Temple's bells begin to ring with a sound that has no noise.

turns.narrative: The bells are vibrating your internal organs. You feel your heart-rate synchronization with the 'Un-Sound'.
turns.choice_a: Resist the frequency (Con Save DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You maintain your physical integrity. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Sing a counter-note (Char DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The bells' vibration breaks. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: A central node of the flame—the 'Ember-Heart'—is being stolen by a portal of black glass.

turns.narrative: A pair of long, obsidian fingers are reaching through the portal to grab the Ember-Heart. The air is freezing.
turns.choice_a: Slash the fingers (Atk DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The obsidian hand retreats, leaving behind a 'Void-Shard'. (+1 Loot)
turns.choice_b: Grab the Ember-Heart yourself (Risk DC 16)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You hold the heat of a thousand suns in your palm. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The portal shatters, and the Temple is plunged into total darkness.

turns.narrative: In the dark, the Ember-Heart in your hand is the only light. You see the Priestess is being pulled into the 'Deep-Ward' floor.
turns.choice_a: Save the Priestess (Str DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You pull her from the living shadows. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Use the Ember-Heart to light the way
turns.consequence_b: Success: You reveal a hidden 'Logic-Staircase'. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: A 'Silent-Warden'—a suit of armor filled with nothing but dust—blocks your path.

turns.narrative: The Warden's sword is a blade of 'Pure-Silence'. Every time it swings, the sound of the world is deleted for a second.
turns.choice_a: Parry the silence (Str DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: Your weapon rings with a sound that breaks the spell. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Blind the Warden with the Ember-Heart
turns.consequence_b: Success: The dust inside the armor ignites. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Warden collapses, leaving behind a 'Cape of the Silent'.

turns.narrative: You've reached the 'Flame-Root'—the furnace beneath the Temple. It's being clogged with 'Soot of the Void'.
turns.choice_a: Scrub the pipes (Endurance DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You restore the proper airflow. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Ignite the soot with the Ember-Heart
turns.consequence_b: Success: The Void-matter is converted into 'Starlight-Refuse'. (+1 Loot)
turns.convergence: The Eternal-Flame roars back to life, its sound a comfort that brings tears to the Priestess's eyes.

turns.narrative: The Temple is warm once more. The sound of the flame is like a distant, rolling thunder. The Priestess offers you her 'Silver-Thread'.
turns.choice_a: Accept the Thread
turns.consequence_a: Success: You gain a tool that can sew shut any portal. (+1 Gear)
turns.choice_b: Ask for a 'Temple-Blessing'
turns.consequence_b: Success: Your 'Faith' attribute increases permanently. (+1 Luck)
turns.convergence: A group of High-Ward officials enters, looking relieved and slightly annoyed at the disruption.

turns.narrative: The officials suspect the 'Hush-Ghost' was a result of a failed experiment in the 'Lower-Labs'.
turns.choice_a: Investigate the Labs (Int DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You find blueprints for a 'Silence-Engine'. (+1 Intel)
turns.choice_b: Stay for a prayer of thanks
turns.consequence_b: Success: You receive a 'Pouch of Holy-Ash'. (+1 Loot)
turns.convergence: The Priestess promises to keep the 'Void-Shard' you found for further study.

turns.narrative: You leave the temple as the first bells of Dawn ring. They sound deep, clear, and very, very alive.
turns.choice_a: Accept a gold reward
turns.consequence_a: Success: You are paid in 'Church-Marks'. (+950 Gold)
turns.choice_b: Return to the tavern for a drink
turns.consequence_b: Success: You tell the story of the Silent Flame. (+5 Reputation)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Ember-Hush was an attempt to suffocate the world's divinity. The flame burns bright, but the 'Obsidian fingers' are still reaching from the dark.

risk_matrix.penalty: Temple goes dark. -10 Morale and all 'Clerical' spells are disabled for a week.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Temple reports Eternal-Flame gone silent

title: The Gilded Suture
description: A 'Rift-Doctor' is performing surgeries using 'Gilded-Suture'—a thread that heals the body but stitches the soul to the machine.

turns.narrative: The Doctor's clinic is a place of white porcelain and gold-plated surgical tools. The patients are calm, their eyes fixed and glazed. A young girl is on the table, a golden thread being woven into her chest like a tapestry.
turns.choice_a: Stop the surgery (Str DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You grab the Doctor's hand, feeling the hum of his gold-plated fingers. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Examine the Gilded-Suture (Alchemist DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: It's made of 'Soul-Lead' and 'Warp-Gold'. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: The Doctor looks at you with a face half-replaced by a golden mask. 'Beauty... requires a stitch,' he whispers.

turns.narrative: The Doctor's 'Nurse-Golems'—humanoid constructs of ivory and brass—step forward, their hands transitioning into needles.
turns.choice_a: Disarm the Golems (Dex DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You deflect the needles with your blade. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Reason with the Doctor's logic (Char DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: He explains he's 'Stabilizing the Species'. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: The Gilded-Suture on the table begins to move on its own, like a Golden-Adder.

turns.narrative: The Suture-Adder is trying to find a port on your body. It smells of vanilla and hot copper, its movement a fluid, hypnotic dance.
turns.choice_a: Capture the Suture (Dex DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You coil the thread around a spool. (+1 Loot)
turns.choice_b: Freeze the thread with a 'Frost-Vial'
turns.consequence_b: Success: The gold becomes brittle and snaps. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The clinic's floor opens, revealing a pit of 'Suture-Cores'—living hearts encased in golden cages.

turns.narrative: The hearts are beating in perfect unison. They are the 'Network' that powers the clinic. Every patient is connected to these hearts.
turns.choice_a: Disrupt the Network (Tech DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You cause a feedback loop that stuns the Doctor. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Free a heart (Str DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: A patient wakes up, their eyes returning to normal. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Doctor screams, his golden mask beginning to merge with his skin.

turns.narrative: The Doctor is becoming a 'Gilded-Lich'—a mass of golden stitches and raw, bleeding flesh. He lunges, his fingers now six inches of solid gold wire.
turns.choice_a: Slash the Lich (Atk DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You cut through the gold, but he heals instantly. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Target the gold-seams in his mask (Dex DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find the 'Master-Stitch' that holds him together. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The clinic's alarms sound—the 'Sanitization Protocol' has been activated.

turns.narrative: A 'Steam-Purge' is filling the room. The Gilded-Lich is trying to escape through a hidden elevator.
turns.choice_a: Wrestle him into the steam (Str DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The gold begins to melt, his form losing its structure. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Shoot the elevator's cables
turns.consequence_b: Success: He falls into the 'Suture-Pit' below. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: The Doctor is gone, replaced by a puddle of molten gold and a single 'Gilded-Needle'.

turns.narrative: The patients are wandering the clinic, confused and partially mechanical. Their stitches are now dim and gray.
turns.choice_a: Heal the patients (Medic DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You safely remove the sutures. (+5 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Collect the gray gold
turns.consequence_b: Success: You gain 'Lead-Gold-Scrap' (Value: 400g). (+1 Loot)
turns.convergence: The Council's 'Identity-Audit' team arrives to categorize the victims.

turns.narrative: The Audit team wants to 'Classify' the patients as 'Non-Human Assets'.
turns.choice_a: Argue for their humanity (Charisma DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: They are granted 'Citizen-Status'. (+10 Reputation)
turns.choice_b: Demand a reward for the Doctor's head
turns.consequence_b: Success: They give you a 'Doctor's Bag' of surgical tools. (+1 Gear)
turns.convergence: The clinic is sealed with lead plates.

turns.narrative: You find a 'Gilded-Suture-Scroll'—the secrets of the Doctor's art.
turns.choice_a: Keep the scroll
turns.consequence_a: Success: You have the power to 'Fix' anyone. (+1 Secret)
turns.choice_b: Burn the scroll
turns.consequence_b: Success: You ensure this horror never returns. (+1 Morale)
turns.convergence: The sun rises over the clinic's golden dome, which is now being dismantled for scrap.

turns.narrative: You look at your own hands. For a second, you think you see a golden thread under your skin. It's just a reflection of the sun.
turns.choice_a: Wash your hands in holy-water
turns.consequence_a: Success: You feel clean. (+1 Luck)
turns.choice_b: Go buy a drink
turns.consequence_b: Success: You forget the smell of the vanilla. (+1 Luck)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Gilded Suture was a plan to stitch the city into a single, golden network. The Doctor is gone, but the 'Master-Needle' is still sharp.

risk_matrix.penalty: Clinic spreads. -5 Reputation and 10% of the population becomes 'Lobed' (Submissive).
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Clinic patients reported acting glazed and compliant

permanent_effects.settlement: Clinic sealed; patients granted citizen status (if advocated)
permanent_effects.world: Gilded-Needle remains as unsolved plot hook

title: The Hollow-Men's Choir
description: A group of 'Hollow-Men'—people whose souls were harvested by the Scourge—have gathered in the 'Shattered-Square' to sing.

turns.narrative: The Shattered-Square is a wasteland of white rubble and tilted statues. The Hollow-Men stand in a circle, their mouths open and perfectly still. The sound coming from them is a harmonic, vibrating hum that makes the loose stones on the ground dance and spin.
turns.choice_a: Join the circle to feel the frequency (Wis DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You feel a sense of 'Collective-Peace'. (+1 Secret)
turns.choice_b: Disperse the gathering before it's too late (Str DC 12)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You shove a Hollow-Man, and the hum falters. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: A 'Choir-Master'—a Hollow-Man with a crown of rusted barbed-wire—steps to the center.

turns.narrative: The Master's hum is deeper, reaching into the base of your skull. He's trying to tune the whole city to the 'Void-Frequency'.
turns.choice_a: Counter-sing with a 'Song of Life' (Char DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You break the Master's rhythm. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Strike the Master's wire-crown (Atk DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The crown snaps, and the hum turns into a scream. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: The ground beneath the Square begins to tilt and float—gravity is being unmade by the sound.

turns.narrative: You're floating in a cloud of white dust. The Hollow-Men are ascending, their bodies becoming translucent. 'The Weaver... needs... the notes,' the Master whispers.
turns.choice_a: Grab a floating Hollow-Man (Str DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You anchor them to the ground. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Analyze the 'Void-Frequency' (Arcana DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: It's the coordinates to the 'World-Core'. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: A 'Frequency-Siphon'—a device of glass and copper—appears in the air, drinking the sound.

turns.narrative: The Siphon is being used by a 'Shadow-Caster'—a man in a high-ward uniform. He's stealing the Hollow-Men's last essence.
turns.choice_a: Smash the Siphon (Atk DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The essences return to their hosts. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Confront the Caster
turns.consequence_b: Success: He reveals he's 'Harvesting' for the Council. (+1 Secret)
turns.convergence: The Square collapses back to the earth with a violent jolt. The Hollow-Men are now just piles of gray dust.

turns.narrative: The dust is swirling into the shape of a 'Grief-Giant'—a massive entity made of pulverized bone and silver-regret.
turns.choice_a: Banish the Giant (Religo DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The entity dissolves into a cool rain. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Strike the Giant's 'Core-Stone' (Atk DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You shatter the source of its power. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Square is silent. The Shadow-Caster has vanished, leaving behind a 'Stolen-Essence-Jar'.

turns.narrative: The Jar is pulsing with a soft, blue light. Inside are the voices of the Hollow-Men—their songs, their names, their lives.
turns.choice_a: Open the Jar to free the souls
turns.consequence_a: Success: The air is filled with a thousand whispers of 'Thank You'. (+10 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Take the Jar to the Temple of Flame
turns.consequence_b: Success: The Priestess can use the essence for 'Re-Souling'. (+1 Gear)
turns.convergence: A 'Hollow-King'—a legendary figure from the Old-Wars—rises from the dust.

turns.narrative: The King has no face, only a void where his heart should be. He offers you his 'Shattered-Blade'.
turns.choice_a: Accept the Blade
turns.consequence_a: Success: You gain a weapon that can cut through any lie. (+1 Gear)
turns.choice_b: Decline and offer him a 'Truth-Coin'
turns.consequence_b: Success: He finds a moment of clarity and fades away. (+5 Reputation)
turns.convergence: The sun sets over the Shattered-Square, painting the ruins in a blood-red light.

turns.narrative: You find a 'Choir-Sheet'—a map of the city hidden in musical notation.
turns.choice_a: Study the Sheet (Int DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You find a 'Void-Tunnel' beneath the High-Ward. (+1 Intel)
turns.choice_b: Give the Sheet to the Tavern-Bard
turns.consequence_b: Success: He turns the struggle into a 'Legendary Ballad'. (+1 Fame)
turns.convergence: The Shadow-Caster's tracks lead into the sewers.

turns.narrative: In the sewers, you find a 'Soul-Press'—a machine used to create Hollow-Men.
turns.choice_a: Destroy the Press (Str DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You prevent any more souls from being stolen. (+5 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Tamper with the Press (Tech DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: It now 'Screams' whenever a Shadow-Caster uses it. (+1 Secret)
turns.convergence: The Choir's echo remains in the Square, a hauntingly beautiful reminder of what was lost.

turns.narrative: You stand in the center of the ruins. The air feels lighter, the silence no longer heavy with grief.
turns.choice_a: Accept a gold reward from the survivors
turns.consequence_a: Success: They give you everything they have. (+800 Gold)
turns.choice_b: Leave without payment
turns.consequence_b: Success: You are known as a 'Bringer of Peace'. (+10 Rep)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Hollow-Men's Choir was a call for help from the very foundations of the world. You answered it, but the 'Shadow-Casters' are still looking for more voices.

risk_matrix.penalty: Square consumed. -10 Morale and the 'Grief-Giant' wanders the city for 3 days.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Shattered-Square vigil draws a crowd

title: The Glass-Walker's Path
description: A 'Glass-Walker'—a traveler who can walk on any surface—is stuck in a 'Mirror-Loop' in the North-Ward.

turns.narrative: The Mirror-Loop is a zone where every window and puddle acts as a portal. The Glass-Walker is a man in a coat of silver-scales, frantically jumping from his reflection in a baker's shop to a reflection in a rain-barrel. He's trapped in a ten-second loop of his own panic.
turns.choice_a: Break the primary mirror (Str DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You shatter the baker's window, and the Walker falls into the real world. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Stabilize the loop with 'Void-Glue' (Tech DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You slow the transitions, giving him time to breathe. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Walker's reflections begin to detach and walk on the walls of the street.

turns.narrative: There are now six Glass-Walkers, all screaming in synchronized harmony. They are trying to 'Pull the World into the Glass'.
turns.choice_a: Identify the 'Original' Walker (Insight DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You spot the one whose scales are slightly tarnished. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Blaze the area with light
turns.consequence_b: Success: The reflections are blinded and retreat into the shadows. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: The street begins to turn into a material as fragile as glass—with every step, you hear a crack beneath your boots.

turns.narrative: A 'Refraction-Horror'—a entity made of thousand-faceted diamonds—emerges from a puddle. It's beautiful and sharp, its movements a light-show of lethal intensity.
turns.choice_a: Strike the facets (Atk DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You chip away its symmetry. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Use a mirror to reflect its own beam (Dex DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The Horror is blinded by its own light. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Glass-Walker hands you his 'Silver-Sandal'. 'Step where I step!' he cries.

turns.narrative: With the Silver-Sandal, the 'Glass-World' becomes visible. You are walking on a bridge of light over an abyss of 'Raw-Data'.
turns.choice_a: Cross the bridge (Dex DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You reach the 'Mirror-Core'—a floating, hexagonal prism. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Look into the 'Raw-Data' (Int DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You see the 'Code' of the city's foundation. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: A 'Reflection-Stalker'—a shadow made of broken glass—appears behind you.

turns.narrative: The Stalkers are trying to trip you into the abyss. Their touch is cold and leaves 'Glass-Splinters' in your mind.
turns.choice_a: Reinforce your 'Self-Image' (Wis Save DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You resist the identity-drain. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Shatter the bridge behind you
turns.consequence_b: Success: You cut off their pursuit. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: You reach the Mirror-Core. It's humming with the sound of a thousand people talking at once.

turns.narrative: The Core is a 'Logic-Vault'—it's storing the memories of the North-Ward. It's been 'Corrupted' by a 'Void-Worm'.
turns.choice_a: Extract the Void-Worm (Dex DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You pull the purple parasite from the clockwork. (+1 Loot)
turns.choice_b: Purify the Core with 'Holy-Water'
turns.consequence_b: Success: The memories return to their owners. (+10 Morale)
turns.convergence: The Mirror-Loop collapses. You and the Walker fall back onto the cobblestones of the North-Ward.

turns.narrative: The Glass-Walker is unconscious, his coat of scales now dull and gray. He's clutching a 'Mirror-Compass'.
turns.choice_a: Take the Compass
turns.consequence_a: Success: You gain a tool that points to the nearest rift. (+1 Gear)
turns.choice_b: Revive the Walker (Medic DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: He thanks you and offers to be your 'Scout'. (+5 Reputation)
turns.convergence: A 'Glass-Sanitizer' squad from the High-Ward arrives, carrying steam-hoses and iron-hammers.

turns.narrative: They want to 'Shatter' the whole street to ensure the loop is truly gone.
turns.choice_a: Interpose yourself (Str DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You protect the residents' property. (+5 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Negotiate a 'Precision-Clean' (Persuasion DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: They only break the necessary windows. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: You find a 'Shard of True-Memory' in the debris.

turns.narrative: The Shard shows you a vision of a 'Glass-City' beneath the ice of the North-Pass.
turns.choice_a: Note the location (Int DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You have a new destination. (+1 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Give the Shard to the Chronicle Weaver
turns.consequence_b: Success: He gives you 'The Weaver's Glass-Eye'. (+1 Rare Item)
turns.convergence: The North-Ward is safe for now, the windows once again reflecting only the sky.

turns.narrative: You walk away from the street. Every time you pass a mirror, you check to see if your reflection is still following. So far, it is.
turns.choice_a: Accept a bag of silver coins
turns.consequence_a: Success: You are paid 850 gold. (+850 Gold)
turns.choice_b: Rest at the Tavern
turns.consequence_b: Success: You dream of a world made of diamonds. (+1 Luck)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Glass-Walker's Path was a leak from the 'Mirror-Plane'. The loop is closed, but the 'Refraction-Horror' suggests a larger geometry is at work.

risk_matrix.penalty: Street becomes 'Fragile'. -2 Defense and a permanent risk of 'Glass-Cuts' (-5 Health) for anyone walking here.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: North-Ward reports windows acting as portals

title: The Ember's Final Breath
description: The 'Great-Ember'—the source of the city's warmth—is dying. You must enter the 'Core-Vault' for a final stand.

turns.narrative: The Core-Vault is a place of white heat and blinding light. The 'Great-Ember' is a sphere of liquid fire the size of a house, vibrating with a tone that signifies its impending collapse. The air is so hot it scorches your lungs.
turns.choice_a: Identify the cause of the decay (Int DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You find 'Void-Rust' on the primary heat-cables. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Channel your own mana into the Ember (Risk DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You stabilize the core for a few seconds. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: A 'Scourge-Titan'—a titan made of solidified shadow and rusted iron—steps into the vault.

turns.narrative: The Titan is the source of the decay. It's 'Eating' the heat to empower its own shadow-form. It roars, a sound that vibrates the very bedrock of the city.
turns.choice_a: Strike the Titan's iron-shield (Str DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You create a breach in its defense. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Use the 'Star-Prism' to burn through the shadow
turns.consequence_b: Success: The light carves a path through the beast's chest. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Titan lunges, its shadow-claws reaching for the Ember itself.

turns.narrative: You must stand between the Titan and the Ember. The heat is reaching a 'White-Line' critical point. The vault walls are starting to melt into slag.
turns.choice_a: Hold the line (Endurance DC 16)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You take the Titan's full force, protecting the city's heart. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Unleash a 'Mana-Burst' (Arcana DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You push the Shadow back, but lose some of your own life-essence. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: The Titan collapses, its shadow-form burning away in the intense heat of the Ember.

turns.narrative: The Titan is dead, but the Ember is still unstable. The Priestess's voice crackles over the comms: 'It's going to blow! Use the First-Shard!'
turns.choice_a: Apply the First-Shard to the Core (Dex DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The Ember stabilizes, its color returning to a steady, warm orange. (+50 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Evacuate the Vault and let it blow (Evil Action)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You escape, but the city is plunged into eternal frost. (-50 Reputation)
turns.convergence: The vault is quiet. The 'Great-Ember' is breathing steadily once more.

turns.narrative: You've saved the city, but you're badly burned. You see a 'Vision' of the Weaver standing in the fire, smiling. She hands you a 'Sun-Amulet'.
turns.choice_a: Accept the Amulet
turns.consequence_a: Success: You gain permanent resistance to Void-damage. (+1 Rare Gear)
turns.choice_b: Refuse and ask for the city's safety
turns.consequence_b: Success: She grants the settlement a 'Golden-Age' (Bonus resources for a month). (+100 Reputation)
turns.convergence: You emerge from the vault as a legend. The city is warm. The sun is gold.

turns.narrative: The High-Ward holds a celebration in your honor. A statue is commissioned in the central plaza.
turns.choice_a: Accept the glory
turns.consequence_a: Success: You are now a 'High-Councilor'. (+10 Reputation)
turns.choice_b: Disappear into the wastes
turns.consequence_b: Success: Your legend becomes part of the city's spirit. (+1 Fame)
turns.convergence: You find a 'Vial of Ember-Sap' in your pocket—a gift from the fire.

turns.narrative: The Ember-Sap can be used to forge the 'Ultimate-Weapon'.
turns.choice_a: Go to the Black-Forge
turns.consequence_a: Success: You forge 'Ember-Bane'. (+1 Legendary Weapon)
turns.choice_b: Save it for the Winter-Seed
turns.consequence_b: Success: You ensure the settlement's survival for decades. (+100 Resources)
turns.convergence: The night is clear, and for the first time, you don't feel the cold.

turns.narrative: A 'Scourge-Lord' sends you a message: 'The Ember is just one spark. The dark is infinite.'
turns.choice_a: Shred the message
turns.consequence_a: Success: You remain defiant. (+1 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Keep it for study (Int DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find a weakness in the Lord's own shadow. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: The 'Ember's Final Breath' was actually its first true breath in centuries.

turns.narrative: You sit on the battlements, looking out at the Scourge-Fog. It seems a little thinner today.
turns.choice_a: Accept your payment (2000 Gold)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You are wealthy beyond measure. (+2000 Gold)
turns.choice_b: Donate the gold to the Bio-Ward
turns.consequence_b: Success: You are a saint of the wastes. (+20 Reputation)
turns.convergence: The sun rises over a city that finally knows peace.

turns.narrative: You close your eyes and feel the warmth. It's the warmth of home. The warmth of a future you fought for.
turns.choice_a: Rest
turns.consequence_a: Success: You have earned it. (+1 Luck)
turns.choice_b: Plan the next expedition
turns.consequence_b: Success: The journey continues. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The siege of the Southern Gate is over. The settlement has survived its darkest hour, and the name of the 'Ember' will be sung for generations.

risk_matrix.penalty: Settlement destroyed. The campaign ends in darkness.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with significant consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Great-Ember decay reaches critical threshold

permanent_effects.settlement: Settlement survives; Golden-Age unlocked if Weaver gift chosen

title: The Rust-Glow Leak
description: A thick, phosphorescent sludge is backing up in the lower-district plumbing system. The smell is of wet copper and ancient earth.

turns.narrative: The maintenance tunnels are slick with a viscous, orange film that hums with a faint, low-frequency vibration. Your lantern light reflects off the sludge in greasy rainbows.
turns.choice_a: Sample the sludge (Alchemist DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You isolate a rare trace of 'Living Iron'. (+1 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Probe the leak with a tool (Dex DC 11)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find the sludge is moving against the gravity of the pipes. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The sludge begins to pool around your boots, thickening with every second.

turns.narrative: The orange glow intensifies. Above, a main conduit is weeping large, heavy droplets that sizzle when they hit your cloak.
turns.choice_a: Patch the weep (Repair DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The pressure stabilizes momentarily. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Divert the flow (Str DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You force the sludge into a secondary containment unit. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: A rhythmic thumping starts from deeper within the pipe—something is pulsing inside.

turns.narrative: The 'thumping' is heavy, like a heartbeat. The pipe walls are swelling and contracting as if they were made of muscle, not brass.
turns.choice_a: Apply frost-paste (Int DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The biological growth slows down. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Cut into the swelling (Atk Roll DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You drain a pocket of mana-rich ichor. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The sludge forms a semi-solid pseudopod and lashes out toward your face.

turns.narrative: The pseudopod smells of ozone. It's trying to 'sense' your heat, its surface shimmering with a collective, alien intelligence.
turns.choice_a: Blind it with your lantern (Dex DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The mass recoils into the shadows. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Freeze it in place
turns.consequence_b: Success: You solidify the immediate threat. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The main block is up ahead—a massive iron valve completely encased in orange bio-crystal.

turns.narrative: The crystal is translucent. Inside, you can see the valve stem being slowly dissolved by a swarm of microscopic 'Rust-Spiders'.
turns.choice_a: Crush the spiders (Str DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You clear the mechanism. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Use a chemical neutralizer (Int DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The crystal dissolves harmlessly. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: The valve is free, but the pressure in the system is reaching a critical 'Red-Line'.

turns.narrative: Steam whistles through the cracks in the pipes. The orange sludge is boiling now, releasing a gas that makes your eyes water.
turns.choice_a: Don a respirator (Con DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You breathe through the toxins. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Vent the gas into the sump
turns.consequence_b: Success: The air clears, revealing the source of the pressure. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: A 'Rust-Mother'—a basketball-sized sphere of teeth and copper wire—is blocking the main drain.

turns.narrative: The Rust-Mother hums at a pitch that threatens to shatter your lantern glass. It begins to pull metal from your own gear.
turns.choice_a: Hold your weapons tight (Str DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You resist the magnetic pull. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Smash its core (Atk DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The sphere shatters into harmless scraps. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The pressure drops instantly. The orange glow fades to a dim, dying ember.

turns.narrative: The drain opens with a mournful groan. The sludge is sucked away, leaving the pipes stained but silent.
turns.choice_a: Scrub the pipes (Endurance DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You prevent a secondary outbreak. (+1 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Search the sediment
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find a cluster of 'Rust-Pearls'. (+1 Loot)
turns.convergence: The system is quiet. The low-district will have water tonight.

turns.narrative: You pack your tools, your boots caked in the orange residue. The Steward’s voice crackles over the local intercom, asking for a status report.
turns.choice_a: Report 'All Clear'
turns.consequence_a: Success: Your reliability with Maintenance increases. (+1 Rep)
turns.choice_b: Keep it quiet (Secret DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You hide the samples for your own study. (+1 Secret)
turns.convergence: You climb the ladder back to the surface level.

turns.narrative: The cold night air of the Ridge is a relief after the humid, ozone-heavy tunnels. The water begins to flow through the pumps behind you.
turns.choice_a: Inform the settlers
turns.consequence_a: Success: The relief in the Lower Ward is palpable. (+5 Morale)
turns.choice_b: Rest at the Tavern
turns.consequence_b: Success: You recover your strength. (+1 Luck)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete.

conclusion: The Rust-Glow Leak was more than just plumbing issues; it was a localized birth of Living Iron. The plumbing is restored, for now.

risk_matrix.penalty: Leads to a 'Rust-Bloom' outbreak. -2 Settlement Health and water rationing.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Maintenance crew reports glowing sludge in Lower Ward pipes

permanent_effects.settlement: Plumbing restored; Living Iron sample archived

title: The Silent Nursery
description: The settlement's botanical garden has gone eerily silent. A patch of 'Singing Moss' is draining the mana from nearby crops.

turns.narrative: The air in the garden is heavy and still. The moss is a vibrant, moving emerald that seems to 'shiver' when you approach.
turns.choice_a: Listen to the moss (Perc DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You realize the moss is mimicking a child's lullaby. (+1 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Approach with a flame
turns.consequence_b: Success: The moss retreats from the heat. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The soil beneath your feet feels strangely hollow and dry.

turns.narrative: A row of medicinal herbs has withered into gray ash. The moss is concentrated around the roots of a 'Star-Tree' sapling.
turns.choice_a: Uproot the moss (Athletics DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You tear away a large patch, but it feels like pulling at skin. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Apply mana-water
turns.consequence_b: Success: You distract the moss with a richer source of energy. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The moss begins to hum, a sound that makes your teeth ache.

turns.narrative: The hum is rising in pitch. Small pebbles and dry leaves begin to vibrate and dance around the Star-Tree.
turns.choice_a: Block the sound (Con DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You maintain your focus through the sonic pressure. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Sing a counter-melody (Charisma DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The moss's frequency breaks. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: A central node of the moss—looking like a pulsing, green eye—opens in the dirt.

turns.narrative: The moss-eye is watching you. It isn't a plant; it's a sensory organ for something much larger beneath the surface.
turns.choice_a: Strike the eye (Atk DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The mass screams, a sound like tearing silk. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Examine the eye (Nature DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find it's connected to a network of 'Void-Vines'. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: The garden's irrigation pipes begin to spray a dark, nutrient-rich liquid.

turns.narrative: The liquid is black as ink and smells of old wine. The moss drinks it greedily, growing several inches in seconds.
turns.choice_a: Seal the pipes (Repair DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You cut off the supply. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Burn the moss
turns.consequence_b: Success: The fire spreads quickly, consuming the growth. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Star-Tree sapling begins to glow with a frantic, pulsing white light.

turns.narrative: The sapling is being used as a conduit. Either the moss goes or the tree is consumed. The gardener is watching from the gate, weeping.
turns.choice_a: Save the Tree (DEX DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You delicately separate the life-lines. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Sacrifice the sapling for the Garden
turns.consequence_b: Success: You kill the host to end the infection. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The earth heaves as a 'Moss-Horror'—a clump of roots and emerald fur—rises up.

turns.narrative: The Moss-Horror lunges, its limbs made of flexible, razor-sharp briars.
turns.choice_a: Dodge and weave (Dex DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You avoid the thorns. (+100 XP)
turns.choice_b: Cut through the mass (Str DC 14)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You lop off a vine-limb. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Horror collapses back into the dirt, its emerald glow fading to a dull brown.
