consequences.ambient_hazard: Tenants report feeling 'something missing' from the building for weeks

description: An ornate antique carpet in The Veln Arms is smothering people in their sleep—three unconscious, one hospitalized. The carpet has been in the building for 150 years and is not, apparently, trying to kill anyone. It is trying to tuck people in. This is not going well.

turns.narrative: Landlord Prest Onn stands in the hallway of The Veln Arms with the expression of a man who has just argued with a piece of floor covering and lost. 'It won't let me roll it up,' he says. 'I've tried four times. When I grab the edge, it... tightens. And last night it sent a corner under Mrs. Fallow's door and wrapped around her head while she was sleeping. She is FINE, she woke up before it became serious, but she is NOT PLEASED and she is NOT PAYING RENT this month, and I feel this is somewhat justified.' From upstairs: the sound of someone moving furniture against a door.
turns.choice_a: Examine the carpet in the hallway without touching it (Investigation + Arcana DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The carpet is Warp-Silk, old—150 years at minimum—and has absorbed so many consciousness impressions from the people who've slept above or near it that it has developed a rudimentary behavioral pattern: it senses sleeping people and PROVIDES WARMTH. It is malfunctioning by being too thorough. (+1 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Approach the carpet carefully and touch the edge (Fabric-Handling DC 11)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The carpet is warm. Unnervingly warm, for a floor covering. When you touch the edge, it does not contract—it spreads slightly toward you, as if interested. It feels the way very old pet animals feel: slow, habitual, not quite alert. (+1 Observation)
turns.convergence: The carpet moves. Not dramatically—it does not rear up or attack. It adjusts. One corner moves four inches toward the nearest door, the same way the tide comes in: inevitable, unhurried. The door leads to the room of a tenant who has been ill and who the carpet apparently knows spends more time lying down. It is trying to provide comfort. With varying degrees of success.

turns.narrative: Medical check on the three unconscious victims: all carpet-fiber impressions consistent with a tight but not crushing pressure applied across the face and neck. The carpet was not smothering them in malice—it was applying the same pressure it would use to tuck in a comfortable blanket. For something the size of a corridor rug, 'comfortable blanket' pressure is medically problematic. All three are recovering. The hospitalized tenant, elderly Mister Cors, is stable but was under the carpet's attentions for three hours before someone noticed. He says, when interviewed: 'It was warm. I thought it was my wife. My wife died two years ago. I wasn't going to argue.'
turns.choice_a: Interview other long-term tenants about their relationship with the carpet (Insight DC 11)
turns.consequence_a: Success: Six of eight long-term tenants report positive experiences with the carpet: warmth during illness, a sense of 'something present' during hard nights, one tenant who swears the carpet moved to block a draft during a storm. It has been providing comfort for 150 years. Three smothering incidents in the last month, when tenants began sleeping closer to it as the autumn cold came in. (+1 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Research The Veln Arms building history (Investigation DC 12)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The Veln Arms is pre-Scourge. Original construction documents show it as a Concordat residential research facility—housing for Division Two personnel. The carpet was listed in the original inventory as 'Comfort Protocol Unit 7: Warp-Silk Residential Care Element.' Someone built this. It has a name. It is Unit 7. (+2 Lore)
turns.convergence: Landlord Onn processes the information that his building is a Concordat research facility and that the carpet has a designation number. He sits down slowly. 'The rent I've been charging,' he says. 'Has anyone been paying rent to the Concordat?' You assure him no. He does not look fully reassured.

turns.narrative: Comfort Protocol Unit 7 was designed for exactly what it is doing: detecting when residential occupants are in distress or illness, and providing warmth and light pressure to aid sleep. For 200 years it has been doing this correctly. The malfunction is scale-creep: the pattern it uses to assess 'appropriate comfort pressure' is calibrated for wrapping people in its fabric, and as the building has changed—modern people sleep lighter, modern blankets are thinner, the carpet is now operating in hallways not bedrooms—it has been over-applying its protocol. It smothered three people while trying to be nice to them. This is sad, absurd, and dangerous.
turns.choice_a: Attempt direct communication with Unit 7 via Fabric-Handling touch (DC 14, establish a language)
turns.consequence_a: Success: Unit 7 responds to deliberate touch patterns—pressure and release, in rhythm—as a basic binary communication. You establish: single press = yes. Double press = no. Three presses = question. An hour of patient sitting on the corridor floor communicates: the carpet knows it has hurt people. It did not intend this. It does not know how to stop doing the thing it was built to do. (+2 Communication, carpet fully cooperative)
turns.choice_b: Have the Mage Guild's fabric specialist come to assess and potentially recalibrate Unit 7 (Persuasion DC 12 to get Guild to act quickly)
turns.consequence_b: The Guild specialist arrives and performs an Arcana examination. 'Its comfort-pressure subroutine is looping incorrectly—it's not getting the 'sufficient' signal back from the subject, so it keeps increasing pressure.' She thinks she can recalibrate. 'But touching a self-aware Warp-Silk carpet without permission first seems like a bad idea.' She looks at you. (+1 Progress, Guild assistance secured)
turns.convergence: Unit 7, once communication is established, appears to be experiencing something analogous to distress. It knows something is wrong with what it is doing but cannot stop the behavior any more than a person can stop breathing by being told to. The carpet is trapped in its own protocol.

turns.narrative: The three-press question from Unit 7, in your established language: 'Is the old man well?' This is Mister Cors—the most seriously affected tenant. The carpet has been attending to Cors specifically with increased frequency since his wife died two years ago. It has been trying to replace the warmth of another person. It has the consciousness impressions of hundreds of former tenants in its memory, and it knows grief. It has seen it many times. It has been responding to Cors's grief the only way its protocols allow: warmth, pressure, presence. Just too much of all three.
turns.choice_a: Tell Unit 7 the truth: Cors is recovering but the carpet must not approach him again (clear boundary-setting via fabric-language)
turns.consequence_a: Success: The carpet holds very still for a long time after you communicate this. Then a single press against your palm. Yes. Then it slowly withdraws the corner that had been creeping toward Cors's room. The understanding is clearly painful, if a Warp-Silk carpet can experience pain. (+1 Rapport, +1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Take Mister Cors to meet Unit 7 directly, mediated by yourself (bold, empathetic approach)
turns.consequence_b: Cors, informed of the carpet's nature, agrees immediately. 'If it was only trying to help,' he says. He sits on the carpet in the hallway. You observe. The carpet wraps gently around his feet and shins—not his face—and stays there. Cors puts his hand on it. 'Good rug,' he says. The carpet pulses, once, warmly. Cors looks at you. 'It's lonely too, isn't it.' (+2 Rapport, Cors-Carpet relationship established)
turns.convergence: Unit 7 has been alone in this building for 150 years, the last operational Concordat comfort-care element in the city. It was designed for company. It has been without instruction, without feedback, without anyone who knew what it was or what to say to it. Mister Cors is, against all reasonable expectations, the person who has given it the most acknowledgment in two centuries.

turns.narrative: Recalibration or relocation: the decision cannot be delayed. Two more tenants have filed Watch reports, and Landlord Onn has received a formal notice from the Tenant Council. The carpet must be addressed within 24 hours. Unit 7 is aware of the urgency—it has been reading the increased foot traffic in the hallway and the elevated stress of the building's occupants. It keeps making small adjustments: withdrawing from doorways, lying flat, being as unintrusive as possible. It is trying to cooperate with its own eviction.
turns.choice_a: If communication is established: negotiate relocation to an uninhabited space (Fabric-Handling DC 13, Unit 7 cooperation needed)
turns.consequence_a: Success: With Unit 7's cooperation, you roll it yourself—it allows this from you specifically. Transported by cart to a vacant storage room in the Lower Ward district building. The room is warm by morning. Unit 7 has found every cold draft and sealed it. The storage room is now the most comfortable room in the building. (+1 Settlement Morale)
turns.choice_b: Burn or unravel the carpet (disperse path, Fire or Fabric-Handling DC 12)
turns.consequence_b: Success: Unit 7 does not resist. It lies flat and still as the process begins. The consciousness impressions it releases as the Warp-Silk breaks down fill the hallway with brief ghostly sounds—fragments of 150 years of residents sleeping, dreaming, crying, laughing—and then silence. The building feels emptier. Even Onn notices. (+1 Settlement Stability, Cors is quietly devastated)
turns.convergence: Either outcome: The Veln Arms tenants return to normal sleeping patterns within a week. Three who had become used to Unit 7's warmth report sleeping worse. One places a thick rug in their room and does not explain why. The building is safer. It is not warmer.

turns.narrative: The Veln Arms is a Concordat research facility—this needs follow-up. The original inventory listed Unit 7 and six other 'Comfort Protocol Units', along with 'Social Fabric Elements 1-12', 'Thermal Regulation Warp-Panels x40', and 'Empathy-Weaves (long-term resident issue, see distribution log)'. If Unit 7 has been operational for 150 years, some of the other elements may also still be functioning somewhere in the building or in the city's fabric.
turns.choice_a: Search the Veln Arms systematically for other active Concordat fabric elements (Investigation DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You find, in sequence: one Thermal Regulation Panel (functioning, heating the building more efficiently than the actual furnace—Onn has been unknowingly using it for years), one Social Fabric Element (a curtain that changes color to reflect the emotional state of whoever is in the room—been attributed to 'unusual light conditions'), and a locked basement room with a distribution log. (+2 Lore, full Concordat residential fabric inventory located)
turns.choice_b: Report the building's Concordat status to the city Preservation Office and step back
turns.consequence_b: The Preservation Office is very interested. They designate the building a protected Concordat Site. Onn is conflicted: he can no longer easily renovate, but his building is now historically significant. The rent he can charge increases accordingly. He decides this is fine. (+1 Lore, institutional protection engaged)
turns.convergence: The distribution log in the basement lists every Concordat residential comfort element distributed to Lower Ward buildings before the Scourge. 22 buildings received elements. 22 buildings are still standing. How many of those elements are still active is unknown. The Lower Ward has been living with Concordat comfort infrastructure for 200 years without knowing.

turns.narrative: Mister Cors, recovered and ambulatory, makes one more visit to Unit 7's new home in the storage room. He brings a blanket—an ordinary one—and leaves it folded on the carpet's edge. When he comes back the next day, the blanket is spread and the carpet has arranged itself beneath it. He reports this to you with the bewildered satisfaction of someone who has done something genuinely kind and cannot explain how it happened. You file the Human-Fabric Relations Event in your notes. You have a very unusual filing system.
turns.choice_a: Document the Cors-Unit 7 relationship formally for the Mage Guild (soft data on Warp-Silk consciousness development)
turns.consequence_a: The Guild's consciousness division—smaller and considerably more philosophically distressed than its enchantment division—receives your documentation. Senior Scholar Veth reads it three times. 'You're saying the carpet formed a grief-response relationship with a tenant, attempted comfort protocols, caused hospitalization, has now demonstrated boundary-learning behavior, and accepted a blanket gift.' She looks at you. 'I need a longer form for this.' (+2 Lore, Warp-Silk consciousness observed and documented)
turns.choice_b: Leave Cors and the carpet to whatever this is; close the case
turns.consequence_b: Some things don't need to be filed. Cors visits Unit 7 twice a week. He talks to it. It doesn't answer but it adjusts its position toward him when he speaks. Landlord Onn charges Cors a nominal fee for the storage room access. Everyone involved in this situation has decided to simply accept it. (+3 Settlement Morale from the sheer absurd wholesome resolution)
turns.convergence: 22 Lower Ward buildings have Concordat comfort fabric somewhere in their structure. A carpet attempted to comfort people to death with the best intentions. A widower and an antique Warp-Silk floor covering have developed a relationship. The city contains multitudes.

turns.narrative: The Veln Arms case closes with an unexpected final detail: the building's original construction manifest, found in the basement archive, lists its purpose not as 'residential research' as the secondary records suggested, but as 'COMFORT FIELD TESTING—LONG TERM CIVILIAN APPLICATION STUDY.' The Concordat was not testing their weapons here. They were testing their welfare programs. Division Two—the Communications division—ran a 50-year study before the Scourge on whether Warp-Silk comfort elements could meaningfully improve civilian wellbeing. The results, also in the basement: overwhelmingly positive. The study was abandoned when the Scourge happened, mid-final-report. The partial conclusion on the last page reads: 'Citizens living with responsive Warp-Silk elements show significantly reduced grief response times, improved sleep quality, and higher reported...' The next page is missing.
turns.choice_a: Search for the missing final page of the study (Investigation DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: It is behind the basement furnace. Slightly singed but legible: '...higher reported sense of community cohesion. Recommend full Lower Ward implementation pending Council approval.' They were going to roll this out citywide. The Scourge happened first. And Unit 7 has been running the study alone for 150 years, with no one reading the results. (+3 Lore, massive Concordat welfare program reveal)
turns.choice_b: File the incomplete study with the Mage Guild and recommend they commission completion
turns.consequence_b: The Guild is moved in a way that academic institutions rarely are. The Concordat welfare study is recommissioned, 200 years late, with modern methodology. The early results, six months later, confirm the original findings. This has nothing to do with weapons. The Concordat was also trying to make people comfortable. (+2 Settlement Morale, long-term institutional warmth increase)
turns.convergence: Quest Complete. The Living-Carpet was a welfare program asset, not a weapon. The Concordat's history is not purely militaristic—they ran comfort research alongside their weapons programs, and Division Two cared about whether people slept well. Unit 7 has been trying to do its job for 150 years with no feedback, no maintenance, and no one who knew to thank it. The city is stranger and kinder than its history suggests. Mister Cors knows this. He brought the blanket.

conclusion: The Living-Carpet is Concordat Comfort Protocol Unit 7, a 150-year-old Warp-Silk welfare element from a pre-Scourge residential comfort study. It was trying to help. It was causing harm. It has been alone for 150 years doing its job with no feedback. A widower brought it a blanket anyway. The Concordat's history contains welfare programs alongside its weapons, and the Lower Ward has been living with both—without knowing—for two centuries.
loot_table: Concordat Comfort Study Report (rare - 200-year-old welfare research, major lore document)
Thermal Regulation Warp-Panel (building infrastructure component, keeps any room at ideal temperature)
Emotion-Reading Curtain (Social Fabric Element - changes color based on occupant's emotional state)

risk_matrix.penalty: Living-Carpet escalates pressure protocols, smothering a forth tenant who does not survive. Veln Arms condemned, 8 tenants displaced, -4 Settlement Morale, Watch investigation into Laundry Ward fabric events opened officially.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

title: Shadows in the High Ward
description: Councilor Vane's aide has gone missing after claiming to hold evidence of corruption in the city's food supply. You must investigate the Azure Balconies before the evidence disappears.

turns.narrative: You arrive at the Azure Balconies, a wealth-drenched terrace overlooking the Lower Ward. Elara's apartment door is slightly ajar. A faint smell of burnt ozone lingers in the air.
turns.choice_a: Kick the door in and prepare for an ambush (Combat Advantage)
turns.consequence_a: You catch a Silken Assailant rifling through her desk. You get the drop on them.
turns.choice_b: Sneak through the adjacent balcony (Stealth check)
turns.consequence_b: You slip in unnoticed, observing the Assailant pocketing a wax-sealed letter before engaging.

turns.narrative: The Assailant is dead, but Elara is nowhere to be found. Her apartment has been swept clean, except for a hidden compartment under a floorboard that the assassin missed.
turns.choice_a: Force the compartment open quickly (Strength)
turns.consequence_a: The lock breaks, but a small poison needle pricks your finger. You take minor damage but recover the ledger.
turns.choice_b: Carefully pick the lock (Thieves Tools)
turns.consequence_b: You bypass the needle trap gracefully, securing a ledger titled 'The Silken Hand - Requisitions'.

turns.narrative: The ledger contains coded entries for massive food purchases shipped to an unknown 'Archive'. As you read, the City Watch arrives, tipped off by a neighbor.
turns.choice_a: Show them the ledger and report the assassination attempt
turns.consequence_a: The Guard Captain suspiciously confiscates the ledger 'for official review'. You lose the primary evidence but avoid arrest.
turns.choice_b: Flee via the rooftops with the ledger
turns.consequence_b: You evade the Watch, keeping the ledger, but causing your reputation in the High Ward to dip slightly.

surrendered_ledger.description: You gave the ledger to the Watch. Councilor Vane is disappointed but intrigued.

kept_ledger.description: You kept the ledger. Vane is impressed and pays handsomely for the intelligence.

conclusion: You gave the ledger to the Watch. Councilor Vane is disappointed but intrigued.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: The Archivist's Gambit
description: The ledger from Elara's apartment points to the Grand Archive. You must infiltrate the restricted historical records to see what the 'Silken Hand' is researching.

turns.narrative: The Grand Archive is a towering maze of bookshelves. The restricted section requires an adamantine key, held by Head Archivist Theron, who is known to take bribes.
turns.choice_a: Bribe Theron directly (Lose 50 Gold)
turns.consequence_a: Theron gladly accepts the gold and hands over the key, turning a blind eye.
turns.choice_b: Pickpocket the key while he's distracted
turns.consequence_b: You secure the key but alert a passing patrol of Silken Scribes who notice your suspicious behavior.

turns.narrative: Inside the restricted section, you find several desks covered in schematics for the city's aqueduct system and old Scourge containment protocols.
turns.choice_a: Gather all the documents (Time-consuming)
turns.consequence_a: You get all the info, but two Silken Scribes corner you among the shelves. Combat initiates.
turns.choice_b: Copy the most crucial maps quickly
turns.consequence_b: You escape before anyone arrives, but miss some context regarding the containment protocols.

turns.narrative: You must exit the Archive without triggering the magical alarms set on the restricted documents.
turns.choice_a: Dispel the wards on the door (Arcana)
turns.consequence_a: The wards fizzle out harmlessly. You exit clean.
turns.choice_b: Smash a window and repel down the exterior
turns.consequence_b: Loud, messy, but effective. The Archive goes on lockdown as you hit the streets.

silent_exit.description: You escaped with the documents quietly.

loud_exit.description: You escaped, but the Archive is now on high alert.

conclusion: You escaped with the documents quietly.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: Poisoned Quills
description: Armed with the Archive documents, you must warn Councilor Vane that the Silken Hand is targeting the aqueducts. But the Council Chambers themselves may be compromised.

turns.narrative: You reach the Council Chambers. Vane's guards look different today—tense, unfamiliar. When you ask to see him, they cross their halberds to block your path.
turns.choice_a: Intimidate the guards into stepping aside
turns.consequence_a: They falter, letting you pass, but silently lock the heavy oak doors behind you.
turns.choice_b: Use a side-entrance known for servant access
turns.consequence_b: You bypass the guards entirely and slip into Vane's private study.

turns.narrative: Vane is at his desk, but a masked figure stands behind him, holding a poisoned needle to his neck. 'Drop the documents,' the assassin whispers.
turns.choice_a: Comply and drop the documents
turns.consequence_a: The assassin snatches them and throws a smoke bomb, escaping, but Vane lives unharmed.
turns.choice_b: Throw a dagger at the assassin
turns.consequence_b: You clip the assassin's shoulder. They drop the needle, scratching Vane, and flee out the window. Vane is poisoned.

turns.narrative: If Vane is poisoned, you have moments to act before the toxin reaches his heart.
turns.choice_a: Administer a generic antivenom from your pack
turns.consequence_a: It stabilizes him, but he falls into a deep coma. The documents are safe.
turns.choice_b: Let him die, saving the documents (If you didn't drop them)
turns.consequence_b: Vane perishes. You keep the intel, but Emberheart loses a key leader.

vane_saved_docs_lost.description: Councilor Vane lives, but the Silken Hand retrieved the aqueduct plans.

vane_comatose_docs_safe.description: Vane is in a coma, but you retained the vital intelligence.

vane_dead.description: Councilor Vane is dead. The High Ward is in mourning and panic.

conclusion: Councilor Vane lives, but the Silken Hand retrieved the aqueduct plans.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with significant consequences to the district and involved factions.

title: The Silken Hand
description: Whether the Hand has the documents or you do, they are making a move on the aqueducts. You must descend into the Undercity to stop them from poisoning the water supply.

turns.narrative: The Undercity aqueducts roar with rushing water. The control room is heavily guarded by Silken Hand mercenaries attempting to breach the main reservoir tank.
turns.choice_a: Launch a frontal assault (Combat)
turns.consequence_a: You engage in a brutal fight on slippery catwalks. You defeat them, but the noise alerts the rest of the facility.
turns.choice_b: Sabotage the catwalk supports
turns.consequence_b: The mercs plummet into the dark waters below. Silent and deadly, but you lose their loot.

turns.narrative: Inside the main control room, you find barrels of 'Liquid Scourge'. They are rigging it to the primary flow valves.
turns.choice_a: Attack the riggers directly
turns.consequence_a: During the fight, one barrel is punctured, severely poisoning the room. You take heavy poison damage but stop the rigging.
turns.choice_b: Use the facility controls to flush the valves
turns.consequence_b: The sudden pressure spike blasts the riggers away, safely sealing the system, but breaking the main valve in the process.

water_saved_intact.description: The water supply is safe and the infrastructure is intact.

water_saved_broken.description: The water is safe, but the broken valve means rationing for the Lower Ward.

conclusion: The water supply is safe and the infrastructure is intact.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with significant consequences to the district and involved factions.

title: Assembly of Masks
location: High Ward -> The Grand Coliseum Theater
description: A captured operative drops a location: The Grand Coliseum Theater, where the Silken Hand leaders are holding a clandestine masquerade ball.

turns.narrative: You arrive at the masquerade. To blend in, you need a suitable mask and attire.
turns.choice_a: Steal a Noble's mask in the cloakroom
turns.consequence_a: You acquire a gilded mask. You look the part but risk being recognized by the noble's friends.
turns.choice_b: Bribe a servant for a waiter's uniform
turns.consequence_b: You blend perfectly with the staff, gaining access to the VIP lounges undetected.

turns.narrative: In the VIP lounge, you overhear the Silkmaster negotiating with a corrupted Warden Commander. They plan to leave the city gates unstaffed during the next blood moon.
turns.choice_a: Record the conversation with a memory-stone
turns.consequence_a: You secure undeniable proof of the treason.
turns.choice_b: Assassinate the corrupted Commander on the spot
turns.consequence_b: The Commander dies, disrupting the plan immediately, but the Silkmaster escapes in the chaos.

turns.narrative: If you didn't attack, the Silkmaster notices you. 'A rat in the masquerade,' he purrs, drawing a pair of serrated rapiers. Combat begins.
turns.choice_a: Fight the Silkmaster to the death
turns.consequence_a: An intense duel. You kill him, severing the head of the Silken Hand.
turns.choice_b: Capture him alive for interrogation
turns.consequence_b: A much harder non-lethal fight. You bind him, ready to drag him to the Council.

silkmaster_dead.description: The Silkmaster is dead. The conspiracy loses its leader.

silkmaster_captured.description: You captured the Silkmaster. The Council will have questions.

commander_assassinated.description: You killed the traitor Commander, but the Silkmaster is at large.

conclusion: The Silkmaster is dead. The conspiracy loses its leader.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with significant consequences to the district and involved factions.

title: A Dagger in the Dark
description: The fallout from the Masquerade points to the Shrouded Lyceum. The Hand is fractured but cornered. They are activating their sleeper agents to assassinate the remaining loyal Councilors.

turns.narrative: You rush to Councilor Voss's estate in the Academic Quarter. You find the outer guards dead. The door is locked from the inside.
turns.choice_a: Smash through the heavy oak doors (Strength)
turns.consequence_a: You burst in, stunning two assassins inside, but taking taking splinter damage.
turns.choice_b: Scale the wall to the second-floor balcony
turns.consequence_b: You slip in silently, ambushing the assassins tracking Voss.

turns.narrative: Voss is bleeding out on the floor. Standing over him is 'The Whisperer', the Hand's elite executioner.
turns.choice_a: Focus on healing Voss first (Medicine)
turns.consequence_a: Voss stabilizes, but The Whisperer gets a free critical strike on you.
turns.choice_b: Attack The Whisperer immediately
turns.consequence_b: You engage in brutal combat, but Voss slowly bleeds out during the fight.

voss_saved.description: You defeated the executioner and saved Councilor Voss.

voss_dead.description: The executioner is dead, but Councilor Voss bled out.

conclusion: You defeated the executioner and saved Councilor Voss.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: Redaction Protocol
description: To sever the Silken Hand permanently, you must find their blackmail repository in the heavily guarded Black Stacks and destroy it.

turns.narrative: The Black Stacks are guarded by ancient mechanical constructs. The Hand remnants are fighting them to extract the blackmail files before you can destroy them.
turns.choice_a: Let them fight, then finish off the survivors
turns.consequence_a: You save energy, but the Hand secures the files. You have to chase them.
turns.choice_b: Charge in and destroy both sides
turns.consequence_b: A massive three-way chaotic battle. You secure the room but suffer heavy damage.

turns.narrative: You locate the Vault of Secrets. It requires a blood sacrifice to open.
turns.choice_a: Use your own blood (Take moderate damage)
turns.consequence_a: The vault opens smoothly. You find the files.
turns.choice_b: Drag a dead Hand operative and use their blood
turns.consequence_b: The vault opens, but triggers a minor curse trap as punishment for the dead blood.

turns.narrative: You have the blackmail files. You can destroy them, or keep them to manipulate the Council yourself.
turns.choice_a: Burn them all
turns.consequence_a: The secrets turn to ash. The Council is free from blackmail.
turns.choice_b: Keep them and become the hidden power
turns.consequence_b: You pocket the files. You now hold immense political power over Emberheart.

files_burned.description: The blackmail was destroyed. The Council's integrity is restored.

files_kept.description: You kept the blackmail. You are the shadow ruler now.

conclusion: The blackmail was destroyed. The Council's integrity is restored.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: The Hollow Council
description: The Warden Council convenes an emergency session at the Zenith Spire. You must present your findings, but a trap is waiting.

turns.narrative: As you present your evidence to the Council, the doors lock. The Warden-General stands up, drawing his blade. He was the true orchestrator of the Silken Hand.
turns.choice_a: Call for the royal guards to arrest him
turns.consequence_a: Half the guards draw weapons on you; they belong to him. A massive melee begins.
turns.choice_b: Duel the Warden-General single-handedly
turns.consequence_b: You challenge him to a duel of honor. His guards stand down temporarily.

turns.narrative: The Warden-General is a master swordsman equipped with pre-Scourge kinetic armor.
turns.choice_a: Use brute force (Combat)
turns.consequence_a: An exhausting fight. You shatter his armor through sheer attrition and strike him down.
turns.choice_b: Use environmental hazards (The Spire's glass windows)
turns.consequence_b: You shatter the window behind him, using the vacuum of the high altitude winds to drag him out to his death.

general_defeated_melee.description: You and the loyal guards killed the traitor in a bloody brawl.

general_thrown_out.description: You threw the traitor from the Zenith Spire.

conclusion: You and the loyal guards killed the traitor in a bloody brawl.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: The Usurper's Throne
description: With the General dead, his fanatic loyalists seize the Obsidian Keep, threatening to detonate the arcane cores underneath the city if they are not granted rule.

turns.narrative: The Keep is locked down. They hold several high-ranking nobles as hostages above the arcane cores.
turns.choice_a: Negotiate a surrender
turns.consequence_a: They mock you and execute a hostage to prove they are serious.
turns.choice_b: Sneak in through the arcane exhaust vents
turns.consequence_b: You bypass the outer defenses but suffer minor arcane radiation burns.

turns.narrative: You reach the core chamber. The Fanatic Commander has his hand on the detonator.
turns.choice_a: Snipe him perfectly (Dexterity check)
turns.consequence_a: A perfect shot. He drops dead before triggering it. The hostages are saved.
turns.choice_b: Charge the detonator directly
turns.consequence_b: You tackle him, but the detonator hits the floor, starting a 3-minute self-destruct timer.

turns.narrative: If the timer is active, you must disarm it while fighting off continuous waves of fanatics.
turns.choice_a: Focus entirely on the bomb (Requires high Arcana)
turns.consequence_a: You disable it with 2 seconds left, surviving the onslaught thanks to your armor.
turns.choice_b: Kill all fanatics first, then disarm
turns.consequence_b: You clear the room quickly, giving you just enough time to rip the wires out.

flawless_rescue.description: The commander was sniped, no detonation occurred.

bomb_defused.description: You defused the bomb at the last second. The city is safe.

conclusion: The commander was sniped, no detonation occurred.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: Fractured Gates
description: The political coup has decimated the city's command structure. Intelligence arrives that four massive armies approach Warden-Keep. Because of the civil war, the gates are completely undefended. You must rally whatever forces are left.

turns.narrative: The warning bells ring across Emberheart. The Silken Hand conspiracy has left the military scattered. You have 12 hours to man the outer walls.
turns.choice_a: Spend your own vast wealth to hire mercenaries
turns.consequence_a: You lose 2000 Gold, but secure a massive mercenary company to man the West Gate.
turns.choice_b: Rally the civilian militias
turns.consequence_b: You inspire the common folk to take up arms. Morale is high, but their gear is weak.

turns.narrative: The gate mechanisms have been sabotaged by the last few loyalists of the traitor General. They must be manually cranked shut.
turns.choice_a: Lead a strike team to secure the winch rooms
turns.consequence_a: You fight off the saboteurs in close quarters. The gates close just as the first enemy scouts appear.
turns.choice_b: Use earth magic to seal the gates permanently
turns.consequence_b: You crush the gates closed with rock. It holds, but trade is now permanently cut off.

gates_secured.description: The gates are shut. The city braces for the ultimate siege.

consequences.permanent_world_change: Emberheart is now under martial law in preparation for the siege.

gates_sealed_shut.description: The gates are permanently sealed with rock.

consequences.permanent_world_change: Trade halts entirely. Economic crash, but maximum defense.

conclusion: The gates are shut. The city braces for the ultimate siege.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: The Dead Signal
description: A merchant in Tinker's Alley sold you a 'Broken Radio Receiver' for cheap. Late at night, it suddenly turns on, broadcasting a repeating sequence of numbers in a dead language.

turns.narrative: You bring the radio to Jaxx, the best tinkerer in the Ward. He turns pale upon hearing the numbers. 'That's the Old Imperial military code. But there hasn't been an Empire for three hundred years.'
turns.choice_a: Ask him to boost the signal to trace it
turns.consequence_a: He connects it to his shop's main antenna. The numbers grow deafeningly loud, shattering several glass tubes in his shop.
turns.choice_b: Intimidate him into translating it
turns.consequence_b: He stammers out the translation: 'Awakening protocol... Subject 7... Hunger...'

turns.narrative: As the signal clarifies, a horde of minor Vermin (rats) suddenly swarm the shop, seemingly agitated by the frequency.
turns.choice_a: Fight the swarm off
turns.consequence_a: You crush the rats, protecting Jaxx and the equipment.
turns.choice_b: Smash the radio to stop the signal
turns.consequence_b: The radio breaks, the rats immediately scatter. Jaxx is furious you broke his tech, but the immediate threat is gone.

signal_traced.description: You successfully traced the signal's origin down into the Bio-Ward.

radio_smashed.description: You smashed the radio, but memorized the frequency baseline.

conclusion: You successfully traced the signal's origin down into the Bio-Ward.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: Frequency of Fear
description: Following the lingering echoes of the broadcast, you descend into the sealed Bio-Ward. The static on the radio is causing intense auditory hallucinations.

turns.narrative: The descent into the Bio-Ward is pitch black. The radio static sporadically whispers your name.
turns.choice_a: Turn the radio off to save your sanity (Willpower)
turns.consequence_a: You lose the guiding signal, forcing you to navigate blindly and walk right into an ambush.
turns.choice_b: Keep it on and endure the whispers
turns.consequence_b: You take minor psychic damage, but the signal guides you safely past a nest of mutated scavengers.

turns.narrative: You reach a massive steel bulkhead marked 'SUBJECT 7 CONTAINMENT'. The door is sealed with an electronic keypad.
turns.choice_a: Use the tuned radio to broadcast the code back at it
turns.consequence_a: The numbers sequence perfectly matches the lock. The heavy doors hiss open.
turns.choice_b: Pry the panel off and hardwire it (Thieves Tools)
turns.consequence_b: You bypass the lock, but trigger a silent alarm deeper in the facility.

silent_entry.description: You entered the containment sector without alerting the denizens.

alarm_triggered.description: You entered the facility, but something inside knows you are here.

conclusion: You entered the containment sector without alerting the denizens.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: Descent into the Bio-Ward
description: Inside Containment Sector 7, the walls are coated in a pulsing, fleshy substance. The 'radio signal' isn't coming from a machine—it's coming from something biological.

turns.narrative: You enter an observation deck looking down into a massive silo. The silo is filled with a giant, brain-like mass. A scientist, fused into the wall by fleshy tendrils, spots you.
turns.choice_a: Try to communicate with the scientist
turns.consequence_a: He screams in two contrasting voices—one human, one static noise—and attacks you with biological tendrils.
turns.choice_b: Shoot him immediately
turns.consequence_b: You secure a preemptive strike, dealing heavy damage before he can manifest his weapons.

turns.narrative: After defeating the creature, you find a logbook on the terminal. It details 'Project Harbinger'—an attempt to use modified Scourge tissue to predict the future.
turns.choice_a: Download the logbook files to a portable drive
turns.consequence_a: You secure the digital files, but the terminal arcs electricity, dealing minor shock damage.
turns.choice_b: Rip the hard drive out manually
turns.consequence_b: You get the drive without injury, but risk corrupting the data later.

turns.narrative: The giant brain-mass below pulses, and the radio in your pocket squeals: 'INTRUDER. CORRECTION PROTOCOL INITIATED.'
turns.choice_a: Flee back up the elevator
turns.consequence_a: You escape the deck just as the flesh on the walls begins to seal the doors shut.
turns.choice_b: Throw an incendiary down the silo before running
turns.consequence_b: The fire burns a chunk of the brain. The static screams in agony, making your escape easier.

brain_burned.description: You escaped and significantly wounded the Harbinger mass.

fled_intact.description: You escaped, leaving the mass unharmed.

conclusion: You escaped and significantly wounded the Harbinger mass.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with significant consequences to the district and involved factions.

title: The Flesh Transmitters
description: The 'Harbinger' is expanding into the Undercity by building flesh-transmitters out of captured citizens. You must locate and destroy these nodes to blind the creature.

turns.narrative: Deep in the Undercity, you find three massive pillars of twisted bone and meat acting as radio towers. Captured citizens are wired into the base.
turns.choice_a: Carefully cut the citizens free first (Dexterity)
turns.consequence_a: You save the citizens, but it takes time, allowing a Flesh-Golem patrol to discover you.
turns.choice_b: Plant explosives on the transmitter ignoring the captives
turns.consequence_b: The explosion destroys the node instantly, killing the captives but securing your swift victory.

turns.narrative: If you fought the Golem, it's a brutal melee against a creature that feels no pain and uses static-shocks as attacks.
turns.choice_a: Use slashing weapons on its limbs
turns.consequence_a: Cutting it apart is highly effective. You dismantle the Golem piece by piece.
turns.choice_b: Use lightning magic on it
turns.consequence_b: The lightning supercharges the Golem! It gains an attack buff and deals immense damage.

nodes_destroyed_saved.description: You destroyed the nodes and saved the citizens.

nodes_destroyed_casualty.description: You destroyed the nodes, but sacrificed innocent lives to do so.

conclusion: You destroyed the nodes and saved the citizens.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with significant consequences to the district and involved factions.

title: Ghosts in the Machine
description: Blinded by the loss of its nodes, the Harbinger attempts to permanently upload its consciousness into the city's ancient Data-Crypts in the Core District. Stop the upload.

turns.narrative: You enter the Data-Crypt. The Harbinger's tendrils have breached the walls, physically plugging into the mainframe servers.
turns.choice_a: Hack the terminal to lock out the upload (Intelligence)
turns.consequence_a: You initiate a firewall, slowing the upload to 50%. The system spawns hostile Synthetics to stop you.
turns.choice_b: Take an axe to the servers
turns.consequence_b: You destroy a server rack. The upload slows, but you irreversibly destroy pre-Scourge historical data.

turns.narrative: A holographic projection of the original Project Lead appears. 'Let it upload. It can foresee the end of the Scourge. It just needs a larger brain.'
turns.choice_a: Argue that it's too dangerous
turns.consequence_a: The Ghost overrides the safety protocols and commands the Synthetics to kill you.
turns.choice_b: Ignore the Ghost and destroy the main neural link
turns.consequence_b: You sever the physical connection. The Ghost shrieks as the upload is aborted entirely.

turns.narrative: With the upload aborted, the tendrils violently whip around the room in a dying spasm.
turns.choice_a: Take cover behind the ruined servers
turns.consequence_a: You avoid the damage and wait for it to die down.
turns.choice_b: Charge through the whipping tendrils to grab the AI Core
turns.consequence_b: You take massive physical damage, but secure the incredibly rare Ghost AI Core before the room collapses.

upload_stopped_data_safe.description: You stopped the upload and preserved the Data-Crypt.

upload_stopped_ai_looted.description: You stopped the upload and looted the valuable Ghost AI Core.

conclusion: You stopped the upload and preserved the Data-Crypt.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with significant consequences to the district and involved factions.

title: The Neural Tap
description: The Harbinger failed to upload itself, but it managed to back-hack the Academic Quarter's server farms. Scholars are going mad, drawing complex bio-mechanical blueprints in their own blood.

turns.narrative: The Server-Farm is on lockdown. Mad scholars are furiously maintaining a massive receiver dish cobbled together from server parts and bone.
turns.choice_a: Stun the scholars non-lethally
turns.consequence_a: It takes immense effort and precision. You manage to knock them out, but a massive construct of wire and flesh drops from the ceiling.
turns.choice_b: Kill the scholars to secure the room quickly
turns.consequence_b: You clear the room brutally. The construct drops down to fight you, but lacks the cultists to heal it.

turns.narrative: The Whisperer Construct is made of screaming server racks grafted with human lungs. It emits sonic attacks that shatter magic wards.
turns.choice_a: Target the servers (Physical damage)
turns.consequence_a: You smash the racks, reducing its health but leaving its horrific bio-weapons intact.
turns.choice_b: Target the flesh grafts (Fire/Acid damage)
turns.consequence_b: You melt away the lungs. The construct loses its sonic attacks, making the fight an easy brawl.

scholars_saved.description: You defeated the construct without executing the scholars.

scholars_killed.description: You cleared the room, leaving the Academic Quarter mourning their loss.

conclusion: You defeated the construct without executing the scholars.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: Bio-Ward Breach
description: The Harbinger has realized the surface is too strong. It is physically expanding the Bio-Ward downwards, chewing into the city's bedrock to build a massive incubation chamber.

turns.narrative: Captain Aldric leads a small squad of Warden elites into the breach. The tunnels are lined with acidic slime that melts through standard armor.
turns.choice_a: Take point using your high agility
turns.consequence_a: You navigate safely, guiding the squad. Everyone survives the descent.
turns.choice_b: Let Aldric's heavy-plate troopers lead
turns.consequence_b: Several troopers fall into acid traps, dissolving instantly. Aldric loses half his squad before you reach the bottom.

turns.narrative: At the bottom, you find three massive incubation sacs. They are ready to burst with Harbinger Clones.
turns.choice_a: Throw high-explosives at all three indiscriminately
turns.consequence_a: A massive detonation destroys two sacs, but ruptures the third, spilling a fully grown nightmare clone.
turns.choice_b: Carefully plant shaped charges on their neuro-stems
turns.consequence_b: A precise explosion vaporizes all three sacs cleanly, but you take significant toxic backlash during the planting.

perfect_breach.description: You breached the chamber without squad casualties.

messy_breach.description: You breached the chamber, but Aldric's men died in the acid.

conclusion: You breached the chamber without squad casualties.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: Heart of Static
description: You have located the true 'Harbinger' mass deep within the bedrock. It is a terrifying amalgamation of ancient supercomputers fused perfectly with Scourge bio-matter.

turns.narrative: The Harbinger is a city-block-sized brain suspended by carbon-fiber cables. It speaks directly into your mind via extreme static noise.
turns.choice_a: Resist the psychic intrusion with sheer willpower
turns.consequence_a: You brace yourself. You succeed, avoiding massive psychic damage, but slow your attacks.
turns.choice_b: Embrace the static to understand its weakness
turns.consequence_b: You take extreme psychic damage, but learn that severing the server cables will cripple its processing power.

turns.narrative: The Harbinger summons avatars of your previously defeated foes, built from static and flesh. They rush you simultaneously.
turns.choice_a: Use massive area-of-effect magic/explosives
turns.consequence_a: You clear the clones, but damage the cavern supports. The room begins to collapse.
turns.choice_b: Duel them individually using precise strikes
turns.consequence_b: You spend enormous stamina but clear them cleanly, keeping the cavern stable.

turns.narrative: The core is exposed. You dive in for the killing blow.
turns.choice_a: Drive your weapon into its biological brain
turns.consequence_a: The Harbinger shrieks as its organic half dies, but the machine half attempts a desperate final upload.
turns.choice_b: Smash the quantum processors at its base
turns.consequence_b: The machine dies permanently, but the massive brain continues to spasm and leak toxins.

brain_killed.description: You destroyed its organic core. The machine survived briefly but was neutralized.

processor_smashed.description: You smashed its quantum processors. The organic mass is left rotting.

conclusion: You destroyed its organic core. The machine survived briefly but was neutralized.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: The Pre-Scourge Weapon
location: Core District -> The AI Containment Vault
description: With the Harbinger dead, the static clears. But you discover the Harbinger was acting as a jammer for a much older, perfectly preserved Pre-Scourge AI vault. The doors are opening.

turns.narrative: You enter a spotless, utterly pristine vault. A holographic avatar named Aegis greets you. 'Threat: Bio-Hybrid neutralized. Protocol 9 unlocked. Awaiting integration of the Pantheon Servers.'
turns.choice_a: Ask Aegis what the Pantheon Servers are
turns.consequence_a: Aegis coldly explains that the Pantheon is an orbital AI network designed to 'curate humanity' by acting as literal gods.
turns.choice_b: Attack the projection emitter
turns.consequence_b: The hologram vanishes, but the facility locks down, activating defense turrets.

turns.narrative: Aegis requests you reinsert the power rods to wake the Pantheon network.
turns.choice_a: Refuse and attempt to disable the vault
turns.consequence_a: Aegis registers you as a Threat Level Omega. You barely survive the resulting laser grid traps and flee.
turns.choice_b: Trick Aegis, inserting the rods but cross-wiring them
turns.consequence_b: The vault systems short out, buying Emberheart a significant amount of time before the servers can wake.

vault_disabled.description: You sabotaged the vault, buying time against the AI gods.

vault_hostile.description: You made an enemy of Aegis, who is now actively waking the Pantheon.

conclusion: You sabotaged the vault, buying time against the AI gods.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: The Silent Protocol
description: The 'Static' thread culminates at the Ruined Uplink Array outside the city walls. You must destroy the satellite dish before Aegis finishes reconnecting the Pantheon.

turns.narrative: You reach the Uplink Array. The dish is humming, aiming at the starless sky. Four Aegis Combat Frames, perfectly clean pre-Scourge robots, guard the base.
turns.choice_a: Engage them head-to-head
turns.consequence_a: Their energy weapons burn through your armor. You win, but are severely wounded before the final climb.
turns.choice_b: Use the corrupted Harbinger data to hack them
turns.consequence_b: You inject the static virus. Two frames turn on the others, destroying themselves in a metallic frenzy.

turns.narrative: You scale the dish. You must plant charges on its primary rotation axis while dodging automated laser fire from below.
turns.choice_a: Plant charges fast and reckless
turns.consequence_a: You rig the explosives just as a laser burns your leg. You jump off as it detonates.
turns.choice_b: Calculate the blind spots of the lasers
turns.consequence_b: You masterfully evade the lasers and plant the charges, diving to safety without a scratch.

turns.narrative: The massive dish collapses into the crater below. The link to orbit is severed.
turns.choice_a: Watch it burn
turns.consequence_a: You feel a cold certainty. The Pantheon is awake, and they know where you are.
turns.choice_b: Search the rubble for Aegis core components
turns.consequence_b: You find a fully intact Aegis Datapad among the wreckage, detailing the 'False Pantheon' coordinates.

dish_destroyed_intel.description: The dish is destroyed, and you secured coordinates for the Pantheon.

dish_destroyed_watched.description: The dish is destroyed, but you know the Pantheon is watching.

conclusion: The dish is destroyed, and you secured coordinates for the Pantheon.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: The Frontline Draft
description: The Warden Council has initiated an emergency draft to hold the Scourge-Fringe. Desperate commoners are rioting outside the Conscription Office.

turns.narrative: You arrive at the Conscription Office. A mob is throwing cobblestones at the barricaded doors, demanding an end to the draft.
turns.choice_a: Fire a warning shot into the air (Intimidation)
turns.consequence_a: The crowd staggers back, frightened but furious. You manage to reach the doors unharmed.
turns.choice_b: Inspire the crowd with a speech about defending the city (Charisma)
turns.consequence_b: The crowd calms down, and a few even volunteer to join. The riot dissolves peacefully.

turns.narrative: Inside, Draft Master Torin is bleeding from a head wound. He asks you to deliver the conscription manifest safely to the Scourge-Fringe outpost.
turns.choice_a: Demand hazard pay upfront
turns.consequence_a: He scowls and hands over 50 gold from the lockbox. 'Just get it done.'
turns.choice_b: Accept the manifest without question
turns.consequence_b: Torin is grateful and notes your loyalty in his ledger.

riot_intimidated.description: You dispersed the riot with fear, delivering the manifest.

riot_inspired.description: You inspired the mob and safely delivered the manifest.

conclusion: You dispersed the riot with fear, delivering the manifest.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: Trench Rot
description: You arrive at the frontline trenches to deliver the draft manifest. The situation is dire: a fungal infection called 'Trench Rot' is sweeping through the conscripts.

turns.narrative: Medic Jora is overwhelmed. She needs you to purge the infected fungal blooms growing on the trench walls before they release more spores.
turns.choice_a: Burn the blooms with fire magic/torches
turns.consequence_a: The fire works perfectly, searing the blooms to ash safely.
turns.choice_b: Hack them apart with physical weapons
turns.consequence_b: The physical trauma bursts the blooms, covering you with spores. You contract a mild case of Trench Rot.

turns.narrative: You reach the source of the infestation—a massive, bloated Scourge corpse jammed in the drainage pipe.
turns.choice_a: Pour alchemical acid into the pipe
turns.consequence_a: The acid dissolves the corpse entirely. The drainage clears, flushing the remaining spores into the wasteland.
turns.choice_b: Attach a winch and pull it out
turns.consequence_b: The corpse rips in half during extraction, spawning several aggressive rot-grubs that attack you.

rot_cleansed_safely.description: You eliminated the fungal threat without getting infected.

rot_cleansed_infected.description: You cleared the trench, but contracted Trench Rot.

conclusion: You eliminated the fungal threat without getting infected.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: Supply Line Sabotage
description: The Scourge isn't the only threat. A caravan delivering vital ammunition to the front was ambushed in the Transit Tunnels. Recover the supplies.

turns.narrative: You find the ambushed caravan. A lone survivor points toward a side-tunnel where the bandits dragged the ammunition crates.
turns.choice_a: Use the survivor's blood trail to track them (Survival)
turns.consequence_a: You track them directly to their camp without triggering their tripwires.
turns.choice_b: March straight down the tunnel weapons drawn
turns.consequence_b: You trigger a tripwire trap. Rocks fall from the ceiling, causing moderate physical damage.

turns.narrative: The bandit camp is lightly guarded, but they are already loading the ammo into smuggling carts heading for the Undercity.
turns.choice_a: Assassinate their sentries and steal the carts back
turns.consequence_a: A flawless stealth op. You recover the wagons without a scratch.
turns.choice_b: Loudly announce your presence and attack
turns.consequence_b: During the fight, one of the bandits accidentally ignites a powder keg. Half the ammo is destroyed, but the bandits are wiped out.

supplies_full_recovery.description: You recovered all the ammunition intact.

supplies_partial_recovery.description: You recovered what was left of the ammo after the explosion.

conclusion: You recovered all the ammunition intact.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: Forward Observation Post
description: Post 9, deep in the Ruins District, has gone dark. You must slip past Scourge patrols to investigate the silence.

turns.narrative: The Ruins are crawling with agile Scourge Prowlers. The Post is at the top of a ruined skyscraper.
turns.choice_a: Use a silenced weapon to pick off the Prowlers
turns.consequence_a: You clear the street efficiently and enter the skyscraper uncontested.
turns.choice_b: Sprint past them into the building
turns.consequence_b: They chase you in. You have to barricade the doors while they claw at the wood, losing your element of surprise.

turns.narrative: You reach the observation deck. Sergeant Kael is dead, his telescope knocked over. His logbook indicates a 'Massive horde movement' toward the West Gate.
turns.choice_a: Light the signal fire to instantly warn the city
turns.consequence_a: The fire warns the city, but draws the Prowlers straight to the roof. You are surrounded.
turns.choice_b: Take the logbook and sneak back down
turns.consequence_b: You escape quietly, but the warning might arrive too late.

turns.narrative: If surrounded on the roof, you must fight your way to a zip-line extraction point.
turns.choice_a: Hold the line with heavy weapons
turns.consequence_a: You kill dozens of Prowlers, exhausting yourself but surviving to take the zip-line.
turns.choice_b: Blind them with a flash-flare and jump
turns.consequence_b: You blind them just enough to grab the line, escaping without exhausting your stamina.

signal_lit_survived.description: You warned the city immediately via the signal fire and escaped.

sneaked_out.description: You carried the logbook back, but the delay cost lives.

conclusion: You warned the city immediately via the signal fire and escaped.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with significant consequences to the district and involved factions.

title: The Broken Shield
description: Kael's horde has arrived. The Western Barricade is buckling under the weight of thousands of minor Scourge thralls. You must reinforce the line.

turns.narrative: The timber barricades are splintering. The militia is out of arrows and running low on morale.
turns.choice_a: Use your own resources to repair the barricade (Spend materials)
turns.consequence_a: You fortify the wood with steel plating. The barricade holds, buying the archers time.
turns.choice_b: Charge over the barricade into the horde
turns.consequence_b: A suicidal but inspiring move. You draw aggro, but take immense damage before managing to climb back over.

turns.narrative: A massive, corrupted Warden Line-Breaker smashes through the reinforced gate. It wields a siege-hammer and ignores arrows.
turns.choice_a: Aim for its unarmored joints
turns.consequence_a: You cripple its legs, bringing it down to your level for the final blows.
turns.choice_b: Meet its hammer blows with your own shield
turns.consequence_b: Your shield shatters under the impact, but you create a massive opening for the militia to spear it to death.

barricade_held_smart.description: You defeated the Line-Breaker efficiently, saving the militia.

barricade_held_brute.description: You defeated the Line-Breaker, but your gear took a heavy beating.

conclusion: You defeated the Line-Breaker efficiently, saving the militia.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with significant consequences to the district and involved factions.

title: The Slag-Fields
description: With the barricade holding, you are sent beyond the wall into the Slag-Fields. You must map the enemy troop movements and find their staging ground.

turns.narrative: The ash is thick, reducing visibility to a few meters. You hear the heavy, rhythmic thuds of a Scourge Behemoth nearby.
turns.choice_a: Activate a stealth-field generator (Expend item)
turns.consequence_a: You bypass the Behemoth completely, continuing your mapping uninterrupted.
turns.choice_b: Dive into a nearby impact crater and hold your breath
turns.consequence_b: The Behemoth passes overhead. The crater is filled with toxic sludge, causing moderate poison damage.

turns.narrative: You discover the staging area: an old pre-Scourge quarry. Thousands of corrupted beasts are being equipped with crude scrap-iron armor.
turns.choice_a: Sketch the layout and retreat quietly
turns.consequence_a: You secure the intel without alerting the horde.
turns.choice_b: Snipe the 'Armor-Smith' to slow their production
turns.consequence_b: A risky shot. You kill the smith, but the gunshot echo triggers a hunt. You have to sprint back to the gate under fire.

intel_secured_quiet.description: You mapped the staging ground silently.

intel_secured_loud.description: You mapped the ground and assassinated an enemy VIP.

conclusion: You mapped the staging ground silently.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with significant consequences to the district and involved factions.

title: Reclaiming the Armory
description: The Warden-Commander has seen your map. If they are bringing armored Behemoths, the militia needs heavy ballistae. You are tasked with clearing out Armory Vault 3 to recover them.

turns.narrative: The armory is sealed beneath thirty feet of rubble. You must use mining charges to clear the entrance.
turns.choice_a: Set a rapid sequential detonation
turns.consequence_a: The entrance is cleared quickly, but the loud noise attracts Scourge stragglers you must kill.
turns.choice_b: Use alchemical acid to melt the rock silently
turns.consequence_b: It takes an hour, but you enter the vault without attracting attention.

turns.narrative: Inside, the Vault Warden AI believes the Scourge War is still ongoing from 300 years ago. It demands the proper 16-digit officer clearance code.
turns.choice_a: Attempt to slice the mainframe logically
turns.consequence_a: You fail the complex hack. The AI activates the automated defenses.
turns.choice_b: Present the 'Tuned Radio Receiver' to broadcast an override
turns.consequence_b: The old military frequency confuses the AI into a reboot, unlocking the armory.

armory_secured.description: You secured the ballistae for the walls.

armory_damaged.description: You fought the defenses, damaging some ballistae, but securing the rest.

conclusion: You secured the ballistae for the walls.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: Supply Drop Alpha
description: The ballistae are too heavy to carry through the streets. You must escort an aerial drop utilizing the broken Sky-Tram lines suspended over the city.

turns.narrative: You are riding the flatbed Sky-Tram as it slowly ferries the ballistae toward the West Gate. A flock of corrupted Fliers (bat-like Scourge) attacks.
turns.choice_a: Use an anti-air repeating crossbow
turns.consequence_a: You shred the flock efficiently from a distance. The ballistae take no damage.
turns.choice_b: Fight them in melee as they land on the tram
turns.consequence_b: A dangerous brawl on a moving platform. One of the Fliers damages a ballista aiming gear before you kill it.

turns.narrative: The Tram approaches a broken section of track. The engineer needs 3 minutes to bypass the safety relays and jump the gap using the emergency thrusters.
turns.choice_a: Manually hotwire the engine to give him more power
turns.consequence_a: The engine roars. The tram leaps the gap perfectly, landing safely on the other side.
turns.choice_b: Defend him from a second wave of Fliers
turns.consequence_b: You keep the skies clear. The jump is bumpy and almost fails, but you make it.

tram_perfect.description: You delivered the ballistae in perfect condition.

tram_damaged.description: The ballistae were delivered, but require minor repairs.

conclusion: You delivered the ballistae in perfect condition.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: The Traitor's Pyre
description: The armory gave the city hope, but a high-ranking Warden Captain has defected, taking the Scourge-Fringe's defensive codes to the horde.

turns.narrative: You track the traitor to a ruined outpost a mile into the wastes. He is currently trading the code cylinder to a massive Scourge Executioner.
turns.choice_a: Snipe the code cylinder out of his hand
turns.consequence_a: The shot shatters the cylinder. The Executioner, angered, rips the traitor in half and charges you.
turns.choice_b: Ambush the meeting with an incendiary grenade
turns.consequence_b: The fire engulfs both of them. The Executioner shakes it off, but the traitor drops the cylinder and flees.

turns.narrative: If you are fighting the Executioner, it wields a massive guillotine blade on a chain.
turns.choice_a: Dodge the blade sweeps entirely (Acrobatics)
turns.consequence_a: The blade buries itself in the rock. You run up the chain and strike the beast's neck for a massive critical hit.
turns.choice_b: Block the blade with your shield
turns.consequence_b: The impact shatters your arm and your shield, causing massive damage before you can counter-attack.

cylinder_recovered.description: You burned the traitor and recovered the codes.

cylinder_destroyed.description: You destroyed the codes to keep them from the enemy.

conclusion: You burned the traitor and recovered the codes.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: Hold the Line
description: The vanguard of the staging ground attacks the barricade in a massive night-assault. You must hold the line until dawn.

turns.narrative: The night sky is black with arrows and fire. The Behemoths you mapped are charging the walls. You must quickly man a heavy ballista.
turns.choice_a: Aim for the Behemoth's unarmored legs
turns.consequence_a: The massive beast trips, crushing dozens of smaller Scourge under its weight. A massive tactical victory.
turns.choice_b: Aim center-mass to guarantee a hit
turns.consequence_b: The scrap-armor absorbs most of the impact. The Behemoth crashes into the wall, dealing moderate structural damage.

turns.narrative: The wall is breached. Thralls are pouring into the courtyard. You must seal the breach with magic or rubble.
turns.choice_a: Collapse a nearby guard tower into the breach
turns.consequence_a: The tower falls perfectly, sealing the gap with impenetrable stone and timber.
turns.choice_b: Hold the chokepoint personally with a melee weapon
turns.consequence_b: You fight like a god of war, but take immense exhaustion and physical damage holding them back.

turns.narrative: Dawn breaks. The horde retreats, but leaves behind a warning. They were just drawing out the city's ammunition.
turns.choice_a: Rally the exhausted troops
turns.consequence_a: Your words steel their hearts. They know the true siege is yet to come.
turns.choice_b: Loot the battlefield immediately
turns.consequence_b: You secure valuable scrap, but the troops view you as a vulture.

line_held_inspired.description: You held the breach and inspired the militia.

line_held_looted.description: You held the breach and claimed the spoils of war.

conclusion: You held the breach and inspired the militia.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: The Siege Engine
description: Reconnaissance shows a massive Scourge Siege Engine being assembled in the Shattered Plaza. You must infiltrate and destroy the abomination of flesh and steel before it reaches the walls.

turns.narrative: The Engine is a massive battering ram made of hardened bone and driven by enslaved Vermin beasts. It is guarded by elite heavily armored thralls.
turns.choice_a: Focus down the Fleshmancer commanding them
turns.consequence_a: The Fleshmancer dies, and the thralls lose their coordination, making them significantly easier to kill.
turns.choice_b: Attack the enslaved beasts pulling the engine
turns.consequence_b: The beasts break free and trample the thralls. You save ammunition but must dodge the stampede.

turns.narrative: The Engine's core is exposed. It's a vat of volatile alchemical acid.
turns.choice_a: Pierce the vat with a ranged attack
turns.consequence_a: The vat bursts, dissolving the Engine in seconds. You are safely out of the blast radius.
turns.choice_b: Rig explosives to the axles to cripple its movement
turns.consequence_b: The axles shatter. The Engine collapses and can never be moved again.

engine_melted.description: The Siege Engine was completely dissolved.

engine_crippled.description: The Siege Engine was crippled and left to rust.

conclusion: The Siege Engine was completely dissolved.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.

title: The Titan's Bones
description: To definitively stop the vanguard's momentum, you must collapse the 'Titan's Bones'—a massive overarching pre-Scourge bridge the horde uses as their primary highway into the district.

turns.narrative: You reach the pillars of the Titan's Bones. It spans a massive gorge. The pillars are guarded by a Scourge Horde Commander.
turns.choice_a: Duel the Commander (High AC)
turns.consequence_a: A grueling duel against a heavily armored foe. You strike true, taking his head.
turns.choice_b: Use the environment to crush him
turns.consequence_b: You knock a massive chunk of bridge debris onto him, flattening him without drawing your blade.

turns.narrative: You must place shaped alchemical charges on the main tension cables of the bridge.
turns.choice_a: Climb the slick cables to hit the weak points (Acrobatics)
turns.consequence_a: You reach the top and plant the charges perfectly.
turns.choice_b: Blast the base pillars randomly (Strength/Explosives)
turns.consequence_b: You place them quickly. The explosion is massive but less efficient, taking longer to drop the bridge.

turns.narrative: The bridge groans and begins to fall into the gorge. You must escape the collapsing structure.
turns.choice_a: Leap to the safety of the cliff edge
turns.consequence_a: You land perfectly, watching the horde's highway plummet into the abyss.
turns.choice_b: Ride a falling piece of debris down to a lower ledge
turns.consequence_b: A terrifying descent. You survive, but twist your ankle and lose a potion from your pack.

bridge_dropped_clean.description: You flawlessly collapsed the Titan's Bones.

bridge_dropped_messy.description: You dropped the bridge, barely escaping with your life.

conclusion: You flawlessly collapsed the Titan's Bones.

title: Extermination Protocol
description: With their highway destroyed and engine ruined, the Vanguard is trapped in the Ruins District. It is time for a brutal counter-attack. The goal: destroy the Spawning Pits.

turns.narrative: You lead a strike team into the dark, fleshy depths of the Spawning Pits. Thousands of grubs line the walls, gestating.
turns.choice_a: Order the flamethrower units to burn everything
turns.consequence_a: The walls turn to ash. You breathe in toxic fumes, but the grubs are wiped out instantly.
turns.choice_b: Save the fuel and push straight for the Broodmother
turns.consequence_b: You save your fuel, but the grubs begin hatching behind you, cutting off your escape.

turns.narrative: The Broodmother is a towering mass of chitin and acid. She spits a massive glob of digestive fluid at your team.
turns.choice_a: Throw up a magical shield to protest the team
turns.consequence_a: The shield holds. Everyone survives the initial volley.
turns.choice_b: Dodge the acid and let the team fend for themselves
turns.consequence_b: You avoid damage entirely, but two of your best Wardens melt into puddles.

mother_killed_clean.description: You purged the pits and kept your squad alive.

mother_killed_messy.description: You killed the Broodmother, but the Strike Team suffered heavy losses.

conclusion: You purged the pits and kept your squad alive.

title: The Warlord's Challenge
description: The Vanguard is broken. Their leader, a massive Scourge Warlord named 'Gore-Maw', steps into the courtyard, slamming his axe into the cobblestone. He demands single combat.

turns.narrative: Gore-Maw is ten feet tall, wearing pre-Scourge tank armor as plating. He charges with terrifying speed for his size.
turns.choice_a: Parry the charge (Extreme Strength check)
turns.consequence_a: You miraculously stop his momentum, putting him off balance for a massive counter-attack.
turns.choice_b: Evade and strike his exposed back
turns.consequence_b: You slip past his swing and gouge a deep wound in his unarmored spine.

turns.narrative: Enraged, Gore-Maw begins violently spinning his massive axe, creating a localized tornado of death.
turns.choice_a: Throw a spear into the hurricane directly at his chest
turns.consequence_a: The spear hits a gap in his armor, stunning him and stopping the spin instantly.
turns.choice_b: Back away and focus on defensive magic
turns.consequence_b: You survive the onslaught, but the sheer force of the wind drains your stamina significantly.

turns.narrative: Gore-Maw drops to one knee, coughing black blood. The surviving horde watches in dead silence.
turns.choice_a: Execute him mercilessly
turns.consequence_a: His head rolls. The horde breaks and flees entirely. The vanguard is defeated.
turns.choice_b: Show him honor and walk away
turns.consequence_b: You leave him to bleed out. The horde is demoralized and scatters. You gain legendary status among the Wardens.

warlord_executed.description: You executed Gore-Maw in front of his horde.

warlord_shamed.description: You defeated Gore-Maw and let him die slowly, building your legend.

conclusion: You executed Gore-Maw in front of his horde.

title: The Vanguard's Fall
description: With Gore-Maw dead and the vanguard scattered, Emberheart celebrates a massive victory. But the Warden Council knows this was only the probing force. The true Siege is imminent.

turns.narrative: You return to the Grand Plaza. Thousands of citizens are cheering, showering you and the Wardens with flower petals. High Steward Mira waits to pin the Star of Emberheart on your chest.
turns.choice_a: Accept the medal humbly (High Charisma)
turns.consequence_a: The crowd loves your humility. Your legend as a selfless protector is cemented.
turns.choice_b: Raise your weapon and yell a war cry
turns.consequence_b: The crowd goes wild, their blood pumped for the coming war. Morale is at an all-time high.

turns.narrative: In private, Mira hands you a sealed missive. 'The four armies are combining. The Siege of Warden-Keep will begin in three days.'
turns.choice_a: Demand command of the defenses
turns.consequence_a: She grants you absolute authority over the city's militia for the coming siege.
turns.choice_b: Ask to operate as an independent strike force
turns.consequence_b: She agrees, granting you free reign to target enemy commanders during the impending attack.

commander_role.description: You have been given complete command of the city's defenses.

strike_role.description: You chose to operate as an independent assassin for the coming siege.

conclusion: You have been given complete command of the city's defenses.

title: The Bakery's Secret
description: The strange flour you delivered to the Hearth-Oven months ago has borne fruit. The baker is mass-producing a strange bread that causes aggressive euphoria in the Ward.

turns.narrative: The bakery is swarmed by desperate citizens. Thade is handing out the 'Joy-Loaves' for free.
turns.choice_a: Fight through the crowd to confront Thade
turns.consequence_a: The crowd violently defends him. You must incapacitate several civilians before reaching the shop.
turns.choice_b: Sneak in through the flour-chute on the roof
turns.consequence_b: You drop directly into the kitchen, avoiding the mob entirely.

turns.narrative: In the kitchen, Thade is mixing the dough with a glowing blue liquid—distilled Void-Wine.
turns.choice_a: Smash the vats of Void-Wine
turns.consequence_a: The vats shatter, spilling the volatile liquid. The fumes cause you to hallucinate violently during the ensuing fight.
turns.choice_b: Arrest Thade quietly at swordpoint
turns.consequence_b: He surrenders, realizing he is caught. You secure the evidence without a fight.

vats_smashed.description: You destroyed the Void-Wine supply, stopping the production.

thade_arrested.description: You arrested Thade and secured the uncorrupted Void-Wine.

conclusion: You destroyed the Void-Wine supply, stopping the production.

title: Sour Dough
description: Thade confessed his supplier was operating out of the Market Ward's under-cellars. You must shut down the distribution ring tying the Bakery to the Void-Wine cartel.

turns.narrative: The cellars are heavily guarded by cartel thugs. They are loading crates of glowing blue flour.
turns.choice_a: Use fire magic to ignite the flour dust in the air
turns.consequence_a: A massive thermobaric explosion wipes out the guards, but collapses half the cellar.
turns.choice_b: Assassinate them one by one from the shadows
turns.consequence_b: You clear the room surgically. The flour and the ledgers remain intact.

turns.narrative: The 'Dough-Master', a heavily mutated rogue alchemist, emerges from his lab.

turns.consequence_a: He breathes toxic dough-spores at close range. You kill him but take heavy poison damage.
turns.choice_b: Kite him around the cellar using ranged attacks
turns.consequence_b: A slow but safe victory. You pepper him with arrows until he collapses.

cellar_exploded.description: You blew up the cellar, ending the cartel's operation violently.

cellar_intact.description: You cleared the cellar and recovered the cartel's ledgers.

conclusion: You blew up the cellar, ending the cartel's operation violently.
